Function.Name: animcurve_channel_evaluate
Function.Description: This function gets the value at a specific point in time from a channel struct.
Function.Parameter: The struct pointer for the channel to evaluate.
The position in time to check (from 0 to 1).

Function.Name: animcurve_channel_new
Function.Description: This function creates a new animation curve channel struct.

Function.Name: animcurve_create
Function.Description: This function creates an empty animation curve struct, ready for you to populate with channel data.

Function.Name: animcurve_destroy
Function.Description: This function destroys an animation curve previously created with the function animcurve_create().
Function.Parameter: The pointer to the curve struct to destroy.

Function.Name: animcurve_get
Function.Description: This function returns a struct containing all the data for the given animation curve.
Function.Parameter: The asset ID (index) of the animation curve to get.

Function.Name: animcurve_get_channel
Function.Description: This function returns the struct containing the channel data for the channel specified in an animation curve asset or struct (as returned by animcurve_get()).
Function.Parameter: The ID or struct pointer of the animation curve to target
The channel name (a string) or the channel index (an integer)

Function.Name: animcurve_get_channel_index
Function.Description:
This function returns the index value for any given animation curve channel.
Note that if the curve or channel does not exist then you will get an error.
Function.Parameter: The ID or struct pointer of the animation curve to target
The channel name.

Function.Name: animcurve_point_new
Function.Description: This function creates a new points struct (posx, value) to be added to an animation curve channel.

Function.Name: asset_add_tags
Function.Description:
This function adds one or more tag strings to any asset from the Asset Browser.
You supply either the asset name (as a string) or its asset index, as well as either a single tag string or an array where each item is a single tag string.
Function.Parameter: The name of the asset (a string) or its index value (an integer).
A single asset tag string or an array with various asset tags.
OPTIONAL! The type of asset to set the tags on, only used when supplying an index for the first argument.

Function.Name: asset_clear_tags
Function.Description:
This function clears all tags present on the given asset from the Asset Browser and returns whether any tags were removed.
You supply either the asset name (as a string) or its asset index, and if you supply an asset index value, then you will need to supply the optional asset type argument (a constant), as assets of different types can have the same index, even though they cannot have the same name.
Function.Parameter: The name of the asset (a string) or its index value (an integer).
OPTIONAL! The type of asset to clear the tags from, only used when supplying an index for the first argument.

Function.Name: asset_get_index
Function.Description:
This function gets the handle for a game asset from its name.
If the asset is not found, the function will return a value of -1, otherwise it will return the handle for the asset being checked.
Function.Parameter: The name of the game asset to get the index of (a string).

Function.Name: asset_get_tags
Function.Description:
This function retrieves all tags assigned to an asset from the Asset Browser.
You supply either the asset name (as a string) or its asset index, and the function will return an array of tags for that asset.
If no tags are found or there is an error (i.e.: the name string given doesn't exist) then the returned array will be empty.
Function.Parameter: The name of the asset (a string) or its index value (an integer).
OPTIONAL! The type of asset to get the tags for, only used when supplying an index for the first argument.

Function.Name: asset_get_type
Function.Description: This function gets the type of asset being referenced from its name.
Function.Parameter: The name of or a reference to the game asset to get the type of.

Function.Name: asset_get_ids
Function.Description: This function returns an array containing IDs of all existing assets of given type.
Function.Parameter: The type of assets to retrieve an array of.

Function.Name: asset_has_tags
Function.Description:
This function checks if one or more tag strings is assigned to the given asset from the Asset Browser.
You supply either the asset name (as a string) or its asset index, as well as either a single tag string or an array where each item is a single tag string.
Function.Parameter: The name of the asset (a string) or its index value (an integer).
A single asset tag string or an array with various asset tags.
OPTIONAL! The type of asset to check the tags for, only used when supplying an index for the first argument.

Function.Name: asset_remove_tags
Function.Description:
This function removes one or more tag strings to any asset from the Asset Browser.
You supply either the asset name (as a string) or its asset index, as well as either a single tag string or an array where each item is a single tag string.
Function.Parameter: The name of the asset (a string) or its index value (an integer).
A single asset tag string or an array with various asset tags.
OPTIONAL! The type of asset to remove the tags from, only used when supplying an index for the first argument.

Function.Name: tag_get_assets
Function.Description:
This function retrieves the names of all assets that have been assigned the given tag or tags.
You supply either a single tag string or an array, where each item in the array is a tag string.
Function.Parameter: A single asset tag string or an array with various asset tags.

Function.Name: tag_get_asset_ids
Function.Description:
This function gets all the assets of a given type that have the given tags assigned to them.
You supply either a single tag (as a string) or an array, where each item in the array is a tag (as a string), as well as the type of asset to check.
Function.Parameter: A single asset tag string or an array with various asset tags.
An asset type constant (listed above)

Function.Name: audio_channel_num
Function.Description: With this function you can set how many audio channels are available for playing audio in GameMaker.
Function.Parameter: Number of available audio channels (default is 128).

Function.Name: audio_create_stream
Function.Description: With this function you can create a new sound index which can then be used in the regular audio functions to stream audio directly from an external OGG file source.
Function.Parameter: The file (OGG only) to stream the audio from.

Function.Name: audio_debug
Function.Description:
This function can be used to display debug information about the audio system, with true switching it on and false to switch it off.
Enabling this will display the Audio window of The Debug Overlay.
Function.Parameter: Enable (set to true) or disable (false) audio debugging.

Function.Name: audio_throw_on_error
Function.Description: This function can be used to toggle whether errors returned from the audio engine should throw runtime errors which abort the game.
Function.Parameter: Enable or disable throwing.

Function.Name: audio_destroy_stream
Function.Description:
This function destroys a previously created audio stream from memory.
Any further calls to the sound after it has been destroyed will give an error.
Function.Parameter: The sound asset, as returned by audio_create_stream.

Function.Name: audio_exists
Function.Description:
This function returns whether a Sound Asset exists.
The sound to check can either be a single instance of a sound (the index for individual sounds being played can be stored in a variable when using the audio_play_sound or audio_play_sound_at functions) or a sound asset.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound to check the existence of.

Function.Name: audio_falloff_set_model
Function.Description: This function sets the audio falloff model used in your game.
Function.Parameter: The constant used to set the falloff model.

Function.Name: audio_get_master_gain
Function.Description: With this function you can get the absolute value for the global volume of all sounds and music for a specific listener.
Function.Parameter: The index of the listener to get the gain of.

Function.Name: audio_get_name
Function.Description: This function will return the name of a given audio asset as a string.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound to check.

Function.Name: audio_get_type
Function.Description: This function returns the type of the given sound asset, which can be either streamed (1) or in memory (0).
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound to check.

Function.Name: audio_is_paused
Function.Description: This function will check the given sound to see if it is currently paused.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound to check.

Function.Name: audio_is_playing
Function.Description: This function will check the given sound to see if it is currently playing.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound to check.

Function.Name: audio_master_gain
Function.Description: With this function you can set the absolute value for the global volume of all sounds and music.
Function.Parameter: Value for the global volume (0 to 1).

Function.Name: audio_pause_all
Function.Description: With this function you can pause all sounds that are currently playing.

Function.Name: audio_pause_sound
Function.Description: With this function you can pause any sound that is currently playing.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound to pause.

Function.Name: audio_play_sound
Function.Description: This function plays any Sound Asset in your game.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound to play.
Set the channel priority for the sound.
Sets the sound to loop or not.
Sets the gain of the sound played.
Sets the start offset (in seconds) of the sound played.
Sets the pitch of the sound played.
Sets the listener mask of the sound played.

Function.Name: audio_play_sound_at
Function.Description: With this function you can play any sound asset at a given position within the audio space.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound to play.
The x position.
The y position.
The z position.
The falloff reference relative to the listener (clamp).
The maximum falloff distance relative to the listener.
The falloff factor (default 1).
Flags the sound as looping or not.
Set the channel priority for the sound.
Sets the gain of the sound played.
Sets the start offset (in seconds) of the sound played.
Sets the pitch of the sound played.
Sets the listener mask of the sound played.

Function.Name: audio_play_sound_ext
Function.Description: This function plays any sound asset in your game using any combination of parameters.
Function.Parameter: A struct containing a set of playback parameters.

Function.Name: audio_sound_get_asset
Function.Description:
This function returns the Sound Asset that was used to play the given Sound Instance ID.
The sound must be active (i.e. currently playing) for this function to return the correct value, otherwise it will throw a fatal error.
Function.Parameter: The voice index of the sound.

Function.Name: audio_resume_all
Function.Description: With this function you can resume all sounds that have been paused previously.

Function.Name: audio_resume_sound
Function.Description: With this function you can resume any sound that is currently paused (after using the function audio_pause_sound()).
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound to resume.

Function.Name: audio_set_master_gain
Function.Description:
With this function you can set the absolute value for the global volume of all sounds and music for a specific listener.
The default listener index is 0, but you can use the function audio_get_listener_info() to get the different indices available for the target platform.
Function.Parameter: The index of the listener to set the gain on.
Value for the global volume (0 to 1).

Function.Name: audio_sound_gain
Function.Description: With this function you can fade a sound in or out over a given length of time, or it can be used to set the sound gain instantly.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound to set the gain for.
Value for the music volume.
The length for the change in gain in milliseconds.

Function.Name: audio_sound_get_gain
Function.Description: This function will return the current gain value for the given sound.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound to get the gain of.

Function.Name: audio_sound_get_listener_mask
Function.Description: This function will return the bit-mask data that defines which audio listeners a sound should be played from.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the sound to get the mask of

Function.Name: audio_sound_get_pitch
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the pitch of a given sound.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound to get the pitch of.

Function.Name: audio_sound_get_track_position
Function.Description: This function will get the position (in seconds) within the sound file for the sound to play from.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound to get the play position of.

Function.Name: audio_sound_is_playable
Function.Description: This function can be used to check if the given sound index can be played currently.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound to check.

Function.Name: audio_sound_length
Function.Description: This function returns the length of the given sound in seconds.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound to check.

Function.Name: audio_sound_pitch
Function.Description: This function changes the pitch of the given sound asset or instance.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound to change.
The pitch multiplier (default 1).

Function.Name: audio_sound_set_listener_mask
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the the bit-mask for a sound so that it will play only from those listeners specified.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the sound to set the mask of
The bitmask data to set for the sound

Function.Name: audio_sound_set_track_position
Function.Description: This function will set the position (in seconds) for the given sound ID or asset.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound to change.
The time (in seconds) to set the start point to.

Function.Name: audio_sound_loop
Function.Description: This function will set the state of a playing sound's loop section.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound to change.
The state that the loop section should be set to.

Function.Name: audio_sound_get_loop
Function.Description: This function will return the state of a playing sound's loop section.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound whose loop section state is retrieved.

Function.Name: audio_sound_loop_start
Function.Description: This function will set the offset (in seconds) of the start of a sound's loop section.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound to change.
The offset (in seconds) to set the start of the loop section to.

Function.Name: audio_sound_get_loop_start
Function.Description: This function will return the offset (in seconds) of the start of a sound's loop section.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound whose loop-start is retrieved.

Function.Name: audio_sound_loop_end
Function.Description: This function will set the offset (in seconds) of the end of a sound's loop section.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound to change.
The offset (in seconds) to set the end of the loop section to.

Function.Name: audio_sound_get_loop_end
Function.Description: This function will return the offset (in seconds) of the end of a sound's loop section.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound whose loop-end is retrieved.

Function.Name: audio_stop_all
Function.Description: This function will stop all sounds that are currently playing.

Function.Name: audio_stop_sound
Function.Description:
This function will stop the given sound if it is currently playing.
This includes all sounds that have been paused using audio_pause_sound or audio_pause_all.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound to stop.

Function.Name: audio_system_is_available
Function.Description: This function can be used to check and see if the audio system has been initialised, or if the audio context is running.

Function.Name: audio_system_is_initialised
Function.Description: This function can be used to check if the audio engine has been initialised, after which all audio functions can be called normally.

Function.Name: audio_create_buffer_sound
Function.Description: With this function you can create a new sound from the contents of a buffer.
Function.Parameter: The ID of the buffer to use.
The format of the data in the buffer (buffer_u8 or buffer_s16).
The sample rate of the data in the buffer.
The offset into the buffer to read the sample data from (in bytes).
The length of the buffer (the number of bytes of audio data, excluding the header).
The channels to use (audio_mono, audio_stereo or audio_3D).

Function.Name: audio_create_play_queue
Function.Description: This function prepares a buffer queue for audio.
Function.Parameter: The format of the buffer data to use (buffer_u8 or buffer_s16).
The sample rate of the data in the buffer queue.
A constant specifying the channels to use.

Function.Name: audio_free_buffer_sound
Function.Description: With this function you can free up the pointer index value associated with the sound ID.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffered sound to free.

Function.Name: audio_free_play_queue
Function.Description: This function is used to free up the memory associated with the given audio queue.
Function.Parameter: The index of the queue to free.

Function.Name: audio_get_recorder_count
Function.Description: This function will return the number of audio recording sources (like microphones, etc.) currently available to your game.

Function.Name: audio_get_recorder_info
Function.Description: This function will return a DS Map with information about the given recorder source index.
Function.Parameter: The index of the recorder source to get the information from.

Function.Name: audio_queue_sound
Function.Description: This function will add the data from a buffer into the audio queue that you previously created using the function audio_create_play_queue().
Function.Parameter: The index of the queue to add to.
The buffer to add to the queue.
The offset within the source buffer to start from.
The length of the buffer (the number of the bytes in the buffer).

Function.Name: audio_start_recording
Function.Description: This function will start recording audio from the recorder source indexed.
Function.Parameter: The index of the recorder source to use.

Function.Name: audio_stop_recording
Function.Description: This function will stop recording on the given recorder channel (the channel index is returned when you call the function audio_start_recording()).
Function.Parameter: The index of the recorder channel to stop.

Function.Name: audio_emitter_create
Function.Description: This function creates a new audio emitter and returns the index for it.

Function.Name: audio_emitter_exists
Function.Description: This function returns whether an audio emitter exists (true) or not (false).
Function.Parameter: The index of the emitter to check the existence of.

Function.Name: audio_emitter_falloff
Function.Description: With this function you can set the fall-off distance for an emitter.
Function.Parameter: The index of the emitter to change.
The falloff reference relative to the listener (clamp).
The maximum falloff distance relative to the listener.
The falloff factor (default 1).

Function.Name: audio_emitter_free
Function.Description: With this function you can remove the given emitter from memory.
Function.Parameter: The index of the emitter to free.

Function.Name: audio_emitter_gain
Function.Description: This function sets the maximum gain (volume) for the sound.
Function.Parameter: The index of the emitter to change.
The maximum gain (default 1).
The length for the change in gain in milliseconds.

Function.Name: audio_emitter_get_gain
Function.Description: This function returns the current gain (volume) set for the given audio emitter, normally between 0 and 1, where 0 is silent and 1 is full volume.
Function.Parameter: The index of the emitter to use.

Function.Name: audio_emitter_get_listener_mask
Function.Description: This function will return the bit-mask data that defines which audio listeners an emitter should play sounds from.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the emitter to get the mask of

Function.Name: audio_emitter_get_pitch
Function.Description: This function returns the current pitch value set for the given audio emitter.
Function.Parameter: The index of the emitter to use.

Function.Name: audio_emitter_get_vx
Function.Description: This function returns the current velocity along the x axis for the given audio emitter.
Function.Parameter: The index of the emitter to use.

Function.Name: audio_emitter_get_vy
Function.Description: This function returns the current velocity along the y axis for the given audio emitter.
Function.Parameter: The index of the emitter to use.

Function.Name: audio_emitter_get_vz
Function.Description: This function returns the current velocity along the z axis for the given audio emitter.
Function.Parameter: The index of the emitter to use.

Function.Name: audio_emitter_get_x
Function.Description: This function returns the current x position of the given audio emitter.
Function.Parameter: The index of the emitter to use.

Function.Name: audio_emitter_get_y
Function.Description: This function returns the current y position of the given audio emitter.
Function.Parameter: The index of the emitter to use.

Function.Name: audio_emitter_get_z
Function.Description: This function returns the current z position of the given audio emitter.
Function.Parameter: The index of the emitter to use.

Function.Name: audio_emitter_pitch
Function.Description:
This function can be used to change the pitch of all sounds emitted from the given emitter.
It is a pitch multiplier, in that the input value multiplies the current pitch by that amount, so the default value of 1 is no pitch change, while a value of less than 1 will lower the pitch and greater than 1 will raise the pitch.
Function.Parameter: The index of the emitter to change.
The pitch multiplier (default 1).

Function.Name: audio_emitter_position
Function.Description:
With this function you can change the position of an audio emitter within the 3D audio space.
The position will affect the sound in different ways depending on where the listener is positioned within the audio space too (the default position is (0, 0, 0)).
Function.Parameter: The index of the emitter to change.
The x position.
The y position.
The z position.

Function.Name: audio_emitter_set_listener_mask
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the the bit-mask for an emitter so that all sounds played through the emitter will play only from those listeners specified.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the emitter to set the mask of
The bitmask data to set for the sound

Function.Name: audio_emitter_velocity
Function.Description: This function can be used to give an emitter Doppler effects and simulate audio motion based on the vector that is resolved from the given relative x, y and z positions.
Function.Parameter: The index of the emitter to change.
The x vector value (default 0).
The y vector value (default 0).
The z vector value (default 0).

Function.Name: audio_play_sound_on
Function.Description: With this function you can play any sound asset through an emitter, with any changes to the emitter gain, position, pitch or velocity affecting how the user hears the final sound being played.
Function.Parameter: The index of the emitter to use.
The index of the sound to use.
Flags the sound as looping or not.
Set the channel priority for the sound.
Sets the gain of the sound played.
Sets the start offset (in seconds) of the sound played.
Sets the pitch of the sound played.
Sets the listener mask of the sound played.

Function.Name: audio_group_is_loaded
Function.Description: This function will check a specific audio group to see if it has been loaded into memory, ready for use.
Function.Parameter: The index of the audio group to check (as defined in the Audio Groups Window)

Function.Name: audio_group_load
Function.Description: This function will load all the sounds that are flagged as belonging to the given Audio Group into memory.
Function.Parameter: The index of the audio group to load (as defined in the Audio Groups Window)

Function.Name: audio_group_load_progress
Function.Description: This function will check the loading progress for an audio group and return an (approximate) value between 0 and 100.
Function.Parameter: The index of the audio group to check (as defined in the Audio Groups Window)

Function.Name: audio_group_name
Function.Description: This function will return a string containing the name of the given audio group for displaying or checking.
Function.Parameter: The index value constant of the audio group to check (as defined in the Audio Groups Window)

Function.Name: audio_group_set_gain
Function.Description: With this function you can fade a group of sounds in or out over a given length of time, or it can be used to set the group gain instantly. The time is measured in milliseconds, and the function requires that you input a final level of gain for the group to have reached by the end of that time. This gain can be between 0 (silent) and 1 (full volume) and the scale is linear.
Function.Parameter: The index of the audio group to stop (as defined in the Audio Groups Window)
The final value for the group volume.
The length of the change in gain in milliseconds.

Function.Name: audio_group_get_gain
Function.Description: This function will return the group gain of a given audio group.
Function.Parameter: The index of the audio group to check (as defined in the Audio Groups window)

Function.Name: audio_group_stop_all
Function.Description: This function will stop all sounds from the given audio group that are currently playing.
Function.Parameter: The index of the audio group to stop (as defined in the Audio Groups Window)

Function.Name: audio_group_unload
Function.Description:
This function will unload all the sounds that are flagged as belonging to the given Audio Group into memory.
Note that any audio currently being played when this function is called will be stopped.
Function.Parameter: The index of the audio group to unload (as defined in the Audio Groups Window)

Function.Name: audio_group_get_assets
Function.Description: This function will return an array containing the asset index of each audio asset in the given audio group.
Function.Parameter: The index of the audio group whose asset indices should be retrieved.

Function.Name: audio_sound_get_audio_group
Function.Description: This function will return the index of the audio group that is associated with the given sound index.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sound whose audio group should be retrieved.

Function.Name: audio_get_listener_count
Function.Description: Certain target platforms permit more than one listener, so it is important that you know how many the target has before changing or using different listeners. This function will return the number of listeners available.

Function.Name: audio_get_listener_info
Function.Description: This function will create a DS map and populate it with information for the given listener.
Function.Parameter: The listener number to get the data for.

Function.Name: audio_get_listener_mask
Function.Description: This function will return the bit-mask data that defines the current default (global) mask for the audio listeners.

Function.Name: audio_listener_get_data
Function.Description: This function will create a DS map and populate it with the position, velocity and orientation values for the given listener. The default listener index is 0, but you can use the function audio_get_listener_info() to get the different indices available for the target platform. If you provide an incorrect listener index then the function will return -1.
Function.Parameter: The listener to get the data for (default 0).

Function.Name: audio_listener_orientation
Function.Description: With this function you can change the orientation of the listener within the 3D audio space. The look at direction and up direction are based on the vectors that are resolved from the given relative x, y and z positions, and default to (0, 0, 1000) for the look at direction and (0, 1, 0) for the up direction.
Function.Parameter: The x look vector (default 0).
The y look vector (default 0).
The z look vector (default 1000).
The x up vector (default 0).
The y up vector (default 1).
The z up vector (default 0).

Function.Name: audio_listener_position
Function.Description: With this function you can change the position of the listener within the 3D audio space.
Function.Parameter: The x position of the listener (default 0).
The y position of the listener (default 0).
The z position of the listener (default 0).

Function.Name: audio_listener_set_orientation
Function.Description: With this function you can change the orientation of the given listener within the 3D audio space. The default listener index is 0, but you can use the function audio_get_listener_info() to get the different indices available for the target platform.
Function.Parameter: The listener to set the orientation of.
The x look vector (default 0).
The y look vector (default 0).
The z look vector (default -1).
The x up vector (default 0).
The y up vector (default 1).
The z up vector (default 0).

Function.Name: audio_listener_set_position
Function.Description: With this function you can change the position of a given listener within the 3D audio space. The default listener index is 0, but you can use the function audio_get_listener_info() to get the different indices available for the target platform.
Function.Parameter: The listener to get the data for (default 0).
The x position of the listener (default 0).
The y position of the listener (default 0).
The z position of the listener (default 0).

Function.Name: audio_listener_set_velocity
Function.Description: This function can be used to give the given listener Doppler effects and simulate audio motion based on the vector that is resolved from the given relative x, y and z positions. The default listener index is 0, but you can use the function audio_get_listener_info() to get the different indices available for the target platform.
Function.Parameter: The listener to get the data for (default 0).
The x velocity of the listener (default 0).
The y velocity of the listener (default 0).
The z velocity of the listener (default 0).

Function.Name: audio_listener_velocity
Function.Description: This function can be used to give the listener Doppler effects and simulate audio motion based on the vector that is resolved from the given relative x, y and z positions.
Function.Parameter: The x velocity component of the listener (default 0).
The y velocity component of the listener (default 0).
The z velocity component of the listener (default 0).

Function.Name: audio_set_listener_mask
Function.Description: When using multiple listeners on a system, you can set the bit-mask for a sound and have it heard from the flagged listener only.
Function.Parameter: The bit-mask data to set for the listeners

Function.Name: audio_create_sync_group
Function.Description: This function creates a sync group and returns a unique ID value for it which should then be used in all further audio function calls for this group.
Function.Parameter: Whether the tracks in the group should loop (true) or not (false).

Function.Name: audio_destroy_sync_group
Function.Description: Audio sync groups need to be destroyed when not in use to free up the memory and sound resources associated with them using this function.
Function.Parameter: The group index to be destroyed.

Function.Name: audio_pause_sync_group
Function.Description: This function will pause the given sync group if it is playing, with the group index being the value returned when you created the group using the function audio_create_sync_group(). This does not stop the sound, and calling audio_resume_sync_group(), will start it playing from the same position it was paused at again.
Function.Parameter: The group index to pause.

Function.Name: audio_play_in_sync_group
Function.Description: With this function you can assign a sound to a previously created sync group.
Function.Parameter: The group index to assign the sound to.
The sound index to be assigned to the group.

Function.Name: audio_resume_sync_group
Function.Description: This function will resume the given sync group if it is playing and has previously been paused (using the function audio_pause_sync_group). The group index is the value returned when you created the group using the function audio_create_sync_group().
Function.Parameter: The group index to resume.

Function.Name: audio_start_sync_group
Function.Description: With this function you can start playing a previously created sync group. An audio sync group can be created with the function audio_create_sync_group().
Function.Parameter: The group index to play.

Function.Name: audio_stop_sync_group
Function.Description: This function will stop the given sync group if it is playing, with the group index being the value returned when you created the group using the function audio_create_sync_group().
Function.Parameter: The group index to stop playing.

Function.Name: audio_sync_group_debug
Function.Description: This function can be used to display debug information about any given sync group (the group index is the value returned when the group was created using the function audio_create_sync_group()). You can call the function with a value of -1 to switch off the overlay.
Function.Parameter: The group index to debug, or -1 to switch off the debugging.

Function.Name: audio_sync_group_get_track_pos
Function.Description: This function returns the current play position of the given sync group. The group index is the value returned when you created the group using the function audio_create_sync_group(), and the return value is the time in seconds that the tracks have been playing.
Function.Parameter: The group index to get the position of.

Function.Name: audio_sync_group_is_playing
Function.Description: This function can be used to check if any audio in a synchronised group is playing. You are required to supply the sync group ID as returned by the function audio_create_sync_group().
Function.Parameter: The group index to check.

Function.Name: audio_sync_group_is_paused
Function.Description: This function can be used to check if any audio in a synchronised group is paused. You are required to supply the sync group ID as returned by the function audio_create_sync_group().
Function.Parameter: The group index to check.

Function.Name: audio_bus_create
Function.Description: This function creates and returns a new audio bus struct, which can be modified to configure the bus' properties and to add audio effects to it.

Function.Name: audio_effect_create
Function.Description: This function creates and returns a new audio effect struct, which can be modified to configure the effect's properties.
Function.Parameter: The type of audio effect to create.
A struct containing any initial values for the effect's parameters.

Function.Name: audio_emitter_bus
Function.Description: This function links an emitter to an audio bus. Any sounds played on this emitter will be processed by the audio bus.
Function.Parameter: The emitter to link to the audio bus.
The audio bus to link the emitter to.

Function.Name: audio_emitter_get_bus
Function.Description: This function returns the audio bus that an emitter is linked to.
Function.Parameter: The emitter whose audio bus should be returned.

Function.Name: audio_bus_get_emitters
Function.Description: This function returns an array of all of the audio emitters linked to a given audio bus.
Function.Parameter: The audio bus whose emitters should be returned.

Function.Name: audio_bus_clear_emitters
Function.Description: This function relinks all of the emitters linked to the given bus back to the main bus.
Function.Parameter: The audio bus whose emitters should be cleared.

Function.Name: lin_to_db
Function.Description: Converts a linear gain to a gain in decibels (dB).
Function.Parameter: The value to convert.

Function.Name: db_to_lin
Function.Description: Converts a gain in decibels (dB) to a linear gain.
Function.Parameter: The value to convert.

Function.Name: flexpanel_create_node
Function.Description: Creates a Flexpanel node.
Function.Parameter: A struct or JSON string that describes style settings and child nodes to set up this flexpanel.

Function.Name: flexpanel_delete_node
Function.Description: Deletes a Flexpanel node.
Function.Parameter: The node to be deleted.
Whether all child nodes should be deleted (false by default).

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_insert_child
Function.Description: Inserts the node as a child of the passed parent node.
Function.Parameter: The parent node.
The node to be inserted as a child.
The index at which to insert the child.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_remove_child
Function.Description: Removes a child from the passed parent node.
Function.Parameter: The parent node.
The node to be removed as a child.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_remove_all_children
Function.Description:
Removes all the children of the node.
NOTE: Children are not deleted.
Function.Parameter: The parent node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_get_num_children
Function.Description: Returns the number of child nodes of the given node.
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_get_child
Function.Description: Returns the child node of the given node either by index or name, undefined if out of range. If name is used then the search is done recursively through all the child nodes and the first matching node in a depth first traversal is returned.
Function.Parameter: The node.
The index of the child to get or a string of the name the node has been given.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_get_child_hash
Function.Description: Returns the child node of the given node by its name or the hash of its name.
Function.Parameter: The node.
The hash of the child to get or a string of the name the node has been given.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_get_parent
Function.Description: Returns the parent of the given node, undefined if no parent.
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_get_name
Function.Description: Returns the name of the given node, undefined if no name is set.
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_set_name
Function.Description: Sets the name of the node.
Function.Parameter: The node.
The new name to set on the node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_get_data
Function.Description: Returns the data struct of the given node.
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_set_measure_function
Function.Description: Sets the measure function of the node. When a layout is calculated and a measurement is required (there are various reasons why this may or may not happen, i.e. if parents have absolute widths and heights) then the given GML function will be called and it should return a struct with members `width` with the calculated width and/or `height` with the calculated height.
Function.Parameter: The node.

The function to be executed when calculate layout is done. Accepts the following arguments (width, widthType, height, heightType) the widthType and heightType are either 0 (undefined), 1 (exactly) or 2 (at most).

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_get_measure_function
Function.Description: Returns the measure function of the given node. `undefined` means that measure function is not set on this node.
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_get_struct
Function.Description: Returns the layout data of the given node as a struct. This is the same data that can be passed into flexpanel_create_node().
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_calculate_layout
Function.Description: Calculates the layout for the selected node and its children.
Function.Parameter: The node to start the layout calculations from.
The width of the area to calculate the layout over.
The height of the area to calculate the layout over.
The direction the layout calculation should follow.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_layout_get_position
Function.Description: Returns the calculated node layout position as a struct: {left, top, width, height, bottom, right, hadOverflow, direction, paddingLeft, paddingRight, paddingTop, paddingBottom, marginLeft, marginRight, marginToip, marginBottom}.
Function.Parameter: The node to be queried.
if true then returned coords in struct are relative to parent, otherwise they are absolute (and include parents position), default is true (so relative coords are returned)

Function.Name: flexpanel_set_rounding_scale
Function.Description: Sets the scale factor used when rounding layout values. A value of 0 disables rounding.
Function.Parameter: Rounding scale factor. Default is 1.

Function.Name: flexpanel_get_rounding_scale
Function.Description: Gets the current scale factor used when rounding layout values.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_align_content
Function.Description: Sets the alignment of the content of the node.
Function.Parameter: The node to be set.
The selected alignment.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_align_items
Function.Description: Sets the alignment of the items of the node.
Function.Parameter: The node to be set.
The selected alignment.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_align_self
Function.Description: Sets the alignment of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node to be set.
The selected alignment.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_aspect_ratio
Function.Description: Sets the node's aspect ratio
Function.Parameter: The node to set.
The value

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_display
Function.Description: Sets the display setting of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node to be set.
The selected display.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_flex
Function.Description: Sets the flex value of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node to be set
The flex value for this

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_flex_wrap
Function.Description: Sets the flex wrap of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node to be set.
The selected wrap.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_flex_grow
Function.Description: Sets the flex grow of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node to be set.
The selected grow factor

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_flex_shrink
Function.Description: Sets the flex shrink of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node to be set.
The selected shrink factor

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_flex_basis
Function.Description: Sets the flex basis of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node to be set.
The selected flex basis value
The units to be used

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_flex_direction
Function.Description: Sets the flex direction of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node to be set.
The selected direction.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_gap
Function.Description: Sets the gap of the selected node for the selected gutters.
Function.Parameter: The node to be set.
The selected gutter (column/row/all).
The selected gap size

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_position
Function.Description: Sets an inset position on the node.
Function.Parameter: The node to be set.
The selected edge.
The value
The units to be used

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_justify_content
Function.Description: Sets the node's contents justification
Function.Parameter: The node to be set.
The justification to use

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_direction
Function.Description: Sets the layout direction of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node to be set.
The selected direction.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_margin
Function.Description: Sets the margin of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node to be set.
The selected edge.
The selected padding size
The units to be used

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_padding
Function.Description: Sets the padding of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node to be set.
The selected edge.
The selected padding size
The units to be used

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_border
Function.Description: Sets the border of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node to be set.
The selected edge.
The selected border size

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_position_type
Function.Description: Sets the node's position type.
Function.Parameter: The node to be set.
The position type to use

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_min_width
Function.Description: Sets the node's minimum width
Function.Parameter: The node whose behaviour should be set.
The value to use
The units to use for the value

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_max_width
Function.Description: Sets the node's maximum width
Function.Parameter: The node whose behaviour should be set.
The value to use
The units to use for the value

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_min_height
Function.Description: Sets the node's minimum height
Function.Parameter: The node whose behaviour should be set.
The value to use
The units to use for the value

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_max_height
Function.Description: Sets the node's maximum height
Function.Parameter: The node whose behaviour should be set.
The value to use
The units to use for the value

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_width
Function.Description: Sets the width of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node whose width should be set.
The selected width.
The units to use for the value

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_set_height
Function.Description: Sets the height of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node whose height should be set.
The selected height.
The units to use for the value

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_align_content
Function.Description: Gets the alignment of the content of the node.
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_align_items
Function.Description: Gets the alignment of the items of the node.
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_align_self
Function.Description: Gets the alignment of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_aspect_ratio
Function.Description: Gets the node's aspect ratio
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_display
Function.Description: Gets the display setting of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_flex
Function.Description: Gets the flex value of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_flex_wrap
Function.Description: Gets the flex wrap of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_flex_grow
Function.Description: Gets the flex grow of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_flex_shrink
Function.Description: Gets the flex shrink of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_flex_basis
Function.Description: Gets the flex basis of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_flex_direction
Function.Description: Gets the flex direction of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_gap
Function.Description: Gets the gap of the selected node on the selected side.
Function.Parameter: The node to be set.
The selected gutter (column/row/all).

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_position
Function.Description: Gets the node's style position.
Function.Parameter: The node.
The selected edge.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_justify_content
Function.Description: Gets the node's contents justification
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_direction
Function.Description: Gets the direction of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_margin
Function.Description: Gets the margin of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node.
The selected edge.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_padding
Function.Description: Gets the padding of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node.
The selected edge.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_border
Function.Description: Gets the border of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node.
The selected edge.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_position_type
Function.Description: Gets the nodes position type
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_min_width
Function.Description: Gets the node's minimum width
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_max_width
Function.Description: Gets the node's maximum width
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_min_height
Function.Description: Gets the node's minimum height
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_max_height
Function.Description: Gets the node's maximum height
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_width
Function.Description: Gets the width of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: flexpanel_node_style_get_height
Function.Description: Gets the height of the selected node.
Function.Parameter: The node.

Function.Name: font_add
Function.Description: This function can be used to add a font to your game from a font file present in the Included Files. -1 is returned if the function fails for any reason.
Function.Parameter: The path of the font file in the Included Files (*.ttf or *.otf).
The size of the font - points for Web Fonts, pixels for file fonts.
Whether the font is bold (true) or not (false).
Whether the font is italic (true) or not (false).
The first character to include (if you're unsure, go for 32).
The last character to include (if you're unsure, go for 128).

Function.Name: font_add_enable_aa
Function.Description: This function can be used to enable or disable anti-aliasing (AA) for fonts added using font_add(). This function needs to be called before you add any fonts.
Function.Parameter: Whether to enable (true) or disable (false) AA for added fonts.

Function.Name: font_add_get_enable_aa
Function.Description:
This function can be used to check whether anti-aliasing (AA) is enabled for fonts added using font_add().
Note that AA is enabled by default, but you can change the AA state for added fonts using the function font_add_enable_aa(), as long as it is called before adding the font.

Function.Name: font_add_sprite
Function.Description: With this function you can use a "sprite strip" to create a new font asset, where each sub-image would be an individual symbol or letter.
Function.Parameter: The sprite to add a font based on.
The index of the first available character.
Set as proportional font or not.
The space to leave between each letter.

Function.Name: font_add_sprite_ext
Function.Description: With this function you can use a "sprite strip" to create a new font asset, where each sub-image would be an individual symbol or letter.
Function.Parameter: The sprite to add a font based on.
String from which sprite sub-image order is taken.
Set as proportional font or not.
The space to leave between each letter.

Function.Name: font_delete
Function.Description: With this function you can delete a font asset from the game.
Function.Parameter: The index of the font to delete.

Function.Name: font_enable_sdf
Function.Description: With this function you can enable or disable SDF rendering for the specified font. This only works on fonts added using font_add().
Function.Parameter: The index of the font.
Whether to enable (true) or disable (false) SDF rendering for the specified font.

Function.Name: font_get_sdf_enabled
Function.Description: With this function you can determine whether SDF rendering is enabled or disabled for the specified font
Function.Parameter: The index of the font.

Function.Name: font_sdf_spread
Function.Description: With this function you can set the SDF spread value for the specified font. This only works on fonts added using font_add(), and its effect is only visible if the font is using SDF rendering.
Function.Parameter: The index of the font.
The SDF spread value to set for the specified font.

Function.Name: font_get_sdf_spread
Function.Description: With this function you can query the SDF spread value for the specified font
Function.Parameter: The index of the font.

Function.Name: font_enable_effects
Function.Description: With this function you can enable or disable built-in effects rendering for the specified font. Built-in effects will only have an effect with SDF-enabled fonts.
Function.Parameter: The index of the font.
Whether to enable (true) or disable (false) effects rendering for the specified font.
A struct containing any initial values for the font's effect parameters.

Function.Name: font_exists
Function.Description: This function returns whether a font with the specified index exists or not. You can check font indices as defined from the Asset Browser, or fonts that have been added using functions like font_add().
Function.Parameter: Index of the font to check.

Function.Name: font_get_bold
Function.Description: With this function you can check any font asset to see if it has the bold flag or not.
Function.Parameter: Index of the font to check.

Function.Name: font_get_fontname
Function.Description: With this function you can get the actual system name of the selected font asset. This function returns a string and not an index, and the name returned will depend on the font being used.
Function.Parameter: Index of the font to check.

Function.Name: font_get_info
Function.Description: This function is used to retrieve information for the given font.
Function.Parameter: The font for which information should be retrieved.

Function.Name: font_get_italic
Function.Description: With this function you can check any font asset to see if it has the italic flag or not.
Function.Parameter: Index of the font to check.

Function.Name: font_get_last
Function.Description: This function can be used to find the last character (as an UTF-8 value) that was used when your font asset was added to your game.
Function.Parameter: Index of the font to check.

Function.Name: font_get_name
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the name (as a string) that was given to the font when it was added as an asset to the GameMaker Asset Browser.
Function.Parameter: Index of the font to check.

Function.Name: font_get_size
Function.Description: With this function you can get the size of any font asset, which is the point value shown by the font asset dialogue.
Function.Parameter: Index of the font to get the size of.

Function.Name: font_get_texture
Function.Description: This function returns a special pointer for the font texture page.
Function.Parameter: The index of the font to use.

Function.Name: font_get_uvs
Function.Description:
This function returns an array with the UV coordinates for the font texture on the texture page, filling in the array with the following values:
[0] = left
[1] = top
[2] = right
[3] = bottom
Function.Parameter: The index of the font to use.

Function.Name: font_replace_sprite
Function.Description: With this function you can use a "sprite strip" to replace a previously created sprite font asset, where each sub-image would be an individual symbol or letter.
Function.Parameter: The index of the font that shall be replaced (i.e. all references to this asset past this function will refer to the new font, not the original).
The sprite to add a font based on.
The index of the first available character.
Whether white space around each letter should be removed (if false, the created font will be monospaced, otherwise it'll be like most regular fonts).
The space between each letter, 0 meaning the right of one letter just touches the left of the next one.

Function.Name: font_replace_sprite_ext
Function.Description: This function will replace a sprite font that you created previously using the function font_add_sprite_ext(). It uses a "sprite strip", where each sub-image is an individual symbol or letter, and the images are mapped to letters based on the argument "string_map" of the function.
Function.Parameter: The font to replace.
The sprite to add a font based on.
String from which sprite sub-image order is taken.
Set as proportional font or not.
The space to leave between each letter.

Function.Name: font_set_cache_size
Function.Description: This function sets how many blended copies of the given font can be cached before old ones are overwritten.
Function.Parameter: The index of the font to change the cache size of.
The maximum number of cached copies of the font that can be stored.

Function.Name: alarm_get
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the current value of the given alarm. This is an alternative method to getting the alarm array value directly.
Function.Parameter: The alarm index to get, from 0 to 11.

Function.Name: alarm_set
Function.Description: This function can be used to set an alarm. This is an alternative method to setting the alarm array directly.
Function.Parameter: The alarm index to set, from 0 to 11.
The value (an integer) to set the alarm to.

Function.Name: instance_change
Function.Description: You can use this function to change one instance of an object into another instance of a different object, and while doing so decide whether to perform the initial instance's Destroy and Clean Up Events and the new instance's Create Event.
Function.Parameter: The new object the calling object will change into.
Whether to perform that new object's create and destroy events (true) or not (false).

Function.Name: instance_copy
Function.Description: With this function you can "clone" an instance as this will create a new version of the instance running the code at its same position.
Function.Parameter: Whether to perform the new instance's Create event (true) or not (false).

Function.Name: instance_create_depth
Function.Description: With this function you can create a new instance of the specified object at any given point within the room and at the depth specified.
Function.Parameter: The x position the object will be created at
The y position the object will be created at
The depth to assign the created instance to
The object index of the object to create an instance of
A structure that contains variables that are copied into the new instance before the Create Event is called

Function.Name: instance_create_layer
Function.Description: With this function you can create a new instance of the specified object at any given point within the room and on the layer specified. The layer can be identified using the layer ID value (as returned by the function layer_create()) or by the name of the layer (as a string, for example "instance_layer") as defined in the Room Editor.
Function.Parameter: The x position the object will be created at
The y position the object will be created at
The layer ID (or name) to assign the created instance to
The object index of the object to create an instance of
A structure that contains variables that are copied into the new instance before the Create Event is called

Function.Name: instance_destroy
Function.Description: You call this function whenever you wish to destroy an instance, normally triggering a Destroy Event and also a Clean Up Event.
Function.Parameter: The instance ID or object_index to destroy (optional, default is the calling instance)
Set to true or false to perform the destroy event or not (optional, default is true)

Function.Name: instance_exists
Function.Description: This function checks if any instance of the given Object handle exists in the room, or whether the given specific Instance handle exists in the room.
Function.Parameter: The object or instance to check for the existence of.

Function.Name: instance_find
Function.Description: All instances have a unique identifier (id) which can be used to modify and manipulate them while a game is running, but you may not always know what the id for a specific instance is and so this function can help as you can use it to iterate through all of them to find what you need.
Function.Parameter: The object to find the nth instance of
The number of the instance to find.

Function.Name: instance_furthest
Function.Description: This function will check all the instances of the given object to see which is furthest from the given x/y point.
Function.Parameter: The x position to check.
The y position to check.
The object to check for instances of.

Function.Name: instance_id_get
Function.Description: With this function you can get the unique ID value of any instance from the currently active instance list.
Function.Parameter: The index within the instance list from 0 - (instance count - 1).

Function.Name: instance_nearest
Function.Description: This function will check all the instances of the given object to see which is nearest to the given x/y point.
Function.Parameter: The x position to check.
The y position to check.
The object to check for instances of.

Function.Name: instance_number
Function.Description: With this function you can find out how many active instances of the specified object exists in the room.
Function.Parameter: The object to total the number of instances of.

Function.Name: instance_place
Function.Description: With this function you can check a position for a collision with another instance or all instances of an object using the collision mask of the instance that runs the code for the check.
Function.Parameter: The x position to check for instances.
The y position to check for instances.
The object to check for instances of.

Function.Name: instance_place_list
Function.Description: With this function you can check a position for a collision with all instances of an object using the collision mask of the instance that runs the code for the check.
Function.Parameter: The x position to check for instances.
The y position to check for instances.
The object to check for instances of.
The DS list to use to store the IDs of colliding instances.
Whether the list should be ordered by distance (true) or not (false).

Function.Name: instance_position
Function.Description: With this function you can check a position for a collision with another instance or all instances of an object.
Function.Parameter: The x position to check for instances.
The y position to check for instances.
The object to check for instances of.

Function.Name: instance_position_list
Function.Description: With this function you can check a position for a collision with all instances of another object.
Function.Parameter: The x position to check for instances.
The y position to check for instances.
The object to check for instances of.
The DS list to use to store the IDs of colliding instances.
Whether the list should be ordered by distance (true) or not (false).

Function.Name: instance_activate_all
Function.Description: With this function you can tell GameMaker to activate all instances that have been previously deactivated in a room. Note that activation is not instantaneous, and an instance that has been activated in this way will not be considered to be active until the end of the event in which the function was called.
Function.Parameter: The collision space in which to consider instances, defaults to the collision space the calling instance is in.

Function.Name: instance_activate_layer
Function.Description: With this function you can activate a layer that has been deactivated previously. Note that activation is not instantaneous, and an instance that has been activated in this way will not be considered to be active until the end of the event in which the function was called.
Function.Parameter: The layer ID string (or value) to be used

Function.Name: instance_activate_object
Function.Description: With this function you can activate a single instance or all instances of a specific object from all those that have been deactivated previously. Note that if you have deactivated an instance or object that has been flagged as Persistent, then you will need to reactivate it again with this function before changing room, otherwise it will not be carried over and will be discarded instead. Note too that activation is not instantaneous, and an instance that has been activated in this way will not be considered to be active until the end of the event in which the function was called.
Function.Parameter: The object or instance to activate (the keyword all can also be used).
The collision space in which to consider instances, defaults to the collision space the calling instance is in.

Function.Name: instance_activate_region
Function.Description: With this function you can define a region within the room to activate instances that have previously been deactivated. The region can either be flagged as "inside" or "outside".
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the left of the rectangular region to activate.
The y coordinate of the top of the rectangular region to activate.
The width of the region to activate.
The height of the region to activate.
Whether to activate instances on the inside of the region (true) or the outside (false).
The collision space in which to consider instances, defaults to the collision space the calling instance is in.

Function.Name: instance_deactivate_all
Function.Description: This function will deactivate all instances that are in the room at the moment that the code is run. Note that deactivation is not instantaneous, and an instance that has been deactivated in this way will not be considered to be inactive until the end of the event in which the function was called.
Function.Parameter: Whether to keep the calling instance activated (true) or not (false).
The collision space in which to consider instances, defaults to the collision space the calling instance is in.

Function.Name: instance_deactivate_layer
Function.Description: With this function you can deactivate all instances assigned to a specific layer. Note that deactivation is not instantaneous, and an instance that has been deactivated in this way will not be considered to be inactive until the end of the event in which the function was called.
Function.Parameter: The layer ID string (or value) to be used

Function.Name: instance_deactivate_object
Function.Description: With this function you can deactivate a single instance or all instances of a specific object from all those that have been activated previously. Note that deactivation is not instantaneous, and an instance that has been deactivated in this way will not be considered to be inactive until the end of the event in which the function was called.
Function.Parameter: The object or instance to deactivate (the keyword all can also be used).
The collision space in which to consider instances, defaults to the collision space the calling instance is in.

Function.Name: instance_deactivate_region
Function.Description: With this function you can define a region within the room to deactivate instances that have previously been activated. The region can either be flagged as "inside" or "outside".
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the left of the rectangular region to deactivate.
The y coordinate of the top of the rectangular region to deactivate.
The width of the region to deactivate.
The height of the region to deactivate.
Whether to deactivate instances on the inside of the region (true) or the outside (false).
Whether to exclude the calling instance from deactivation (true) or not (false).
The collision space in which to consider instances, defaults to the collision space the calling instance is in.

Function.Name: object_exists
Function.Description: This function returns whether an object with the specified index exists or not.
Function.Parameter: The index of the object to check.

Function.Name: object_get_mask
Function.Description: This function will tell you whether the object you are checking has a mask index or not, and if it does then it will return the index of that mask, or -1 if it does not.
Function.Parameter: The index of the object to check

Function.Name: object_get_name
Function.Description: This function will return the name as a string of the specified object.
Function.Parameter: The index of the object to check.

Function.Name: object_get_parent
Function.Description: This function will get you the object_index of any parent that has been assigned to the specified object, or else return -100 to show that the object has no parent assigned to it, or -1 if the object being checked does not exist.
Function.Parameter: The index of the object to check

Function.Name: object_get_persistent
Function.Description: This function will tell you whether the object you are checking has been flagged as "persistent" or not. A persistent object is one that will cause any instances of it to be carried through from room to room unless they are explicitly destroyed.
Function.Parameter: The index of the object to check.

Function.Name: object_get_physics
Function.Description: This function will tell you whether the object you are checking has been flagged as "physics-enabled".
Function.Parameter: The index of the object to check.

Function.Name: object_get_solid
Function.Description: This function will tell you whether the object you are checking has been flagged as "solid" or not. A solid object generates a special collision event when using the traditional collision system (i.e.: the physics world is off).
Function.Parameter: The index of the object to check.

Function.Name: object_get_sprite
Function.Description: This function will tell you whether the object you are checking has a sprite or not, and if it does then it will return the index of that sprite, or -1 if it does not.
Function.Parameter: The index of the object to check

Function.Name: object_get_visible
Function.Description: This function will tell you whether the object you are checking has been flagged as "visible" (runs its draw event) or not (does not run its draw event).
Function.Parameter: The index of the object to check.

Function.Name: object_is_ancestor
Function.Description: This function can be used to check an object and see if it is an ancestor or not of another object.
Function.Parameter: The object that is being checked as the child.
The object that is being checked as the ancestor (parent).

Function.Name: object_set_mask
Function.Description: With this function you can set the mask_index of a specific object. You can set this to -1 to remove a mask sprite and so default to the mask defined for the sprite of the object (or no masks if no sprite has been chosen).
Function.Parameter: The index of the object to change.
The new sprite to use as the object's mask.

Function.Name: object_set_persistent
Function.Description: With this function you can set the persistence of a specific object. A persistent object is "carried over" from room to room and maintains its properties at all times.
Function.Parameter: The index of the object to change.
Whether the object should be flagged as persistent (true) or not (false).

Function.Name: object_set_solid
Function.Description: With this function you can flag a specific object as being solid or not. This means that all instances of this object that are created after solid has been changed will be created with this new state, while instances that are already in the room may not be affected.
Function.Parameter: The index of the object to change.
The new solidity of the object (true=solid, false=not solid).

Function.Name: object_set_sprite
Function.Description: With this function you can set the sprite index of a specific object. This means that all instances of this object that are created after the sprite_index has been changed will be created with this new sprite_index, while instances that are already in the room may not be affected.
Function.Parameter: The index of the object to change.
The sprite to assign to the object.

Function.Name: object_set_visible
Function.Description: With this function you can flag a specific object as being visible or not. This means that all instances of this object that are created after visible has been changed will be created with this new state, while instances that are already in the room may not be affected.
Function.Parameter: The index of the object to change.
The new visibility of the object (true=visible, false=invisible).

Function.Name: event_inherited
Function.Description: This function will call the current event of the parent object of the instance.

Function.Name: event_perform
Function.Description: This function will perform the specified event, with the designated argument, for the instance running the code.
Function.Parameter: The type of event to perform.
The specific event constant or value, if one is necessary (otherwise, just use 0).

Function.Name: event_perform_async
Function.Description: This function is used to perform any one of the Asynchronous Events provided in GameMaker.
Function.Parameter: The type of event to perform.
The DS map to use as async_load in the called event.

Function.Name: event_perform_object
Function.Description: This function works the same as event_perform() except that this time you can specify events from another object.
Function.Parameter: The object that should have its event triggered.
The type of event to perform.
The specific event, if one is necessary (otherwise, just use 0).

Function.Name: event_user
Function.Description: With this function you tell the instance to run the actions or code that has been placed within one of the 16 user-defined events. These events can only be called in this way, or using the event_perform function.
Function.Parameter: The number of event to call, between 0 and 15.

Function.Name: path_end
Function.Description: This function ends the current path that the instance is following, as set when the function path_start was called.

Function.Name: path_get_closed
Function.Description: This function can be used to return whether the path is flagged as closed (true) or open (false), i.e. whether the path loops or if it has a definitive beginning and end.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to check.

Function.Name: path_get_kind
Function.Description: This function can be used to find out whether the given path is smooth (true) or not (false).
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to check.

Function.Name: path_get_length
Function.Description: You can use this function to get the exact length of a path in pixels. this is not an approximate length from point to point, but rather an exact length along the shape of the path, even when the path is smooth with a high curved precision.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to measure.

Function.Name: path_get_name
Function.Description: This function will return the name of the path that is referenced as a string.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to check.

Function.Name: path_get_number
Function.Description: This function can be used to return the number of points on a path.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to check.

Function.Name: path_get_point_speed
Function.Description: With this function you can get the speed of the point (as defined in the Path Editor or when you dynamically add a path point using path_add_point()) expressed as a percentage.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to check.
The point identity to check.

Function.Name: path_get_point_x
Function.Description: This function will return the x position (in room coordinates) of the point that you input for the path that you index. If the point is outside of the range of the path (i.e.: a path has 8 points and you ask for the x position of point 10) then a value of 0 will be returned.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to check.
The point identity to check.

Function.Name: path_get_point_y
Function.Description: This function will return the y position (in room coordinates) of the point that you input for the path that you index. If the point is outside of the range of the path (i.e.: a path has 8 points and you ask for the y position of point 10) then a value of 0 will be returned.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to check.
The point identity to check.

Function.Name: path_get_precision
Function.Description: This function returns precision with which the given path has been "smoothed", and will be an integer value from 1 to 8. Although you can get (and set) this value for a straight-line path it will have no influence over how an instance uses the path as it is only relevant when the path kind is set to "smooth".
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to check.

Function.Name: path_get_speed
Function.Description: This function returns the speed factor of any given position on a path. The position should be a value between 0 and 1 (you can use path_position if you need the current position of the instance).
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to check.
How far through the path to check. Between 0 (start) and 1 (end), can be decimal.

Function.Name: path_get_x
Function.Description: With this function you can get the x coordinate of a position on any given path.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to check.
How far through the path to check. Between 0 (start) and 1 (end).

Function.Name: path_get_y
Function.Description: With this function you can get the y coordinate of a position on any given path.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to check.
How far through the path to check. Between 0 (start) and 1 (end).

Function.Name: path_start
Function.Description: This function tells the calling instance to start the given path. The path started by the instance is stored in the variable path_index.
Function.Parameter: The path index to start.
The speed of which to follow the path in pixels per step, negative meaning going backwards.
What to do when the end of the path is reached.
Whether the calling instance should follow the absolute path as it is in the editor (true) or a relative path to its current position (false).

Function.Name: path_add
Function.Description: With this function you can create a path in GameMaker without using the path editor.

Function.Name: path_add_point
Function.Description: With this function you can add a point to the specified path and set its speed factor.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to add the point to.
The x coordinate of the new point.
The y coordinate of the new point.
The speed factor of the point (default value is 100).

Function.Name: path_append
Function.Description: With this function you can append one path onto another one, effectively joining them together.
Function.Parameter: The new index of the path.
The index of the path that will be appended to "index".

Function.Name: path_assign
Function.Description: With this function you can copy the path data from one path to another. The path being copied to will be cleared first (should it have any path points) and be completely overwritten by the path being copied from.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to be overwritten.
