The index of the path that will overwrite "index".

Function.Name: path_change_point
Function.Description: With this function you can change the position and/or the speed factor of any point previously defined for a path).
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to change a point of.
The defining point to change the attributes of.
The new x coordinate (relative to the path) of the point.
The new y coordinate (relative to the path) of the point.
The new speed factor of the point.

Function.Name: path_clear_points
Function.Description: With this function you can remove all point definitions from a path, effectively making an "empty" path.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to clear.

Function.Name: path_delete
Function.Description: You can use this code to remove a path from memory.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to delete.

Function.Name: path_delete_point
Function.Description: With this function you can remove a point from the specified path.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to delete a point from.
The defining point to delete.

Function.Name: path_duplicate
Function.Description: This function takes a path and copies it into a new path.
Function.Parameter: The index of the existing path to duplicate.

Function.Name: path_exists
Function.Description: This function returns whether a path with the given index exists or not.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to check for.

Function.Name: path_flip
Function.Description: This function takes all the path points and flips them along the horizontal axis, changing the actual path asset.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to flip.

Function.Name: path_insert_point
Function.Description: With this function you can insert a new point into a path. The point will be added into the path before the point "n" that is specified in the function.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to insert the point into.
The defining point to insert the new point BEFORE.
The x coordinate (relative to the path) of the new point.
The y coordinate (relative to the path) of the new point.
The speed factor of the point.

Function.Name: path_mirror
Function.Description: This function takes all the path points and mirrors them along the vertical axis, changing the actual path asset.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to mirror.

Function.Name: path_rescale
Function.Description: This function can be used to re-scale the given path along both (or either) the vertical and horizontal axis, basically moving each of the path points to a new position corresponding to this scale around the centre of the path.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to scale.
What to multiply the current horizontal scale by. Default scale is 1.
What to multiply the current vertical scale by. Default scale is 1.

Function.Name: path_reverse
Function.Description: With this function you can reverse the order in which the individual path points are numbered, so, for example, if the path has 5 points, point 0 would become point 4, point 1 would be point 3 and point 2 would not be changed. The actual position of the points remains the same, only the order in which they are processed is changed.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to change.

Function.Name: path_rotate
Function.Description: You can use this function to rotate a given path around its center.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to flip.
The angle of rotation degrees.

Function.Name: path_set_closed
Function.Description: This function can be used to flag a given path as being open (false) or closed (true). A closed path has its start point connected to its end point, forming a loop, and an open path has a definitive, unconnected start and finish.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to change.
Whether the path is closed (true) or not (false).

Function.Name: path_set_kind
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the kind of path that you wish the specified asset to be. This can be either a straight line path (set to 0) or a smoothed path (set to 1) which takes into account the path precision.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to change.
The kind of the path, 0 for straight or 1 for smooth.

Function.Name: path_set_precision
Function.Description: With this function you can change the "smoothness" of a path. This value must be between 1 and 8, with a low value creating straighter edges with sharper curves between points, while a higher value will round the points and make the path a lot more "curvy".
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to change.
The precision of the path. Must be an integer between 1 and 8.

Function.Name: path_shift
Function.Description: With this function you can shift a path along the horizontal and vertical axis.
Function.Parameter: The index of the path to change.
The number of horizontal pixels to shift the path. Negative=left, positive=right.
The number of vertical pixels to shift the path. Negative=up, positive=down.

Function.Name: room_add
Function.Description: This function will create a new, empty, room and add it to your game, returning its index to be stored in a variable for all further codes that deal with this room. Note that each room is permanently added to the game until the executable is closed, i.e.: rooms added through code cannot be deleted again.

Function.Name: room_assign
Function.Description: This function copies one room to another, removing all instances, tiles, etc., from the room that is being copied to and replaces them completely with the new room's contents.
Function.Parameter: The index of the room to be copied to.
The index of the room to be copied from.

Function.Name: room_duplicate
Function.Description: This will duplicate a given room and return the duplicate's index to be used in all further calls to reference the new room.
Function.Parameter: The index of the original room to be duplicated.

Function.Name: room_exists
Function.Description: With this function you can check and see whether the room you specify exists or not.
Function.Parameter: The index of the room to check.

Function.Name: room_get_camera
Function.Description: With this function you can get the unique index ID of the camera assigned to a specific view in a room other than the current one.
Function.Parameter: The index of the room to get the view camera of
The index of the viewport to get the camera of

Function.Name: room_get_name
Function.Description: This function can be used to return the name of the specified room as a string.
Function.Parameter: The index of the room to check the name of.

Function.Name: room_get_info
Function.Description:
This function can be used to get all the information on a room. It returns a struct that contains data that has been requested, a room can be very large so this can take a long time to complete, and optionally some data can be omitted to speed it up.
NOTE: Tilemap data is an array of all the tilemap indices stored as a one dimensional array of width * height, where an x, y entry is indexed as (y*width)+x
Function.Parameter: The index of the room.
Add room view information to the struct (defaults to true)
Add instance information to the struct (defaults to true)
Add room layer information to the struct (defaults to true)
Add layer element information to the struct (defaults to true), NOTE: you must have layers enabled to get any layer_elements
Add tilemap data information to the struct (defaults to true), NOTE: you must have layers and layer_elements enabled to get any tilemap_data (if present)
if you request the current room then if this is true (default is false) it will report the live data for the current room, otherwise it is the data from the WAD

Function.Name: room_get_viewport
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the details of a viewport in a room other than the current one.
Function.Parameter: The index of the room to get viewport data from
The index of the viewport to get

Function.Name: room_goto
Function.Description: This function permits you to go to any room in your game project, whether created using code or in the Asset Browser. This function will also trigger the Room End event.
Function.Parameter: The index of the room to go to.

Function.Name: room_goto_next
Function.Description: With this function you can make your game go to the next room as listed in the Room Manager at the time the game was compiled. If this room does not exist, an error will be thrown and the game will be forced to close.

Function.Name: room_goto_previous
Function.Description: With this function you can make your game go to the previous room as listed in the Room Manager at the time the game was compiled. If this room does not exist, an error will be thrown and the game will be forced to close. This function will also trigger the Room End event.

Function.Name: room_instance_add
Function.Description: With this function you can add an instance to any room other than the current one and at any position within that room.
Function.Parameter: The index of the room to add an object instance to.
The x position of the new instance.
The y position of the new instance.
The object to add an instance of.

Function.Name: room_instance_clear
Function.Description:
This function will clear a room of all instances (no destroy events shall be called for the instances that are being removed).
Note that calling this function on a room asset created in the Asset Browser will permanently clear the room of instances, and even calling game_restart() will not return the room to its original state (only ending the game and opening it again will start with the room in its original state again).
Function.Parameter: The index of the room to clear all instances in.

Function.Name: room_next
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the index of the room after the room input into the function.
Function.Parameter: The index of the room to get the next one after.

Function.Name: room_previous
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the index of the room before the room input into the function.
Function.Parameter: The index of the room to get the one before from.

Function.Name: room_restart
Function.Description: This function will restart the current room, as if it had just been entered. Note that the room will not restart until the end of the event where the function was called, so any code after this has been called will still run if in the same event. This function will also trigger the Room End event.

Function.Name: room_set_camera
Function.Description: With this function you can assign a camera to a specific viewport in a room other than the current one.
Function.Parameter: The index of the room to set the view camera of
The index of the viewport to assign the camera to
The index of the camera to assign

Function.Name: room_set_height
Function.Description: With this function you can change (or set) the height of any room in your game except the current one.
Function.Parameter: The index of the room to set the height of.
The new height of the room in pixels.

Function.Name: room_set_persistent
Function.Description: With this function you can change (or set) the persistence of any room in your game except the current one. A persistent room will maintain the state of all instances within that room if the player leaves and then returns, a non-persistent room will be reset to the initial state every time.
Function.Parameter: The index of the room to set the persistence of.
Whether the room shall be persistent (true) or not (false).

Function.Name: room_set_viewport
Function.Description: With this function you can set the viewport properties for any room in your game except the current one.
Function.Parameter: The index of the room to set
The index of the viewport to set
The visibility of the viewport (true is visible, false is invisible)
The x position for the viewport in the room
The y position of the viewport in the room
The width (in pixels) of the viewport
The height (in pixels) of the viewport

Function.Name: room_set_view_enabled
Function.Description: With this function you can enable (true) or disable (false) the view of any room within your game except the current one.
Function.Parameter: The index of the room to set.
Whether to enable (true) or disable (false) views in the given room.

Function.Name: room_set_width
Function.Description: With this function you can change (or set) the width of any room in your game except the current one.
Function.Parameter: The index of the room to set the width of.
The new width of the room in pixels.

Function.Name: layer_background_alpha
Function.Description: This function controls the alpha (transparency) of the background sprite.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to change
The alpha for background sprite, from 0 to 1 (default is 1)

Function.Name: layer_background_blend
Function.Description: This function controls the blending (or "tinting") of the background sprite and the default value is -1 (which represents the constant c_white, which can also be used). Any other value (including internal colour constants like c_red, or c_aqua) will blend the specified colour with the original sprite.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to change
The colour to blend with the background sprite (default is c_white)

Function.Name: layer_background_create
Function.Description: With this function you can assign a sprite asset to a layer to be used as a background in your project.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target (or the layer name as a string)
The sprite index to be used

Function.Name: layer_background_destroy
Function.Description: This function will destroy the given background element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background to be destroyed

Function.Name: layer_background_exists
Function.Description: You can use this function to check and see if a background element exists on any given layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target (or the layer name as a string)
The unique ID value of the background element to check

Function.Name: layer_background_get_alpha
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the alpha value of the background element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_background_get_blend
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the blend colour of the background element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_background_get_htiled
Function.Description: This function can be used to find out if the background element is tiled horizontally or not.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_background_get_id
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the unique ID value of the background element on a layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target

Function.Name: layer_background_get_index
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the current image index value of the background element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_background_get_speed
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the current speed multiplier value of the background element. Default value is 1.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_background_get_sprite
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the current sprite index value of the background element. If the element has no sprite assigned, the function will return -1.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_background_get_stretch
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the stretched state of the background element sprite. The function will return either true if the element sprite is currently stretched to fit the room, or false if it is not.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_background_get_visible
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the visible state of the background element. Note that this return value is not affected by whether the layer the element is on is visible or not.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_background_get_vtiled
Function.Description: This function can be used to find out if the background element is tiled vertically or not.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_background_get_xscale
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the current scale multiplier value of the background element. Default value is 1.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_background_get_yscale
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the current scale multiplier value of the background element. Default value is 1.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_background_htiled
Function.Description: Using this function you can change whether the given background element on a layer should be tiled horizontally or not.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to change
The horizontal tiling toggle, which can be true or false

Function.Name: layer_background_index
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the image index of the background sprite which has multiple sub-images. If you set a value outside of the range of sub-images, then the image index will loop around.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to change
The image index to use for the background

Function.Name: layer_background_speed
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the speed of an animating sprite that has been assigned to a background element. If the background element has no sprite attached or the sprite used has no sub-images, this function will have no effect.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to change
The speed multiplier/value to use for the element

Function.Name: layer_background_sprite
Function.Description: Using this function you can set the sprite index of the background element. If you give a value of -1, the element will have no sprite assigned (but will still exist and can have a sprite assigned again later).
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to change
The sprite index of the sprite to use for the background element

Function.Name: layer_background_stretch
Function.Description: Using this function you can toggle a background element sprite to stretch to fit the room or remain at 1:1 with the resolution.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to change
The stretch toggle, which can be true or false

Function.Name: layer_background_visible
Function.Description: Using this function you can toggle a background element's visibility. Note that this is dependent on the layer visibility, and even if the background element is flagged as visible, it will not be drawn if the layer it is on is flagged as not visible.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to change
The visibility toggle, which can be true or false

Function.Name: layer_background_vtiled
Function.Description: Using this function you can change whether the given background element on a layer should be tiled vertically or not. This function is for 2D projects only, and will not work correctly when a 3D camera projection is used.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to change
The vertical tiling toggle, which can be true or false

Function.Name: layer_background_xscale
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the scale along the x-axis of a background element. Note that negative values are valid, and will "flip" the element around the (0, 0) position, so an x scale of -1 would show the image reversed.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to change
The scale value to use (1 is no scaling)

Function.Name: layer_background_yscale
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the scale along the y-axis of a background element. Note that negative values are valid, and will "flip" the element around the (0, 0) position, so an x scale of -1 would show the image reversed.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the background element to change
The speed multiplier/value to use for the element

Function.Name: layer_add_instance
Function.Description: This function can be used to move a given instance from the layer it is currently on to another layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the instance layer to target (or the layer name as a string)
The unique instance ID value of the instance to move over to the target layer

Function.Name: layer_create
Function.Description: This function is used to create a new layer within the current room. If you do not specify the name of the layer, then the created layer will be assigned a name with the format "_layer_XXX", where "XXX" is a hex value used to give the layer a unique name.
Function.Parameter: The depth that the layer has to be created at.
The name to give the layer (a string - optional)

Function.Name: layer_depth
Function.Description: This function can be used to change the depth of the given layer, changing the order in which its contents will be rendered to the screen.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to set the depth of (or the layer name as a string)
The new depth for the layer

Function.Name: layer_destroy
Function.Description: This function will destroy the given layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to destroy (or the layer name as a string)

Function.Name: layer_destroy_instances
Function.Description: This function can be used to destroy all the instances assigned to the given layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to set the depth of (or the layer name as a string)

Function.Name: layer_element_move
Function.Description: You can use this function to move an element from one layer to another.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the element to move
The unique ID value of the layer to move the element to (or the layer name as a string)

Function.Name: layer_exists
Function.Description: This function can be used to check if the given layer exists.
Function.Parameter: The name of the layer (a string or ID value)

Function.Name: layer_force_draw_depth
Function.Description: This function forces all layers to be drawn at the specified z depth. Note that this is generally only for use with legacy projects from previous version of GameMaker where you could have draw depths higher or lower than the permitted layer range.
Function.Parameter: Whether to enable (set to true or disable (set to false) Z depth forcing
The new Z depth

Function.Name: layer_get_all
Function.Description: This function will return an array populated with the unique ID values of each layer in the room.

Function.Name: layer_get_all_elements
Function.Description: You can use this function to get the element IDs of the given layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to get the elements from (or the layer name as a string)

Function.Name: layer_get_depth
Function.Description: You can use this function to get the depth value associated with a given layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to get the depth of (or the layer name as a string)

Function.Name: layer_get_type
Function.Description: You can use this function to get the type of a given layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to get the type of (or the layer name as a string)

Function.Name: layer_get_element_layer
Function.Description: You can use this function to get the Layer ID that the given element is on. If the element ID given is not a valid one, then the function will return -1.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the element to get the layer of

Function.Name: layer_get_element_type
Function.Description: You can use this function to get the element type for the given element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the element to get the type of

Function.Name: layer_get_flexpanel_node
Function.Description: This function retrieves the root-level flexpanel node on a UI layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique name of the UI layer.

Function.Name: layer_is_draw_depth_forced
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the Z depth set for rendering layers within the room.

Function.Name: layer_get_hspeed
Function.Description: You can use this function to retrieve the horizontal speed (in pixels per game frame) of the layer within the currently scoped room. Default is 0 (unless set in the room editor).
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to get the horizontal speed from

Function.Name: layer_get_id
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the unique ID value for a given layer. Note that if you give the name of a layer that does not exist in the current room, then you will get an error and the project will crash.
Function.Parameter: The name of the layer (a string)

Function.Name: layer_get_id_at_depth
Function.Description: You can use this function to get the IDs of all layers assigned a specific depth.
Function.Parameter: The depth to check and retrieve the layer IDs from.

Function.Name: layer_get_name
Function.Description: You can use this function to get the name of the given layer. If the layer is not one of the room editor ones (i.e.: it was created using layer_create()) then an empty string will be returned.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to get the name of

Function.Name: layer_get_script_begin
Function.Description: This function returns the function assigned to run at the start of rendering the given layer, or it will return an invalid handle (-1) if no function is assigned.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target (or the layer name as a string)

Function.Name: layer_get_script_end
Function.Description: This function returns the script function index of the function assigned to run at the end of rendering the given layer, or it will return -1 if no function is assigned. You can assign script functions to a layer with layer_script_begin() and layer_script_end().
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target (or the layer name as a string)

Function.Name: layer_get_shader
Function.Description: This function can be used to check if the given layer has a shader assigned to it. The function will return either the shader index of the shader assigned, or -1 if no shader is assigned.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target (or the layer name as a string)

Function.Name: layer_get_target_room
Function.Description: This function will return the current room being targeted by the layer functions.

Function.Name: layer_get_visible
Function.Description: With this function you can check whether a layer is visible or not.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target (or the layer name as a string)

Function.Name: layer_get_vspeed
Function.Description: You can use this function to retrieve the vertical speed (in pixels per game frame) of the layer within the currently scoped room. Default is 0 (unless set in the room editor).
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to get the vertical speed from

Function.Name: layer_get_x
Function.Description: You can use this function to retrieve the x position of the layer within the currently scoped room. Default is 0.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to get the x position of

Function.Name: layer_get_y
Function.Description: You can use this function to retrieve the y position of the layer within the currently scoped room. Default is 0.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to get the y position of

Function.Name: layer_has_instance
Function.Description: This function can be used to check if a given instance is currently assigned to the given layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target (or the layer name as a string)
The unique instance ID or the object index of the instance to check for

Function.Name: layer_hspeed
Function.Description: You can use this function to set the horizontal speed (in pixels per game frame) of the layer within the currently scoped room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to set the horizontal speed of
The horizontal speed (in pixels per game frame) to set

Function.Name: layer_instance_get_instance
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the unique instance ID of the given instance element. If the element is not an instance, the function will return -1.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the instance element to get the ID of

Function.Name: layer_reset_target_room
Function.Description: This function is used to reset the layer target to the current room.

Function.Name: layer_script_begin
Function.Description: With this function you can assign a script function to a layer and it will be called before the layer is rendered.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target (or the layer name as a string)
The script function index to assign to the layer (or -1)

Function.Name: layer_script_end
Function.Description:
With this function you can assign a script function to a layer and it will be called after the layer is rendered.
Note that the function is not meant to be called in any draw events or step events, but rather only needs to be called at the start of the room in the Room Creation Code or in the Create Event / Room Start Event of an instance.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target (or the layer name as a string)
The script function index to assign to the layer (or -1)

Function.Name: layer_set_target_room
Function.Description:
When you call this function you are telling GameMaker that all further layer functions should be applied to the given room.
Note that this function can only be used on rooms other than the current room, and is designed so that you can add/remove layers and layer elements to rooms other than the room that is currently running.
Function.Parameter: The room to target for all further layer functions

Function.Name: layer_set_visible
Function.Description: With this function you can toggle the visibility of a layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target (or the layer name as a string)
Whether the layer should be visible (true) or not (false)

Function.Name: layer_shader
Function.Description: With this function you can assign a shader asset to any given layer and the layer will then be rendered using that shader. The shader will also affect any other graphic elements drawn on that layer, like sprite assets or tile maps.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target (or the layer name as a string)
The shader index to assign to the layer

Function.Name: layer_vspeed
Function.Description: You can use this function to set the vertical speed (in pixels per game frame) of the layer within the currently scoped room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to set the vertical speed of
The vertical speed (in pixels per game frame) to set

Function.Name: layer_x
Function.Description: You can use this function to set the x position of the layer within the currently scoped room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to set the x position of
The x position in the room to set the layer to

Function.Name: layer_y
Function.Description: You can use this function to set the y position of the layer within the currently scoped room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to set the y position of
The y position in the room to set the layer to

Function.Name: layer_particle_xscale
Function.Description: This function can be used to change scaling on the x axis of a particle system element. You supply the particle system element ID (which you can get using layer_particle_get_id()), and then set the new scale value to use (based on the room coordinates).
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the particle system element
The new scale on the x axis

Function.Name: layer_particle_yscale
Function.Description: This function can be used to change scaling on the y axis of a particle system element. You supply the particle system element ID (which you can get using layer_particle_get_id()), and then set the new scale value to use (based on the room coordinates).
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the particle system element
The new scale on the y axis

Function.Name: layer_particle_angle
Function.Description: This function can be used to change angle of rotation of a particle system element. You supply the particle system element ID (which you can get using layer_particle_get_id()), and then set the new angle to use (in degrees).
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the particle system element
The new angle of rotation in degrees

Function.Name: layer_particle_blend
Function.Description: This function can be used to change blend colour of a particle system element. You supply the particle system element ID (which you can get using layer_particle_get_id()), and then set the new blend colour to use.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the particle system element
The new blend colour

Function.Name: layer_particle_alpha
Function.Description: This function can be used to change alpha value of a particle system element. You supply the particle system element ID (which you can get using layer_particle_get_id()), and then set the new alpha value in range from 0 (transparent) to 1 (opaque).
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the particle system element
The new alpha value in range from 0 (transparent) to 1 (opaque)

Function.Name: layer_particle_x
Function.Description: This function can be used to change position on the x axis of a particle system element. You supply the particle system element ID (which you can get using layer_particle_get_id()), and then set the x value to use (based on the room coordinates).
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the particle system element
The new position on the x axis

Function.Name: layer_particle_y
Function.Description: This function can be used to change position on the y axis of a particle system element. You supply the particle system element ID (which you can get using layer_particle_get_id()), and then set the y value to use (based on the room coordinates).
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the particle system element
The new position on the y axis

Function.Name: layer_particle_get_id
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the unique ID value of a particle system element on a layer. You supply the layer ID (which you get when you create the layer using layer_create() or when you use the layer name along with layer_get_id()) and the name of the particle system element as defined in the Room Editor. The function will return the ID value associated with that particle system element on the layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target
The unique name of the particle system element on the layer as defined in the Room Editor

Function.Name: layer_particle_get_instance
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the unique ID of a particle system instance associated with a particle system element. You supply the particle system element ID (which you can get using layer_particle_get_id()) and the function returns the particle system instance ID associated with the layer element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the particle system element

Function.Name: layer_particle_get_system
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the particle system asset associated with a particle system element. You supply the particle system element ID (which you can get using layer_particle_get_id()) and the function returns the particle system asset associated with the layer element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the particle system element

Function.Name: layer_particle_get_xscale
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve scaling on the x axis of a particle system element. You supply the particle system element ID (which you can get using layer_particle_get_id()) and the function returns the layer element's scale on the x axis.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the particle system element

Function.Name: layer_particle_get_yscale
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve scaling on the y axis of a particle system element. You supply the particle system element ID (which you can get using layer_particle_get_id()) and the function returns the layer element's scale on the y axis.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the particle system element

Function.Name: layer_particle_get_angle
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve rotation of a particle system element. You supply the particle system element ID (which you can get using layer_particle_get_id()) and the function returns the layer element's rotation in degrees.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the particle system element

Function.Name: layer_particle_get_blend
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve blend colour of a particle system element. You supply the particle system element ID (which you can get using layer_particle_get_id()) and the function returns the layer element's blend colour.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the particle system element

Function.Name: layer_particle_get_alpha
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve alpha value of a particle system element. You supply the particle system element ID (which you can get using layer_particle_get_id()) and the function returns a value in range from 0 (transparent) to 1 (opaque).
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the particle system element

Function.Name: layer_particle_get_x
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve position on the x axis of a particle system element. You supply the particle system element ID (which you can get using layer_particle_get_id()) and the function returns the layer element's position on the x axis.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the particle system element

Function.Name: layer_particle_get_y
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve position on the y axis of a particle system element. You supply the particle system element ID (which you can get using layer_particle_get_id()) and the function returns the layer element's position on the y axis.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the particle system element

Function.Name: layer_sequence_angle
Function.Description: With this function you can set the angle of rotation for the given sequence element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target
The new angle to rotate the sequence element to

Function.Name: layer_sequence_create
Function.Description: With this function you can create an instance of a sequence asset on the given layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the instance layer to target
The x position in the room to create the sequence at
The y position in the room to create the sequence at
The sequence ID to create, as defined in the Asset Browser

Function.Name: layer_sequence_destroy
Function.Description: With this function you can destroy (remove from the room) a sequence element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target

Function.Name: layer_sequence_exists
Function.Description: With this function you can check to see if a sequence element exists on the given layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID or name of the layer to check
The unique ID value of the sequence element to target

Function.Name: layer_sequence_get_angle
Function.Description: This function returns the current angle of the given sequence element in the game room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target

Function.Name: layer_sequence_get_headdir
Function.Description: This function returns the current playhead direction of the given sequence element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target

Function.Name: layer_sequence_get_headpos
Function.Description: This function returns the current playhead position (the current frame the playhead is on) of the given sequence element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target

Function.Name: layer_sequence_get_instance
Function.Description: This function returns the sequence instance struct for the given sequence element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target

Function.Name: layer_sequence_get_length
Function.Description: This function returns the length of the sequence referenced by the given sequence element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target

Function.Name: layer_sequence_get_sequence
Function.Description: This function gets the sequence object referenced by the given sequence element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target

Function.Name: layer_sequence_get_speedscale
Function.Description: This function returns the current playback speed scale of the given sequence element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target

Function.Name: layer_sequence_get_x
Function.Description: This function returns the current x position in the game room for the given sequence element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target

Function.Name: layer_sequence_get_xscale
Function.Description: This function returns the current scale along the x axis of the given sequence element in the game room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target

Function.Name: layer_sequence_get_y
Function.Description: This function returns the current y position in the game room for the given sequence element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target

Function.Name: layer_sequence_get_yscale
Function.Description: This function returns the current scale along the y axis of the given sequence element in the game room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target

Function.Name: layer_sequence_headdir
Function.Description: With this function you can set the direction for the given sequence playhead.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target
The playhead direction, a constant, listed above

Function.Name: layer_sequence_headpos
Function.Description: With this function you can set the playhead position of a sequence element to a specific frame.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target
The position within the sequence (in frames) to set the playhead position to (can be a decimal value)

Function.Name: layer_sequence_is_finished
Function.Description: This function returns whether the given sequence has finished playing.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target

Function.Name: layer_sequence_is_paused
Function.Description: This function returns whether the given sequence is currently paused.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target

Function.Name: layer_sequence_pause
Function.Description: With this function you can pause the playback of the given sequence. The function will pause the sequence until you begin playback again using the function layer_sequence_play().
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target

Function.Name: layer_sequence_play
Function.Description: With this function you can start the playback of the given sequence. The function will play the sequence, which you can then pause if required using the function layer_sequence_pause().
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target

Function.Name: layer_sequence_speedscale
Function.Description: With this function you can change the playback speed of the given sequence.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target
The speed scale to use (a multiplier), default is 1

Function.Name: layer_sequence_x
Function.Description: With this function you can set the position along the X (horizontal) axis of the room for the given sequence element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target
The X position to move the sequence element to

Function.Name: layer_sequence_xscale
Function.Description: With this function you can set the X scale for the given sequence element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target
The new X axis scale value to apply to the sequence element

Function.Name: layer_sequence_y
Function.Description: With this function you can set the position along the Y (vertical) axis of the room for the given sequence element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target
The Y position to move the sequence element to

Function.Name: layer_sequence_yscale
Function.Description: With this function you can set the Y scale for the given sequence element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sequence element to target
The new Y axis scale value to apply to the sequence element

Function.Name: layer_sprite_alpha
Function.Description: This function controls the alpha (transparency) of the sprite on the asset layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sprite element to change
The alpha for sprite sprite, from 0 to 1 (default is 1)

Function.Name: layer_sprite_angle
Function.Description: Using this function you can change the angle for the given sprite element on a layer. If you set a value greater than 360 this will be looped to bring it within the 0 - 359 range.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sprite element to change
The angle of the sprite (default is 0)

Function.Name: layer_sprite_blend
Function.Description: This function sets the blend colour (or "tint") of the given sprite element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sprite element to change
The colour to blend with the sprite sprite (default is c_white)

Function.Name: layer_sprite_change
Function.Description: Using this function you can change the sprite asset assigned to a given sprite element on a layer. Note that you can assign a value of -1 as the new sprite index and no sprite will be shown, although the element will still exist and can still be changed again later.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sprite element to change
The new sprite index to use

Function.Name: layer_sprite_create
Function.Description: With this function you can assign a sprite asset to a layer to be used in your project.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target
The x position to use
The y position to use
The sprite index to be used

Function.Name: layer_sprite_destroy
Function.Description: This function will destroy the given sprite element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sprite to be destroyed

Function.Name: layer_sprite_exists
Function.Description: You can use this function to check and see if a sprite element exists on any given layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target (or the layer name as a string)
The unique ID value of the sprite element to check

Function.Name: layer_sprite_get_alpha
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the alpha value of the sprite element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sprite element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_sprite_get_angle
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the current angle for the sprite element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sprite element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_sprite_get_blend
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the blend colour of the sprite element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sprite element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_sprite_get_id
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the unique ID value of a sprite element on a layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target
The unique name of the sprite element on the layer as defined in the Room Editor

Function.Name: layer_sprite_get_index
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the current image index value of the sprite element. The function will return -1 if either the sprite element doesn't exist or the element doesn't have a valid sprite assigned to it.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sprite element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_sprite_get_speed
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the current speed multiplier value of the sprite element. Default value is 1.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sprite element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_sprite_get_sprite
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the current sprite index of the sprite element. If the element has no sprite assigned, the function will return -1.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sprite element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_sprite_get_x
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the x position of the sprite element in the room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sprite element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_sprite_get_xscale
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the current scale multiplier along the x axis for the sprite element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sprite element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_sprite_get_y
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the y position of the sprite element in the room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sprite element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_sprite_get_yscale
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the current scale multiplier along the y axis for the sprite element. The function will return a real value for the y scale, where 1 is no scaling.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sprite element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_sprite_index
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the image index of a sprite asset which has multiple sub-images on a layer. If you set a value outside of the range of sub-images, then the image index will loop around.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sprite element to set
The image index to use for the sprite

Function.Name: layer_sprite_speed
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the speed of an animating image that has been assigned to a sprite element. If the sprite used has no sub-images, this function will have no effect.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sprite element to change
The speed multiplier/value to use for the element

Function.Name: layer_sprite_x
Function.Description: This function controls the position along the x-axis of the room of the asset sprite element on the layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sprite element to change
The x position for the sprite

Function.Name: layer_sprite_xscale
Function.Description: Using this function you can change whether the given sprite element on a layer should be scaled along the x axis or not.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sprite element to change
The xscale value (default is 1)

Function.Name: layer_sprite_y
Function.Description: This function controls the position along the y-axis of the room of the asset sprite element on the layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sprite element to change
The y position for the sprite

Function.Name: layer_sprite_yscale
Function.Description: Using this function you can change whether the given sprite element on a layer should be scaled along the y axis or not.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the sprite element to change
The yscale value (default is 1)

Function.Name: layer_text_get_id
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the unique ID value of a text element on a layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target
The unique name of the text element on the layer as defined in the Room Editor

Function.Name: layer_text_exists
Function.Description: You can use this function to check and see if a text element exists on any given layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target (or the layer name as a string)
The unique ID value of the text element to check

Function.Name: layer_text_create
Function.Description: With this function you can create a new text element on the specified layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target
The x position to use
The y position to use
The font to be used
The text string to be displayed

Function.Name: layer_text_destroy
Function.Description: This function will destroy the given text element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to be destroyed

Function.Name: layer_text_x
Function.Description: This function controls the position along the x-axis of the room of the text element on the layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to change
The x position for the text element

Function.Name: layer_text_y
Function.Description: This function controls the position along the y-axis of the room of the text element on the layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to change
The y position for the text element

Function.Name: layer_text_angle
Function.Description: Using this function you can change the angle for the given text element on a layer. If you set a value greater than 360 this will be looped to bring it within the 0 - 359 range.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to change
The angle of the text element (default is 0)

Function.Name: layer_text_xscale
Function.Description: Using this function you can change whether the given text element on a layer should be scaled along the x axis or not.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to change
The xscale value (default is 1)

Function.Name: layer_text_yscale
Function.Description: Using this function you can change whether the given text element on a layer should be scaled along the y axis or not.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to change
The yscale value (default is 1)

Function.Name: layer_text_blend
Function.Description: This function changes the blend colour of the given text element, similar to image_blend for an Object Instance.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to change
The colour to draw the text element (default is c_white)

Function.Name: layer_text_alpha
Function.Description: This function controls the alpha (transparency) of the text element on the asset layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to change
The alpha for text element, from 0 to 1 (default is 1)

Function.Name: layer_text_font
Function.Description: Using this function you can change the font asset assigned to a given text element on a layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to change
The new font to use

Function.Name: layer_text_xorigin
Function.Description: Using this function you can change the x position of the origin of the given text element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to change
The xorigin value (default is 0)

Function.Name: layer_text_yorigin
Function.Description: Using this function you can change the y position of the origin of the given text element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to change
The yorigin value (default is 0)

Function.Name: layer_text_origin
Function.Description: Using this function you can set the frame origin for the given text element. You give the text element ID (which you get when you create a text element using layer_text_create() or when you use the function layer_text_get_id()), and then set the origin value.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to change
The origin value (default is 0)

Function.Name: layer_text_text
Function.Description: Using this function you can change the text string assigned to a given text element on a layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to change
The new text string to be displayed

Function.Name: layer_text_halign
Function.Description: Using this function you can change the horizontal alignment of the given text element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to change
The alignment value (default is 0)

Function.Name: layer_text_valign
Function.Description: Using this function you can change the vertical alignment of the given text element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to change
The alignment value (default is 0)

Function.Name: layer_text_charspacing
Function.Description: Using this function you can change the character spacing of the given text element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to change
The character spacing value (default is 0)

Function.Name: layer_text_linespacing
Function.Description: Using this function you can change the line spacing of the given text element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to change
The line spacing value (default is 0)

Function.Name: layer_text_paragraphspacing
Function.Description: Using this function you can change the paragraph spacing of the given text element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to change
The paragraph spacing value (default is 0)

Function.Name: layer_text_framew
Function.Description: Using this function you can change the width of the frame of the given text element. This only affects rendering when wrapping is enabled.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to change
The frame width value (default is -1)

Function.Name: layer_text_frameh
Function.Description: Using this function you can change the height of the frame of the given text element. This affects vertical alignment of the text.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to change
The frame height value (default is -1)

Function.Name: layer_text_wrap
Function.Description: Using this function you can change whether wrapping is enabled for the given text element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to change
True if wrapping is enabled or false if disabled (default is false)

Function.Name: layer_text_wrapmode
Function.Description: Using this function you can set the wrapping mode for the given text element. You give the text element ID (which you get when you create a text element using layer_text_create() or when you use the function layer_text_get_id()), and then set the wrapping mode.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to change
The wrapping mode value (default is 0)

Function.Name: layer_text_get_x
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the x position of the text element in the room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_text_get_y
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the y position of the text element in the room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_text_get_xscale
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the x scale of the text element in the room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_text_get_yscale
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the y scale of the text element in the room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_text_get_angle
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the rotation angle of the text element in the room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_text_get_blend
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the blend colour of the text element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_text_get_alpha
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the alpha value of the text element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_text_get_font
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the font asset reference of the text element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_text_get_xorigin
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the x origin of the text element in the room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_text_get_yorigin
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the y origin of the text element in the room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_text_get_origin
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the frame origin value of the text element in the room. You give the text element ID (which you get when you create a text element using layer_text_create() or when you use the function layer_text_get_id()), and the function will return the origin value.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_text_get_text
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the text string of the text element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_text_get_halign
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the horizontal alignment of the text element in the room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_text_get_valign
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the vertical alignment of the text element in the room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_text_get_charspacing
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the character spacing of the text element in the room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_text_get_linespacing
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the line spacing of the text element in the room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_text_get_paragraphspacing
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the paragraph spacing of the text element in the room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_text_get_framew
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the width of the frame of the text element in the room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_text_get_frameh
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the height of the frame of the text element in the room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_text_get_wrap
Function.Description: This function can be used to get whether wrapping is enabled for the text element in the room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_text_get_wrapmode
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the wrapping mode for the text element in the room. You give the text element ID (which you get when you create a text element using layer_text_create() or when you use the function layer_text_get_id()), and the function will return the wrapping mode status.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the text element to get the information from

Function.Name: layer_tilemap_create
Function.Description: With this function you can assign a tile-set asset to a layer to be used as a tile map in your project. It is worth noting that you cannot place tiles at negative positions within the tile map, so all tiles must be placed within the cell spaces 0 to width - 1, 0 to height - 1.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target (or the layer name as a string)
The x position of the tile map in the room
The y position of the tile map in the room
The tile set index to be used
The width tile map (in cells)
The height of the tile map (in cells)

Function.Name: layer_tilemap_destroy
Function.Description: This function will destroy the given tile map element. Note that this does not remove the layer, only the tile map from it, and if the tile map is one that has been added in the room editor, then the next time you leave the room and then return, the tile map will be recreated again. However if the room is persistent, the tile map will be removed unless room persistence is switched off again.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map to be destroyed

Function.Name: layer_tilemap_exists
Function.Description: You can use this function to check and see if a tile map element exists on any given layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target (or the layer name as a string)
The unique ID value of the tile map element to check

Function.Name: layer_tilemap_get_id
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the unique ID value of the tile map element on a layer. Note that this function is specifically designed for use with tile maps that have been added in the IDE, as if you add a tile map to a layer through code using the function layer_tilemap_create(), then it will return the unique ID for the tile map element added. If the given tilemap ID is incorrect or the tilemap doesn't exist, the function will return -1.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the layer to target (or the layer name as a string)

Function.Name: layer_tilemap_get_colmask
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the sprite that is being used as the collision mask for this tilemap.
Function.Parameter: The Id of the tilemap element for which you wish to know the colmask of.

Function.Name: layer_tilemap_set_colmask
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the sprite that is being used as the collision mask for this tilemap. The dimensions of the sprite must match the dimensions of the sprite being used for the tileset. If the function succeeds it will return 0, if it fails it will return -1
Function.Parameter: The Id of the tilemap element for which you wish to know the colmask of.
The index of the sprite to be used as the collision mask

Function.Name: tilemap_clear
Function.Description: Using this function you can clear/set all the tiles on a given tile map. A default value of 0 will clear all the tiles from the layer (essentially making all tiles "empty"), while you can use the dedicated tile_* functions to create your own tile data to clear the tile map with.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to change
The tile data to use to clear the layer

Function.Name: tilemap_get
Function.Description: Using this function you can retrieve the tile data from a cell of the tile map element. Note that we are using x/y cell positions based on the size of the tile map grid and not as a position in the room, so "cell_x" is a value from 0 to tile map width, and "cell_y" is a value from 0 to tile map height. If you need to get the data for a tile at a specific room position then you need to use the function tilemap_get_at_pixel().
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to get the tile-data of
The cell along the x-axis to get the tile data from
The cell along the y-axis to get the tile data from

Function.Name: tilemap_get_at_pixel
Function.Description: Using this function you can retrieve the tile data from a position (within the room) of the tile map element. If you need to get the tile data from a specific tile cell you should be using the function tilemap_get() instead.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to get the tile-data of
The position along the x-axis to get the tile data from (in room pixels)
The position along the y-axis to get the tile data from (in room pixels)

Function.Name: tilemap_get_cell_x_at_pixel
Function.Description: Using this function you can retrieve the x-axis position of an individual tile map cell by giving the relative x-axis position within the room. Note that if the value is outside of the tile map area, and no cell is available, it will return -1.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to get the cell x position of
The x position within the room to use for getting the cell
The y position within the room to use for getting the cell

Function.Name: tilemap_get_cell_y_at_pixel
Function.Description: Using this function you can retrieve the y-axis position of an individual tile map cell by giving the relative y-axis position within the room. Note that if the value is outside of the tile map area, and no cell is available, it will return -1.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to get the cell y position of
The x position within the room to use for getting the cell
The y position within the room to use for getting the cell

Function.Name: tilemap_get_frame
Function.Description: Since tiles can be animated, it can sometimes be useful to know which frame is currently being drawn and react accordingly, so with this function you can retrieve the current frame index for a given tile map.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to get the frame index of

Function.Name: tilemap_get_global_mask
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the bit mask value for all tile maps, returning the current mask value or -1 if there is an error or 0 if no mask is specified. For further information on global tile map bit masks, see the function tilemap_set_global_mask().

Function.Name: tilemap_get_height
Function.Description: Using this function you can retrieve the height (in cells) of the tile map element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to get the height of

Function.Name: tilemap_get_mask
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the bit mask value for the given tile map. For further information on tile map bit masks, see the function tilemap_set_mask().
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to get the mask of

Function.Name: tilemap_get_tileset
Function.Description: Using this function you can retrieve the index value of the tile set asset assigned to a given tile map element on a layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to get the tile set from

Function.Name: tilemap_get_tile_height
Function.Description: Using this function you can retrieve the height (in pixels) of each tile cell of the tile map element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to get the tile cell height of

Function.Name: tilemap_get_tile_width
Function.Description: Using this function you can retrieve the width (in pixels) of each tile cell of the tile map element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to get the tile cell width of

Function.Name: tilemap_get_width
Function.Description: Using this function you can retrieve the width (in cells) of the tile map element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to get the width of

Function.Name: tilemap_get_x
Function.Description: Using this function you can retrieve the x position (within the room) of the tile map element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to get the x position of

Function.Name: tilemap_get_y
Function.Description: Using this function you can retrieve the y position (within the room) of the tile map element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to get the y position of

Function.Name: tilemap_set
Function.Description: This function can be used to set any cell (grid square) within the tile map element on the layer to a new tile. The function will return true if the tile was successfully set and false if there was an issue and it wasn't set.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to change
The tile data to set
The cell (grid) position to set along the x-axis
The cell (grid) position to set along the y-axis

Function.Name: tilemap_set_at_pixel
Function.Description: This function can be used to set a cell within the tile map element on the layer to a new tile using the actual position of the tile to change within the room. The function will return true if the tile was successfully set and false if there was an issue and it wasn't set.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to change
The tile set data to set
The x position (in the room)
The y position (in the room)

Function.Name: tilemap_set_global_mask
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the tile bit mask for all tile maps in the game.
Function.Parameter: The mask value to use

Function.Name: tilemap_set_height
Function.Description: This function can be used to resize a tile map element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to set the height of
The height value (in "cells")

Function.Name: tilemap_set_mask
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the tile bit mask for a single tile map.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to set the mask of
The mask value

Function.Name: tilemap_set_width
Function.Description: This function can be used to resize a tile map element.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to set the width of
The width value (in "cells")

Function.Name: tilemap_tileset
Function.Description: Using this function you can change the tile set asset assigned to a given tile map element on a layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to change
The new tile set index to use

Function.Name: tilemap_x
Function.Description: This function controls the position along the x-axis of the room of the asset tile map element on the layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to change
The x position for the tile map

Function.Name: tilemap_y
Function.Description: This function controls the position along the y-axis of the room of the asset tile map element on the layer.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tile map element to change
The y position for the tile map

Function.Name: tile_get_empty
Function.Description: This function can be used to check whether a given set of tile-data is for an empty tile or not.
Function.Parameter: the tile-data to check

Function.Name: tile_get_flip
Function.Description: This function can be used to check whether in a given set of tile-data the tile has been flipped or not.
Function.Parameter: the tile-data to check

Function.Name: tile_get_index
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the tile index (the position of the tile within the tile set image) from a set of tile-data.
Function.Parameter: the tile-data to check

Function.Name: tile_get_mirror
Function.Description: This function can be used to check whether in a given set of tile-data the tile has been mirrored or not.
Function.Parameter: the tile-data to check

Function.Name: tile_get_rotate
Function.Description: This function can be used to check whether in a given set of tile-data the tile has been rotated 90 degrees or not.
Function.Parameter: the tile-data to check

Function.Name: tile_set_empty
Function.Description: This function can be used to set a given set of tile-data to be an empty tile. The function will return a modified tile-data set which can then be applied using the tilemap_set() function.
Function.Parameter: the tile-data to set

Function.Name: tile_set_flip
Function.Description: This function can be used to set a given set of tile-data to flip the tile or not. The function will return a modified tile-data set which can then be applied using the tilemap_set() function.
Function.Parameter: the tile-data to set
Set to true to flip and false to leave it as-is

Function.Name: tile_set_index
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the tile index (the position of the tile within the tile set image) for a set of tile-data. The function will return a modified tile-data set which can then be applied using the tilemap_set() function.
Function.Parameter: the tile-data to set
The integer index value of the tile set to use

Function.Name: tile_set_mirror
Function.Description: This function can be used to set a given set of tile-data to mirror the tile or not. The function will return a modified tile-data set which can then be applied using the tilemap_set() function.
Function.Parameter: the tile-data to set
Set to true to mirror and false to leave it as-is

Function.Name: tile_set_rotate
Function.Description: This function can be used to set a given set of tile-data to rotate the tile 90 degrees or not. The function will return a modified tile-data set which can then be applied using the tilemap_set() function.
Function.Parameter: the tile-data to set
Set to true to rotate and false to leave it as-is

Function.Name: script_execute
Function.Description: This function calls a Script Function or Method with the given arguments.
Function.Parameter: The name of the function/script that you want to call
The different arguments that you want to pass through to the function/script

Function.Name: script_execute_ext
Function.Description: This function calls a Script Function or Method, with the given arguments passed as an Array.
Function.Parameter: The name of the function/script that you want to call
The array containing the arguments for the function/script
OPTIONAL! The offset into the argument array
OPTIONAL! The number of arguments to (from the offset onwards)

Function.Name: method_call
Function.Description: This function calls a method in its bound context, with the arguments taken from an array or a range in an array.
Function.Parameter: method/function that you want to call
The array containing the arguments for the function/script
OPTIONAL! The offset into the argument array
OPTIONAL! The number of arguments to (from the offset onwards)

Function.Name: script_exists
Function.Description: This function will return true or false depending on whether the script or script function with the given index exists.
