Note that this is not a string, but rather the asset name which holds the unique index for each script (as it would appear in the IDE) or the script function name variable, as defined within the script asset (note that this will not work for method variables).
Function.Parameter: The name of the script that you want to check.

Function.Name: script_get_name
Function.Description: This function will return the name as a string of the specified script. This name is the one that has been specified for the script in the Asset Browser of the main GameMaker window. For more information about scripts, see The Script Editor.
Function.Parameter: The index of the script that you want to get the name of.

Function.Name: sequence_create
Function.Description: With this function you can create a new sequence object which you can then add tracks to. The function returns a struct which you can then access to set up the new sequence you have created. The sequence object struct can then be used to create instances of the sequence on a room layer using the function layer_sequence_create().

Function.Name: sequence_destroy
Function.Description: With this function you can destroy a sequence object that has been created dynamically. This function should be used whenever a dynamically created sequence is no longer required to free up the memory associated with it.
Function.Parameter: The sequence object struct or ID to destroy

Function.Name: sequence_exists
Function.Description: With this function you can check to see if a sequence object exists or not.
Function.Parameter: The sequence object struct or ID to check for

Function.Name: sequence_get
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the sequence object struct from a sequence asset index.
Function.Parameter: The sequence index as defined in the asset browser.

Function.Name: sequence_get_objects
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve an array of all the object indices that have instances being created within the given sequence.
Function.Parameter: The sequence object struct or ID to get the objects from.

Function.Name: sequence_instance_override_object
Function.Description: With this function you can override (replace) all instances of an object used in a sequence with another one. Note that this can only be done on sequence instances (not sequence objects) and must be done before the sequence starts to play, otherwise it won't work.
Function.Parameter: The sequence instance struct to modify.
The object index of the object within the sequence to override.
The object index or instance ID to use to override the sequence objects.

Function.Name: sequence_keyframedata_new
Function.Description: With this function you can create a new keyframe data struct, supplying the type of track that the keyframe data will be applied to.
Function.Parameter: The type of keyframe data to create, a constant, listed above.

Function.Name: sequence_keyframe_new
Function.Description: With this function you can create a new track keyframe struct, supplying the type of track that the keyframe will be applied to.
Function.Parameter: The type of keyframe to create, a constant, listed above.

Function.Name: sequence_track_new
Function.Description: With this function you can create a new sequence track struct, supplying the type of track that you wish to make.
Function.Parameter: The type of track to create, a constant, listed above.

Function.Name: shaders_are_supported
Function.Description: This function will do a check to see if the chosen target platform supports shaders, returning true if they do, and false if they do not. It is important to note that on Android, if the project does not have any shader resources defined, then the function will always return false, regardless of whether the device supports shaders or not.

Function.Name: shader_current
Function.Description: This function will return the index ID value of the shader currently being used for rendering, or it will return -1 if no shader is being used.

Function.Name: shader_enable_corner_id
Function.Description: This function enables the use of corner IDs in shaders.
Function.Parameter: Enable (true) or disable (false) this function.

Function.Name: shader_get_name
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the name of a shader asset.
Function.Parameter: The index of the shader to get the name of.

Function.Name: shader_get_sampler_index
Function.Description: This function gets the handle of the shader sampler with the given name.
Function.Parameter: The index of the shader to use.
The shader sampler to get the handle of.

Function.Name: shader_get_uniform
Function.Description: This function gets the handle of the shader constant with the given name.
Function.Parameter: The index of the shader to use.
The shader constant to get the handle of.

Function.Name: shader_is_compiled
Function.Description: This function will check a shader at runtime to make sure that it has been successfully compiled. This function should be used at the start of the game to make sure that the platform running your game has successfully compiled any shaders used.
Function.Parameter: The shader to check.

Function.Name: shader_set_uniform_matrix_array
Function.Description: This function sets a shader constant to hold an array of matrix values.
Function.Parameter: The handle of the shader constant to set.
A previously initialised array of floating point values.

Function.Name: shader_set
Function.Description: With this function you can set the drawing target to the given shader and all further drawing will be done using that. You can end shader use with function shader_reset().
Function.Parameter: The index of the shader to use.

Function.Name: shader_set_uniform_f
Function.Description: With this function you can set the value (or values) of a shader constant. You must previously have gotten the "handle" of the constant using the function shader_get_uniform(), and you will have to know what type of constant it is to pass the correct number of floating point values through to it, i.e.: if you have a vec2 you will need to pass two values to the function.
Function.Parameter: The handle of the shader constant to set.
The floating point value (or values) to set the shader constant to.
The floating point value (or values) to set the shader constant to.
The floating point value (or values) to set the shader constant to.
The floating point value (or values) to set the shader constant to.

Function.Name: shader_set_uniform_f_array
Function.Description: With this function you can set a shader constant to hold an array of values. You must previously have gotten the "handle" of the constant using the function shader_get_uniform(), and you will have to have previously initialised the array.
Function.Parameter: The handle of the shader constant to set.
A previously initialised array of floating point values.

Function.Name: shader_set_uniform_f_buffer
Function.Description: With this function you can set values of a shader constant from a buffer. You must previously have gotten the "handle" of the constant using the function shader_get_uniform(), and you will have to have previously initialised the buffer and filled it with buffer_f32 data.
Function.Parameter: The handle of the shader constant to set.
The index of the buffer to use.
The offset position (in bytes) within the buffer to read the data from.
The number of entires to read from the buffer.

Function.Name: shader_set_uniform_i
Function.Description: With this function you can set the value (or values) of a shader constant. You must previously have gotten the "handle" of the constant using the function shader_get_uniform(), and you will have to know what type of constant it is to pass the correct number of integer values through to it, i.e.: if you have a vec2 you will need to pass two values to the function.
Function.Parameter: The handle of the shader constant to set.
The integer value (or values) to set the shader constant to.
The integer value (or values) to set the shader constant to.
The integer value (or values) to set the shader constant to.
The integer value (or values) to set the shader constant to.

Function.Name: shader_set_uniform_matrix
Function.Description: With this function you can set the value (or values) of a shader constant to the current transform matrix. You must previously have gotten the "handle" of the constant using the function shader_get_uniform().
Function.Parameter: The handle of the shader constant to set.

Function.Name: skeleton_animation_clear
Function.Description: This function will clear the specified animation track of all animations, ready to be reassigned.
Function.Parameter: The animation track to clear.
Whether to reset the skeleton to setup pose (defaults to false).
How long animating the skeleton back to setup pose will take.

Function.Name: skeleton_animation_get
Function.Description: With this function you can get the current animation set being used by your skeletal animation sprite. The return value is a string, which will be the name of the set as you defined it in your skeletal animation program.

Function.Name: skeleton_animation_get_duration
Function.Description: This function will return the time required for the given animation set to run before looping back to the beginning. The return value is in seconds.
Function.Parameter: The name of the animation set to use.

Function.Name: skeleton_animation_get_ext
Function.Description: This function will return the name of the animation set currently used by the given track number (as set by the function skeleton_animation_set_ext).
Function.Parameter: The track number to get the animation set name of.

Function.Name: skeleton_animation_get_frame
Function.Description: This function will return the frame number of the animation on the specified animation track. The function will return -1 if no animation is assigned to the specific track given.
Function.Parameter: The animation track to get the frame of.

Function.Name: skeleton_animation_get_position
Function.Description: This function will return the current position of the specified animation track in the range (0.0 to 1.0). The function will return -1 if no animation is assigned to the specific track given.
Function.Parameter: The animation track to get the frame of.

Function.Name: skeleton_animation_get_frames
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the number of frames that any given skeleton animation has. The function will return 0 if the specified animation does not exist.
Function.Parameter: The animation name to get the frames of.

Function.Name: skeleton_animation_is_finished
Function.Description: This function will return true if the animation on the given track has finished.
Function.Parameter: The animation track.

Function.Name: skeleton_animation_is_looping
Function.Description: This function will return true if the animation on the given track is looping.
Function.Parameter: The animation track.

Function.Name: skeleton_animation_list
Function.Description: With this function you can populate a (pre-created) DS list with all the names of the animations included as part of the skeletal animation sprite. The names will be strings and can then be used in the other animation functions for these types of sprite.
Function.Parameter: The sprite index of the Spine skeletal animation to get the list from.
The ID of the DS list to populate with the animation names.

Function.Name: skeleton_animation_mix
Function.Description: This function sets the mix value between two animation sets that the instance's skeletal animation sprite will interpolate between.
Function.Parameter: The name of the first animation set to interpolate from.
The name of the second animation set to interpolate to.
The duration of the interpolation (from 0 to 1)

Function.Name: skeleton_animation_set
Function.Description: This function defines the animation set to be used by the skeletal animation sprite assigned to the instance.
Function.Parameter: The name of the animation set to use.
Whether the animation should loop (defaults to true).

Function.Name: skeleton_animation_set_ext
Function.Description: This function assigns the given animation set of the instance's skeletal animation sprite to the given track number.
Function.Parameter: The name of the animation set to use.
The track for the animation set to use.
Whether the animation should loop (defaults to true).

Function.Name: skeleton_animation_set_frame
Function.Description: This function will set the animation assigned to the given track to the frame you supply. The frame index should be an real value between 0 and the number of frames for the animation (which you can get using the function skeleton_animation_get_frames). If you supply a value outside of this range, the animation will be looped to make up the difference, for example if the animation has 5 frames and you set the frame to 8, the actual frame shown will be 3.
Function.Parameter: The animation track to set the frame of.
The new index for the animation frame.

Function.Name: skeleton_animation_set_position
Function.Description: This function will set the animation assigned to the given track to the proportional position you supply. The position should be a real value between 0.0 and 1.0. If you supply a value outside of this range, the animation will be looped to make up the difference, for example if the given position is 1.5 the actual position will be 0.5.
Function.Parameter: The animation track to set the frame of.
The new position for the animation track.

Function.Name: skeleton_attachment_create
Function.Description: This function creates an attachment for the instance's skeletal animation sprite at runtime using a sprite asset from your game.
Function.Parameter: The name (as a string) of the attachment to create.
The sprite_index to get the attachment image from.
The image_index to get the attachment image from.
The x origin for the image being used.
The y origin for the image being used.
The horizontal scaling of the image, as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The vertical scaling of the image, as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The rotation of the image. 0=normal, 90=turned 90 degrees counter-clockwise, etc.

Function.Name: skeleton_attachment_create_colour
Function.Description: This function creates an attachment for the instance's skeletal animation sprite at runtime using a sprite asset from your game, blended with the given colour and alpha value.
Function.Parameter: The name (as a string) of the attachment to create.
The sprite_index to get the attachment image from.
The image_index to get the attachment image from.
The x origin for the image being used.
The y origin for the image being used.
The horizontal scaling of the image, as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The vertical scaling of the image, as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The rotation of the image: 0 = normal, 90 = turned 90 counter-clockwise, etc.
The colour value to use (A constant, integer or hex value).
The alpha value to use (from 0 to 1).

Function.Name: skeleton_attachment_exists
Function.Description: This function checks if a custom attachment has been created using the skeleton_attachment_create() or skeleton_attachment_replace() functions.
Function.Parameter: The name (as a string) of the attachment to check.

Function.Name: skeleton_attachment_replace
Function.Description: This function replaces an existing custom attachment on the current instance's skeletal animation sprite with another one.
Function.Parameter: The name (as a string) of the attachment to create.
The sprite_index to get the attachment image from.
The image_index to get the attachment image from.
The x origin for the image being used.
The y origin for the image being used.
The horizontal scaling of the image, as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The vertical scaling of the image, as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The rotation of the image. 0=normal, 90=turned 90 degrees counter-clockwise, etc.

Function.Name: skeleton_attachment_replace_colour
Function.Description: This function replaces an existing custom attachment on the current instance's skeletal animation sprite with another one and also sets the blend colour to use when drawing this attachment.
Function.Parameter: The name (as a string) of the attachment to create.
The sprite_index to get the attachment image from.
The image_index to get the attachment image from.
The x origin for the image being used.
The y origin for the image being used.
The horizontal scaling of the image, as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The vertical scaling of the image, as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The rotation of the image: 0 = normal, 90 = turned 90 counter-clockwise, etc.
The colour value to use (A constant, integer or hex value).
The alpha value to use (from 0 to 1).

Function.Name: skeleton_attachment_destroy
Function.Description: This function destroys a custom attachment previously created using the skeleton_attachment_create() or skeleton_attachment_replace() functions. Any slots using the attachment will be cleared.
Function.Parameter: The name (as a string) of the attachment to destroy.

Function.Name: skeleton_attachment_get
Function.Description: Using this function you can get the name (as a string) of the attachment for the given slot of the currently assigned skeletal animation sprite.
Function.Parameter: The slot name to get the attachment of.

Function.Name: skeleton_attachment_set
Function.Description: With this function you can set an attachment to a given slot, where you are required to give the names (as strings) of the slot and the attachment.
Function.Parameter: The slot name to get the attachment of.
The name (as a string or a sprite_index) of the attachment image.

Function.Name: skeleton_bone_data_get
Function.Description: This function gets information on the transform of a named bone of the instance's skeletal animation sprite.
Function.Parameter: The name (as a string) of the bone.
The (previously created) DS map that stores the bone data.

Function.Name: skeleton_bone_data_set
Function.Description: This function sets transform data for a named bone of the instance's skeletal animation sprite.
Function.Parameter: The name (as a string) of the bone.
The (previously created) DS map that stores the bone data.

Function.Name: skeleton_bone_list
Function.Description: With this function you can populate a (pre-created) DS list with all the names of the bones used as part of the skeletal animation sprite. The names will be strings and can then be used in the other skeleton animation bone functions for these types of sprite.
Function.Parameter: The sprite index of the Spine skeletal animation to get the list from.
The ID of the DS list to populate with the bone names.

Function.Name: skeleton_bone_state_get
Function.Description: This function sets data related to the transform of a named bone of the instance's skeletal animation sprite.
Function.Parameter: The name (as a string) of the bone.
The (previously created) DS map that stores the bone data.

Function.Name: skeleton_bone_state_set
Function.Description: This function sets data related to the transform of a named bone of the instance's skeletal animation sprite.
Function.Parameter: The name (as a string) of the bone.
The (previously created) DS map that stores the bone data.

Function.Name: draw_skeleton
Function.Description: This function draws a skeletal animation sprite.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to draw.
The name of the animation to get the frame from.
The name of the skin to use.
The animation frame to draw (from 0 to image_number - 1).
The x coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The y coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The horizontal scaling of the sprite, as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The vertical scaling of the sprite, as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The rotation of the sprite. 0=normal, 90=turned 90 degrees counter-clockwise, etc.
The colour with which to blend the sprite.
The alpha of the sprite (from 0 to 1 where 0 is transparent and 1 opaque).

Function.Name: draw_skeleton_collision
Function.Description: This function will draw the collision masks associated with the given skeletal animation.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to draw.
The name of the animation to get the frame from.
The animation frame to draw (from 0 to image_number - 1).
The x coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The y coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The horizontal scaling of the sprite, as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The vertical scaling of the sprite, as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The rotation of the sprite. 0=normal, 90=turned 90 degrees counter-clockwise, etc.
The colour with which to blend the sprite.

Function.Name: draw_skeleton_instance
Function.Description: This function draws the skeletal animation sprite assigned to a particular instance.
Function.Parameter: The index of the instance to draw the sprite from.
The name of the animation to get the frame from.
The name of the skin to use.
The animation frame to draw (from 0 to image_number - 1).
The x coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The y coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The horizontal scaling of the sprite, as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The vertical scaling of the sprite, as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The rotation of the sprite. 0=normal, 90=turned 90 degrees counter-clockwise, etc.
The colour with which to blend the sprite.
The alpha of the sprite (from 0 to 1 where 0 is transparent and 1 opaque).

Function.Name: draw_skeleton_time
Function.Description: This function will draw the given animation using the given skin at a specific time in the animation. The time value should be between 0 (the beginning) and the end duration of the animation, which you can find using the function skeleton_animation_get_duration().
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to draw.
The name of the animation to get the frame from.
The name of the skin to use for drawing.
The time-frame to draw the animation at (from 0 to the end duration, in seconds).
The x coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The y coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The horizontal scaling of the sprite, as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The vertical scaling of the sprite, as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The rotation of the sprite. 0 = normal, 90 = turned 90 degrees counter-clockwise, etc.
The colour with which to blend the sprite.

Function.Name: skeleton_collision_draw_set
Function.Description: With this function, you can toggle on (true) or off (false) drawing the collision data for the current skeletal animation sprite being used by the instance. If this is switched on, the bounding box and the precise collision mask will be drawn as outlines around the sprite.
Function.Parameter: Set to true to turn on drawing, and false to turn it off.

Function.Name: skeleton_get_bounds
Function.Description: This function will return an array of values associated with any given bounding box for the currently assigned skeleton animation sprite.
Function.Parameter: The bounding box index to get the values of.

Function.Name: skeleton_get_minmax
Function.Description:
This function will return an array with the total bounding box value for all the individual bounding boxes assigned to a skeleton animation sprite. The returned array will have 4 elements:
[0] - the minimum x position for all bounding boxes
[1] - the minimum y position for all bounding boxes
[2] - the maximum x position for all bounding boxes
[3] - the maximum y position for all bounding boxes

Function.Name: skeleton_get_num_bounds
Function.Description: This function will return the number of bounding boxes associated with the skeleton animation sprite assigned to the instance running the code. This can then be used along with the function skeleton_get_bounds() to retrieve data about each of the bounding boxes.

Function.Name: skeleton_skin_create
Function.Description: Creates a new skin by combining one or more skins defined in the sprite. This can be used (for example) to combine multiple skins defining different pieces of clothing or accessories on a character sprite.
Function.Parameter: The name of the skin to create.
Array of skin names defined in the sprite to combine.

Function.Name: skeleton_skin_get
Function.Description: With skeletal animation sprites, you can assign separate textures (called "skins") to the animation, thereby using one animation for multiple different things. This function will return the name of the skin (as a string) that is currently assigned to the skeletal animation sprite your instance is using.

Function.Name: skeleton_skin_list
Function.Description: With this function you can populate a (pre-created) DS list with all the names of the skins included as part of the skeletal animation sprite. The names will be strings and can then be used in the other skeleton animation skin functions for these types of sprite.
Function.Parameter: The sprite index of the Spine skeletal animation to get the list from.
The ID of the DS list to populate with the animation names.

Function.Name: skeleton_skin_set
Function.Description: This function sets the skin used to draw a skeletal animation sprite.
Function.Parameter: The name (a string) of the skin to use (or a reference returned by the skeleton_skin_create() function).

Function.Name: skeleton_find_slot
Function.Description: With this function you can find which slots are at a specified room-space position in the Spine sprite associated with the current instance. Note that the list is always sorted in descending order starting from the top-most slot.
Function.Parameter: The x position in the room to check.
The y position in the room to check.
The ID of the DS list to populate with the DS maps.

Function.Name: skeleton_slot_alpha_get
Function.Description: With this function you can get an attachment slot alpha value.
Function.Parameter: The slot name to check, a string

Function.Name: skeleton_slot_colour_get
Function.Description: With this function you can get an attachment slot colour.
Function.Parameter: The slot name to check, a string

Function.Name: skeleton_slot_colour_set
Function.Description: With this function you can set an attachment slot colour and alpha so all sprites attached to it will be drawn with these blend values. Keep in mind that the instance's sprite can have a blend colour and alpha setting (image_blend and image_alpha), as can the attachment (see the function skeleton_attachment_create_colour()), and so the final colour and alpha that the assigned attachment sprite for the slot will have will be a composite of all these values.
Function.Parameter: The slot name to set, a string
The colour to set, either an integer, a constant, or a hex value.
The alpha to set from 0 to 1.

Function.Name: skeleton_slot_data
Function.Description: With this function you can populate a (pre-created) DS list with data for each of the available attachment slots that an animation contains. This data is returned in the forum of a DS map.
Function.Parameter: The sprite index of the Spine skeletal animation to get the data from.
The ID of the DS list to populate with the DS maps.

Function.Name: skeleton_slot_data_instance
Function.Description: With this function you can populate a (pre-created) DS list with data for each of the available attachment slots for the Spine sprite associated with the current instance (including any attachment modifications). This data is returned in the forum of a DS map.
Function.Parameter: The ID of the DS list to populate with the DS maps.

Function.Name: skeleton_slot_list
Function.Description: With this function you can populate a (pre-created) DS list with all the names of the slots created as part of the skeletal animation sprite. The names will be strings and can then be used in the other skeleton animation slot functions for these types of sprite.
Function.Parameter: The sprite index of the Spine skeletal animation to get the list from.
The ID of the DS list to populate with the bone names.

Function.Name: sprite_get_bbox_bottom
Function.Description: This function returns the relative position of the bottom of the sprite bounding box. This value is given as a relative value based on the upper left corner of the base sprite asset being (0, 0). it is the same value as can be found in the sprite editor for the collision mask properties.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to check.

Function.Name: sprite_get_bbox_left
Function.Description: This function returns the relative position of the left of the sprite bounding box. This value is given as a relative value based on the upper left corner of the base sprite asset being (0, 0). it is the same value as can be found in the sprite editor for the collision mask properties.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to check.

Function.Name: sprite_get_bbox_mode
Function.Description: This function will return the current "mode" for the bounding box calculations.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to check.

Function.Name: sprite_get_bbox_right
Function.Description: This function returns the relative position of the right of the sprite bounding box. This value is given as a relative value based on the upper left corner of the base sprite asset being (0, 0). it is the same value as can be found in the sprite editor for the collision mask properties.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to check.

Function.Name: sprite_get_bbox_top
Function.Description: This function returns the relative position of the top of the sprite bounding box. This value is given as a relative value based on the upper left corner of the base sprite asset being (0, 0). it is the same value as can be found in the sprite editor for the collision mask properties.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to check.

Function.Name: sprite_get_height
Function.Description: With this function you can find the height of the base sprite asset, with no transforms, in pixels.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to find the height of.

Function.Name: sprite_get_info
Function.Description: This function is used to retrieve information for the given sprite.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to get the information for.

Function.Name: sprite_get_convex_hull
Function.Description: This function is used to generate the points of a convex hull for the given sprite. The function returns an array of reals defining the points of the convex hull.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to generate the convex hull of.
Use this parameter to specify the maximum number of points that can be returned. (If you are intending to generate a physics polygon shape from the points the maximum is 32)
Use this parameter to specify a specific sprite sub-index to use (defaults to 0)

Function.Name: sprite_get_name
Function.Description: This function will return the name as a string of the specified sprite.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to get the name of.

Function.Name: sprite_get_nineslice
Function.Description: This function returns the Nine Slice struct for a sprite, containing all its Nine Slice properties as set in the Sprite Editor or using sprite_set_nineslice().
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite from which the Nine Slice struct will be retrieved

Function.Name: sprite_get_number
Function.Description: A sprite has to have at least one sub-image and this function will return just how many it has.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite.

Function.Name: sprite_get_speed
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the sprite speed as defined for the sprite asset in the Sprite Editor. Note that the return value will be different depending on the type of speed that was applied in the Sprite Editor, either Frames Per Second, or Frames Per Game Frame.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to get the speed of

Function.Name: sprite_get_speed_type
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the sprite animation type as defined for the sprite asset in the Sprite Editor.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to get the animation type of

Function.Name: sprite_get_texture
Function.Description: This function returns a special pointer for the sprite texture page. This value can then be used in other draw functions, particularly in the 2D primitive functions, as well as the Shader functions.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to use.
The sub-image of the sprite to use.

Function.Name: sprite_get_tpe
Function.Description: This function will return a special value that relates to the position of the given sprite and sub-image on the texture page used by your game.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to find the texture page entry of.
The image index of the sprite.

Function.Name: sprite_get_uvs
Function.Description:
This function returns an array with the UV coordinates and other data for the texture of the sprite sub-image on the texture page. The function returns an array with the following 8 elements:
[0] = left
[1] = top
[2] = right
[3] = bottom
[4] = amount of pixels the asset compiler has trimmed from the sprite's left side
[5] = amount of pixels the asset compiler has trimmed from the sprite's top side
[6] = normalised percentage of pixel data from the original sprite's width that has been saved to the texture page
[7] = normalised percentage of pixel data from the original sprite's height that has been saved to the texture page
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to use.
The sub-image of the sprite to use.

Function.Name: sprite_get_width
Function.Description: With this function you can find the width of the base asset sprite, with no transforms, in pixels.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to find the width of.

Function.Name: sprite_get_xoffset
Function.Description: This function returns the x offset of the origin of the given sprite.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to find the xoffset of.

Function.Name: sprite_get_yoffset
Function.Description: This function returns the y offset of the origin of the given sprite.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to find the yoffset of.

Function.Name: sprite_add
Function.Description: With this function you can add an image as a sprite, loading it from an external source where the image file to be loaded should always be in either *.png, *.gif, *.jpg/jpeg or *.json format (*json files are used for loading skeleton animation sprites made with Spine). If you use this function with HTML5 or are getting an image from a URL, this function will also generate an Image Loaded asynchronous event.
Function.Parameter: The name (a string file path) of the file to add.
Use to indicate the number of sub-images (1 for a single image or for a *.gif).
Indicates whether to make all pixels with the background colour (left-bottom pixel) transparent.
Indicates whether to smooth the edges if transparent.
Indicate the x position of the origin in the sprite.
Indicate the y position of the origin in the sprite.

Function.Name: sprite_add_ext
Function.Description: With this function you can asynchronously add an image as a sprite, loading it from an external source where the image file to be loaded should always be in either *.png, *.gif, *.jpg/jpeg or *.json format (*json files are used for loading skeleton animation sprites made with Spine). This function will generate an Image Loaded asynchronous event when the sprite has been loaded.
Function.Parameter: The name (a string file path) of the file to add.
Use to indicate the number of sub-images (1 for a single image or for a *.gif).
Indicate the x position of the origin in the sprite.
Indicate the y position of the origin in the sprite.
Indicates whether the sprite should be loaded to GPU memory.

Function.Name: sprite_add_from_surface
Function.Description: This function works in exactly the same way as sprite_create_from_surface() only instead of creating a new sprite from the area of the indexed surface that you select, it adds the defined area of the surface as a new sub-image to a previously created sprite.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to add the new image to.
The index of the surface from which the get the image.
The x position to copy from.
The y position to copy from.
The width of the area to be copied (from the x position).
The height of the area to be copied (from the y position).
Indicates whether to make all pixels with the background colour (left-bottom pixel) transparent.
Indicates whether to smooth the edges.

Function.Name: sprite_assign
Function.Description: This function takes two previously created (or included) sprite indexes, and copies the image from one to the other. In this way you can copy (or "clone") one sprite into another index. Note that you cannot copy to a game asset. You have to have created the sprite to be copied to previously using the sprite_add() or sprite_duplicate() functions.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to be copied to (i.e.: overwritten).
The sprite to be copied from.

Function.Name: sprite_collision_mask
Function.Description: With this function you can set the properties of the collision mask that a sprite should have. If you select either automatic (0) or full image (1) as the bounding box mode then the individual bounding box values can be set to 0. However, for a user-defined mask (2) you will have to set these values.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to set the bounding box of.
Whether to create collision masks for each sub-image of the sprite (true), or one mask for all (false).
What kind of bounding box to use. 0 = automatic, 1 = full image, 2 = user-defined.
The maximum left position of the bounding box.
The maximum top position of the bounding box.
The maximum right position of the bounding box.
The maximum bottom position of the bounding box.
The kind of mask, a constant.
Indicates the tolerance in the transparency value (0 = no tolerance, 255 = full tolerance).

Function.Name: sprite_create_from_surface
Function.Description: With this function you can create a sprite from a previously initialised surface (the surface index ID value is returned when you create the surface using surface_create()).
Function.Parameter: The index of the surface to create from.
The x position to copy from.
The y position to copy from.
The width of the area to be copied (from the x position).
The height of the area to be copied (from the y position).
Indicates whether to make all pixels with the background colour (left-bottom pixel) transparent.
Indicates whether to smooth the edges.
Indicates the x position of the origin in the sprite.
Indicates the y position of the origin in the sprite.

Function.Name: sprite_delete
Function.Description: This function will delete a sprite from the game, freeing any memory that was reserved for it. This cannot be used to delete sprites that are included in the game as part of the assets in the Asset Browser.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to be deleted.

Function.Name: sprite_duplicate
Function.Description: This function will return the index of a newly created sprite that is a duplicate (copy) of the one input as the "index" argument. If the function fails, -1 is returned.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to duplicate.

Function.Name: sprite_exists
Function.Description: This function returns whether a sprite with the specified index exists or not in the project being run.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to check.

Function.Name: sprite_flush
Function.Description: With this function you can remove the given texture page for the given sprite from texture memory. Note that the function will return -1 if flush is not supported for the chosen asset, or it will return 0 if all worked correctly.
Function.Parameter: The index (asset name) of the sprite asset to flush

Function.Name: sprite_flush_multi
Function.Description: This function removes any number of texture pages for the given sprites from texture memory. Note that the function will return -1 if flush is not supported for the chosen resources, or it will return 0 if all worked correctly.
Function.Parameter: Array with the sprite indices to flush

Function.Name: sprite_merge
Function.Description:
This function will merge the sprite indexed in argument 1 ("ind2") with that which is indexed in argument 0 ("ind1"). The images themselves are NOT merged together, but rather the image indices are merged, with the sub images from sprite "ind2" appended onto those of sprite "ind1", i.e.: they are added on at the end.
Note that if the sprites are different sizes, then the appended sprites are stretched to fit the image size for "ind1".
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to merge.
The index of the sprite that ind1 is to be merged with.

Function.Name: sprite_nineslice_create
Function.Description: This function is used to create a Nine Slice struct which can be modified and then applied to a sprite.

Function.Name: sprite_prefetch
Function.Description: This function can be used to prefetch (place into texture memory) a texture page with the given sprite. Note that the function will return -1 if prefetch is not supported for the chosen asset or the target platform is HTML5, or it will return 0 if all worked correctly.
Function.Parameter: The sprite index to fetch

Function.Name: sprite_prefetch_multi
Function.Description: This function can be used to prefetch (place into texture memory) a number of texture pages that contain the sprites given. Note that the function will return -1 if prefetch is not supported for the chosen asset or the target platform is HTML5, or it will return 0 if all worked correctly.
Function.Parameter: Array with the sprite indices to fetch

Function.Name: sprite_replace
Function.Description: This function works in almost the exact same manner as sprite_add(), only instead of returning the index of the sprite you are importing, it overwrites a previously created sprite index.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to permanently replace.
The filename of the image to make the new sprite.
The number of frames the sprite will be cut up into horizontally. 1 = one single image / *.gif.
Indicates whether to make all pixels with the background colour (left-bottom pixel) transparent.
Indicates whether to smooth the edges.
The x coordinate of the origin, relative to the sprite's top-left corner.
The y coordinate of the origin, relative to the sprite's top-left corner.

Function.Name: sprite_save
Function.Description: This function can be used to save any sub-image of a sprite to disc, giving it the specified filename. The sprite must have been added at runtime (you cannot save sprites added through the IDE) and the file must be saved with a *.png extension.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to save.
The sub-image of the sprite to save.
The filename for the saved sprite.

Function.Name: sprite_save_strip
Function.Description: This function will create a strip image from all the sub-images in a sprite, saving it to disc with the specified filename. The sprite must have been added at runtime (you cannot save sprites added through the IDE) and the file must be saved with a *.png extension.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to change the transparency map of.
The filename for the saved sprite strip.

Function.Name: sprite_set_alpha_from_sprite
Function.Description: This function uses the value/saturation of one sprite and multiplies it with the alpha of the target sprite. Ideally the sprite being used to generate the new alpha map should be grey-scale, with the white areas having an equivalent alpha value of 1 (opaque), the black areas being equivalent to alpha 0 (transparent), and the grey areas being an alpha in between 0 and 1.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to change the transparency map of.
The index of the sprite to take the transparency map data from.

Function.Name: sprite_set_bbox
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the bounding box values for a sprite. The positions are absolute values, where the (0, 0) position corresponds to the top-left corner of the sprite, regardless of the offset for the sprite, any "empty" pixels the sprite may have, or where it is being drawn in the room.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to set the bounding box on.
The left side of the bounding box
The top of the bounding box.
The right side of the bounding box
The bottom of the bounding box.

Function.Name: sprite_set_bbox_mode
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the bounding box mode for a sprite.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to change the mode of.
The mode to set (a constant).

Function.Name: sprite_set_cache_size
Function.Description: This function is used on HTML5 to set how many blended copies of the given sprite to cache before old ones are overwritten (default is 4). This is applied to all sub-images of the sprite.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to change the cache size of.
The maximum number of cached copies of the sprite that can be stored.

Function.Name: sprite_set_cache_size_ext
Function.Description: This function is used on HTML5 to set how many blended copies of the given sprite can be cached before old ones are overwritten (default is 4). This is applied to the given sub-image of the sprite.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to change the cache size of.
The sub-image of ind to change the cache size of.
The maximum number of cached copies of the sprite that can be stored.

Function.Name: sprite_set_nineslice
Function.Description: This function is used to apply a Nine Slice struct to a sprite.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to modify
The Nine Slice struct to apply

Function.Name: sprite_set_offset
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the x and y origin of a sprite, and takes relative values based on the (0, 0) position being the upper left corner of the sprite.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to change the offset of.
The x position of the origin.
The y position of the origin.

Function.Name: sprite_set_speed
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the base animation speed and type for the sprite asset. This is normally set in the Sprite Editor, but there may be moments when you are required to set this manually for a given sprite.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to get the animation type of

Function.Name: tileset_get_name
Function.Description: This function will return the name as a string of the specified tile set. This name is the one that has been specified for the tile set in the Asset Browser of the main GameMaker window.
Function.Parameter: The index of the tile set to get the name of.

Function.Name: tileset_get_texture
Function.Description: This function returns a special pointer for the tile set texture page. This value can then be used in other draw functions, particularly in the 2D primitive functions, as well as the Shader functions.
Function.Parameter: The index of the tile set to use.

Function.Name: tileset_get_uvs
Function.Description:
This function returns an array with the UV coordinates and other data for the texture of the given tile set on the texture page. The function returns an array with the following 8 elements:
[0] = left
[1] = top
[2] = right
[3] = bottom
[4] = amount of pixels the asset compiler has trimmed from the tile set left side
[5] = amount of pixels the asset compiler has trimmed from the tile set top side
[6] = normalised percentage of pixel data from the original tile set width that has been saved to the texture page
[7] = normalised percentage of pixel data from the original tile set height that has been saved to the texture page
Function.Parameter: The index of the tile set to use.

Function.Name: tileset_get_info
Function.Description: This function is used to retrieve information about the given tileset.
Function.Parameter: The index of the tile set to get the name of.

Function.Name: timeline_add
Function.Description: With this function you can add a new (empty) time line into your game. You should make sure to use the function timeline_delete() whenever you no longer wish it to prevent any possible memory leaks. To add moments to a timeline created in this way, see the function timeline_moment_add_script().

Function.Name: timeline_clear
Function.Description: With this function you can clear a specific time line of "moments", removing all codes and actions for that time line and leaving it empty.
Function.Parameter: The index of the time line to clear.

Function.Name: timeline_delete
Function.Description: This function delete the given time line from your game.
Function.Parameter: The index of the time line to delete.

Function.Name: timeline_exists
Function.Description: With this function you can check and see whether a time line exists (returns true) or not (returns false).
Function.Parameter: The index of the time line to check for.

Function.Name: timeline_get_name
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the name of a time line as a string.
Function.Parameter: The index of the time line to check the name of.

Function.Name: timeline_max_moment
Function.Description: This function will return the value of the moment in which the timeline performs its final action.
Function.Parameter: The index of the timeline to get the last moment of.

Function.Name: timeline_moment_add_script
Function.Description: With this function you can dynamically add a script function to Timelines at any given "moment" within that time line, where a "moment" is the equivalent of one game tick (or step).
Function.Parameter: The index of the time line to add a moment to.
The moment (step) to add to.
The index of the script function to add into the moment.

Function.Name: timeline_moment_clear
Function.Description: With this function you can clear a specific moment of any previously defined time line of all codes and actions.
Function.Parameter: The index of the time line to clear.
The moment to clear.

Function.Name: timeline_size
Function.Description: With this function you can get the total number of active moments for a timeline (an "active" moment is one which has GML Code or GML Visual added to it).
Function.Parameter: The index of the timeline get the information from.

Function.Name: achievement_available
Function.Description: This function will return true if the user is currently connected to the internet and the chosen leaderboard and achievement system is available, otherwise it will return false.

Function.Name: achievement_get_challenges
Function.Description: This function will send a request to the server for information on all current challenges and will trigger a callback Social Asynchronous Event which contains the async_load map populated with the relevant key/value pairs. The id key of this DS Map is used to identify the correct callback (there can be more than one trigger function for any given asynchronous event), and will be paired with the constant achievement_challenge_list_received as well as a number of other key/value pairs for each challenge.

Function.Name: achievement_get_pic
Function.Description: This function will send a request to the server for the image of a player or a friend and will trigger a callback Social Asynchronous Event which contains the async_load map populated with the relevant key/value pairs. The id key of this DS Map is used to identify the correct callback (there can be more than one trigger function for any given asynchronous event), and will be paired with the constant achievement_pic_loaded as well as a number of other key/value pairs.
Function.Parameter: The id of the person to get the image of (either from a friends list or a leaderboard)

Function.Name: achievement_increment
Function.Description: Games can have achievements with no completion value and so you can use this function to increment those achievement by a given amount. On Android, you send the ID of the achievement as a string (this is the unique achievement ID that got assigned when you set up the achievement), while on all other platforms you supply the defined achievement name as a string, and then you give the actual achievement value to increment by.
Function.Parameter: The name/id of the achievement.
The value to be sent as an increment.

Function.Name: achievement_load_friends
Function.Description: This function will send a request to the server for information on all the logged in users friends and will trigger a callback Social Asynchronous Event which contains the async_load map populated with the relevant key/value pairs. The id key of this DS Map is used to identify the correct callback (there can be more than one trigger function for any given asynchronous event), and will be paired with the constant achievement_friends_info as well as a number of other key/value pairs for each friend.

Function.Name: achievement_load_leaderboard
Function.Description: below)
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the leaderboard as shown on the developer dashboard.
The starting index value to get the leaderboard data from.
The maximum index value to get the leaderboard data from.
Whether to filter the results to those that are on your friends list or to all players

Function.Name: achievement_load_progress
Function.Description: This function will send a request to the server for information on all available achievements. It will trigger a callback Social Asynchronous Event which contains the async_load map populated with the relevant key/value pairs. The id key of this DS Map is used to identify the correct callback (there can be more than one trigger function for any given asynchronous event), and will be paired with the constant achievement_achievement_info as well as a number of other key/value pairs for each player.

Function.Name: achievement_login
Function.Description: This function logs the user into appropriate leaderboard and achievement service. If the service is not available, the user is logged into a "pretend" game centre and all achievements and scores are stored on the device so that when the actual service is available, these details can be uploaded. The function will trigger a callback Social Asynchronous Event which contains the async_load map populated with the relevant key/value pairs. The id key of this DS Map is used to identify the correct callback (there can be more than one trigger function for any given asynchronous event), and will be paired with the constant achievement_our_info as well as a number of other key/value pairs for each challenge.

Function.Name: achievement_login_status
Function.Description: This function is currently only useful for Google Play on the Android platform. It will check to see if the user is already logged into Google services, in which case it will return true, or not, returning false. If it returns true there is no need to call the achievement_login() function.

Function.Name: achievement_logout
Function.Description: This function logs the user out of the chosen leaderboard and achievement service. This will stop all further achievements and scores from being recorded.

Function.Name: achievement_post
Function.Description: You can use this function to send your achievements to the chosen leaderboard and achievement service. On Android you will need the the ID of the achievement as a string (this is the unique achievement ID that got assigned when you set up the achievement), while on all other platforms you supply the achievement name as a string, and then you give the percentage that you have completed towards getting the achievement (0 - None, 100 - Completed). The function will trigger a Social Asynchronous Event where the returned async_load DS map will have the following key/value pairs:
Function.Parameter: The name/ID of the achievement.
The percentage of the achievement completed.

Function.Name: achievement_post_score
Function.Description: You can use this function to send your score to the chosen leaderboard and achievement service. On Android, you send the ID of the score table as a string (this is the unique leaderboard ID that got assigned when you set up the leaderboard), while on all other platforms you supply the defined leaderboard name as a string, and then you give the actual score value. The function will trigger a Social Asynchronous Event where the returned async_load DS map will have the following key/value pairs:
Function.Parameter: The name/ID of the leaderboard.
The score to be sent.

Function.Name: achievement_reset
Function.Description: This function will reset all achievements back to their initial values for the game. This function is provided as a debug function and it is not recommended that you permit the end-user to do this in your games.

Function.Name: achievement_send_challenge
Function.Description: This function will send a challenge across the network to the chosen player. You can get the playerid using the achievement_load_friends() or the achievement_load_leaderboard() functions and you must also supply the challengeid which is the unique value given the challenge when you created it on your iTunes Connect or Google Play dashboard. You must also supply a score, and a short text message as well as set the challenge type. This can be one of the following constants:
Function.Parameter: The unique ID of the player to challenge.
The unique challenge ID (as found on the provider dashboard).
The score to beat.
the type of challenge to be issued - one of two constants.
The message to attach to the challenge.

Function.Name: achievement_show_achievements
Function.Description: This function will open the achievements page for the chosen platform. Please note that this is an asynchronous function, i.e.: your game will continue to run in the background while the achievements page is being shown. As such, you should be careful where you use this and make sure to pause the game or only permit it to be shown in areas of your game where it will not interfere with the game-play.

Function.Name: achievement_show_challenge_notifications
Function.Description: With this function you can show, or suppress, the various different "toast" pop-up notifications relating to challenges. When the arguments are set to true these messages will appear, informing the player of any local or remote challenges received as well as those challenges that have been completed, while setting them to false will suppress these notifications.
Function.Parameter: Show challenges received pop-up (true) or not (false).
Show completed local challenges pop-up (true) or not (false).
Show completed remote challenges pop-up (true) or not (false).

Function.Name: achievement_show_leaderboards
Function.Description: This function will open the leaderboards page for the chosen platform. Please note that this is an asynchronous function, i.e.: your game will continue to run in the background while the leaderboards page is being shown. As such, you should be careful where you use this and make sure to pause the game or only permit it to be shown in areas of your game where it will not interfere with the game-play.

Function.Name: cloud_file_save
Function.Description: This function will commit a file to the chosen cloud service for storage. The function will return a unique id value that should then be used in the appropriate asynchronous event to identify the DS map that is returned as a "call back" from the cloud service. The file should contain all the information that you need to save for your game as you can only store one single "data blob" to the cloud, and running this function again will overwrite any previously stored values (as will using the cloud_string_save() function). The description should be a short string of information that describes the save, e.g.: "Level2, Stage2".
Function.Parameter: The file to be uploaded (as a string).
A brief description of the data being stored.

Function.Name: cloud_string_save
Function.Description: This function will commit a string to the chosen cloud service for storage. The function will return a unique id value that should then be used in the appropriate asynchronous event to identify the DS map that is returned as a "call back" from the cloud service. The string should contain all the information that you need to save for your game as you can only store one single "data blob" to the cloud, and running this function again will overwrite any previously stored values (as will using the cloud_file_save() function). The description should be a short string of information that describes the save, e.g.: "Level2, Stage2".
Function.Parameter: The data string to be uploaded.
A brief description of the data being stored.

Function.Name: cloud_synchronise
Function.Description: This function would normally be called at the start of a new game and is used to retrieve the current status of the cloud service at game start up. The function returns a unique id value which would then be used in the Asynchronous Cloud Event to retrieve the relevant information from the DS map that is created.

Function.Name: get_integer_async
Function.Description: This function opens a window and displays a message as well as a space for the user to input a value. This is an asynchronous function that triggers an asynchronous Dialog event with the event's information held in the variable async_load.
Function.Parameter: The message to show in the dialog.
The default value.

Function.Name: get_login_async
Function.Description: This function opens a window that asks the user to input a username and password. This is an asynchronous function that triggers an asynchronous Dialog event with the event's information held in the variable async_load.
Function.Parameter: The default user name
The default password

Function.Name: get_string_async
Function.Description: This function opens a window and displays a message as well as a space for the user to input a string. This is an asynchronous function that triggers an asynchronous Dialog event with the event's information held in the variable async_load.
Function.Parameter: The message to show in the dialog.
The default string.

Function.Name: shop_leave_rating
Function.Description: This function opens up an OS dependent dialog where you can ask the user to post a rating or comment to a particular page. You can define the text that is to appear in the dialogue, as well as the text you wish to appear on the two buttons and the URL where the comment has to be posted.
Function.Parameter: Text that appears on the dialog.
Text that appears on the "yes" button.
Text that appears on the "no" button.
The full URL where the comment has to be sent.

Function.Name: show_message_async
Function.Description: This function opens a window and displays the message you define in the function to the user.This is an asynchronous function that triggers an asynchronous Dialog event with the event's information held in the variable async_load.
Function.Parameter: The message to show to the user.

Function.Name: show_question_async
Function.Description: This function opens a window and displays the question you define in the function to the user.This is an asynchronous function that triggers an asynchronous Dialog event with the event's information held in the variable async_load.
Function.Parameter: The question to ask to the user.

Function.Name: http_get
Function.Description: This function sends a GET request to the specified URL in order to retrieve information.
Function.Parameter: The web address of the server that you wish to get information from

Function.Name: http_get_connect_timeout
Function.Description: This function returns the connection timeout value in milliseconds used for HTTP requests.

Function.Name: http_get_file
Function.Description: This function connects to the specified URL in order to retrieve information in the form of a file.
Function.Parameter: The web address of the server that you wish to get file from
The local storage path to save the file to

Function.Name: http_get_request_crossorigin
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the cross-origin type set for HTML5 games and will return a string (on all other platforms an empty string "" will be returned).

Function.Name: http_post_string
Function.Description: This function posts a string using the HTTP POST method.
Function.Parameter: The web address of the server that you wish to get information from
The string you wish to send to the specified URL

Function.Name: http_request
Function.Description: This function creates a generic HTTP request and sends it.
Function.Parameter: The web address of the server that you wish to get information from
The request method (normally "POST" or "GET", but all methods are supported)
A DS map with the required header fields
The data to be transmitted following the headers (can be a binary buffer handle)

Function.Name: http_set_connect_timeout
Function.Description: This function sets the connection timeout used for HTTP requests. Any requests made after a call to this function will use this timeout.
Function.Parameter: The connect timeout (in milliseconds)

Function.Name: http_set_request_crossorigin
Function.Description:
With this function you can set the cross-origin type to use when loading images from a file (using sprite_add()), or sending custom HTTP requests to servers (e.g. using http_post_string()).
The function is exclusively for the HTML5 platform.
Function.Parameter: The cross origin type to use

Function.Name: push_cancel_local_notification
Function.Description: This function cancels the given push notification. You can get the ID for the notification to cancel using the functions push_get_first_local_notification() and push_get_next_local_notification() and the function will return true on success or false otherwise (for example if the notification does not exist or has already been triggered).
Function.Parameter: The ID of the notification to cancel.

Function.Name: push_get_first_local_notification
Function.Description: This function will populate a pre-made DS map with a series of key/value pairs for the first local push notification in the queue to be shown. It returns -1 if there are no notifications queued, or a real value otherwise representing the ID for the notification. This ID can then be used to cancel the notification using the function push_cancel_local_notification().
Function.Parameter: The DS Map ID to use.

Function.Name: push_get_next_local_notification
Function.Description: This function will populate a pre-made DS map with a series of key/value pairs for the next local push notification in the queue to be shown. It returns -1 if there are no further notifications queued, or a real value otherwise representing the ID for the notification. This ID can then be used to cancel the notification using the function push_cancel_local_notification(). You should call the function push_get_first_local_notification() to get the first notification in the queue and then use this function to continue through it.
Function.Parameter: The DS Map ID to use.

Function.Name: push_local_notification
Function.Description: This function can be used to set a local notification to be shown on a given date at a given time. The "fire_time" is the date/time that the notification should be pushed to the user device (you can use the GameMaker Date and Time Functions to get this), and you can give the notification a title and a message text as well as a payload string which will be passed to your game when the users taps the notification.
Function.Parameter: The date/time to fire the off the notification
The notification title (a string)
The notification message text (a string)
The data package to send to your game (a string)

Function.Name: buffer_async_group_begin
Function.Description: This function is called when you want to begin the saving out of multiple buffers to multiple files.
Function.Parameter: The name of the group (as a string).

Function.Name: buffer_async_group_end
Function.Description: This function finishes the definition of a buffer async group and starts the saving of the files.

Function.Name: buffer_async_group_option
Function.Description: This function sets some platform-specific options for the buffer group being saved/loaded.
Function.Parameter: The option to set.
The value to set (can be string or real, depending on the option).

Function.Name: buffer_base64_decode
Function.Description: This function decodes a base64 encoded string (created using the buffer_base64_encode function) into a new buffer.
Function.Parameter: The base64 encoded string to decode

Function.Name: buffer_base64_decode_ext
Function.Description: This function decodes a base64 encoded string (created using the buffer_base64_encode function) into a buffer.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to decode the string into.
The base64 encoded string to decode.
The data offset value.

Function.Name: buffer_base64_encode
Function.Description: This function converts the data in the given buffer into a base64 encoded string.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to use.
The data offset value.
The size of the buffer.

Function.Name: buffer_compress
Function.Description: With this function you can compress part (or all) of a buffer using zlib compression. The function will return a new buffer ID value for the compressed buffer, or a value less than 0 if it has failed for any reason. This function will not alter the original buffer.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to compress.
The offset within the buffer to compress (in bytes).
The size of the buffer area to compress (in bytes).

Function.Name: buffer_copy
Function.Description: This function can be used to copy a segment (or all) of the data stored in one buffer to another.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to copy from.
The data offset to start copying from (in bytes).
The size of the data to copy (in bytes).
The index of the buffer to copy to.
The offset position to copy the data to (in bytes).

Function.Name: buffer_copy_stride
Function.Description: This function can be used to copy multiple data entries from one buffer to another, with the ability to specify different strides between individual entries in both the source and the destination buffers. The function takes into account the types of both buffers. If a buffer has a fixed size or is not a wrap buffer, the copying process will stop when the read or write position exceeds the buffer's range. Initial read and write positions can be negative, in which case they are computed from the end of given buffer.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to copy from.
The data offset to start copying from (in bytes). If negative, then the offset is computed from the end of the buffer.
The size of a single data entry (in bytes). Must be a non-negative value.
The number of bytes from the beginning of one entry to the beginning of the following entry in the source buffer. If negative, then the source buffer is traversed backwards.
The number of data entries to copy. Must be a non-negative value.
The index of the buffer to copy to.
The offset position to copy the data to (in bytes). If negative, then the offset is computed from the end of the buffer.
The desired stride between entries when copied to the destination buffer (in bytes). If negative, then the destination buffer is traversed backwards.

Function.Name: buffer_copy_from_vertex_buffer
Function.Description: This function can be used to copy some (or all) of the vertex data stored in one vertex buffer into a previously created regular buffer. When copying from a vertex buffer into a regular buffer with this function, both buffers must have previously been created (using the vertex_create_buffer() and buffer_create() functions, for example). You can specify the range of vertex data that you wish to copy into the buffer, where the start vertex can be anywhere between 0 and the number of vertices -1, and you can give the number of vertices from that point on to copy. You can use the function vertex_get_number() on the vertex buffer to get the total number of vertices stored. Finally you give the buffer index to copy the vertex data into, as well as a data offset to define the position to copy the vertex data to in the destination buffer.
Function.Parameter: The index of the vertex buffer to copy from.
The starting vertex.
The total number of vertices to use.
The index of the buffer to copy to.
The offset position to copy the data to (in bytes).

Function.Name: buffer_crc32
Function.Description: This function will take input data from a buffer and returns a CRC32 checksum hash, which is a 32 bit integer value for the given region.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to use.
The data offset value.
The size of the buffer.

Function.Name: buffer_create
Function.Description: You use this function to allocate a portion of memory as a buffer in your game, with the function returning the unique buffer id that should be stored in a variable and used for all further function calls to the buffer.
Function.Parameter: The size (in bytes) of the buffer.
The type of buffer to create.
The byte alignment for the buffer

Function.Name: buffer_create_from_vertex_buffer
Function.Description: You use this function to allocate a portion of memory as a buffer in your game filled with the data from a previously created vertex buffer.
Function.Parameter: The vertex buffer index to use.
The type of buffer to create.
The byte alignment for the buffer

Function.Name: buffer_create_from_vertex_buffer_ext
Function.Description: You use this function to allocate a portion of memory as a buffer in your game filled with the data from a previously created vertex buffer.
Function.Parameter: The vertex buffer index to use.
The type of buffer to create.
The byte alignment for the buffer
The starting vertex.
The total number of vertices to copy.

Function.Name: buffer_decompress
Function.Description: With this function you can decompress a previously compressed buffer using zlib compression. If the decompression has failed (for example, you are supplying a buffer that hasn't been compressed) then the function will instead return a value less than 0.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to decompress.

Function.Name: buffer_delete
Function.Description: This function deletes a buffer previously created using buffer_create from memory, releasing the resources used to create it and removing any data that it may currently contain.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to delete.

Function.Name: buffer_exists
Function.Description: This function checks whether the given buffer exists in memory or not. If it does, the function will return true, otherwise it will return false.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to check.

Function.Name: buffer_fill
Function.Description: This function fills a previously created buffer with a given data type and value.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to fill.
The data offset value (in bytes).
The type of data that is to be written to the buffer.
The data to write.
The size of the buffer (in bytes) that you wish to fill.

Function.Name: buffer_get_address
Function.Description: With this function you can get a pointer to the raw, aligned buffer address. This is primarily for use with extensions as you can pass this value through to them, allowing them to access the buffer data.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to use.

Function.Name: buffer_get_alignment
Function.Description: This function gets the byte alignment of the given buffer.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to check.

Function.Name: buffer_get_size
Function.Description: This function gets the size in bytes of the given buffer.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to get the size of.

Function.Name: buffer_get_surface
Function.Description: With this function you can write information from a surface to a given buffer. The buffer must have been created previously and should be a 1-byte aligned buffer large enough to store data for the surface you are going to write.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to use.
The index of the surface to use.
The data offset value (in bytes).

Function.Name: buffer_get_surface_depth
Function.Description: With this function you can write information from a surface's depth buffer to a given buffer. The buffer must have been created previously and should be a 1-byte aligned buffer large enough to store data for the surface you are going to write.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to use.
The index of the surface whose depth buffer to use.
The data offset value (in bytes).

Function.Name: buffer_get_type
Function.Description: This function returns the type of the given buffer.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to check.

Function.Name: buffer_load
Function.Description: This function is used to load a buffer that was previously saved using the buffer_save() functions, as well as any Included Files or files loaded externally.
Function.Parameter: The name of the file to load from.

Function.Name: buffer_load_async
Function.Description: With this function you can load a file that you have created previously using the buffer_save() function (or any of the other functions for saving buffers) into a buffer.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to load.
The name of the file to load.
The offset within the buffer to load to (in bytes).
The size of the buffer area to load (in bytes).

Function.Name: buffer_load_ext
Function.Description: This function will load the buffer data that was previously saved using the buffer_save() functions into an already created buffer.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to load into.
The name of the file to load from.
The offset within the buffer to load to (in bytes).

Function.Name: buffer_load_partial
Function.Description: This function will load some of the buffer data that was previously saved using the buffer_save() functions into an already created buffer.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to load.
The name of the file to load.
The offset within the buffer to load to (in bytes).
The length of the part of the buffer to load (in bytes).
The offset where to start putting the partial data in the new buffer (in bytes).

Function.Name: buffer_md5
Function.Description: This function takes the input data from a given buffer (or part of the buffer) and returns the 32-character hexadecimal MD5 hash that is unique to that data. In this way you can generate a secure key which can be stored and used to check the integrity of the information being sent to (or received from) an external server (for example).
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to use.
The data offset value.
The size of the buffer.

Function.Name: buffer_peek
Function.Description: The buffer_peek function reads a piece of data of a certain type from the given buffer at an arbitrary offset position (in bytes). Contrary to buffer_read(), however, this function doesn't use or change the buffer's current "seek" position.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to use.
The offset position (in bytes) within the buffer to read the given data from.
The type of data that is to be read from the buffer.

Function.Name: buffer_poke
