Function.Description: With this function you can write data into a buffer at the specified offset, without changing the seek position. This is different from buffer_write(), which uses the current seek position as the offset and advances that with the amount of bytes written.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to use.
The offset position (in bytes) within the buffer to write the given data to.
The type of data that is to be written to the buffer.
The data to add to the buffer, in accordance with the type specified.

Function.Name: buffer_read
Function.Description: This function can be used to read data from a previously created buffer. The return value will depend on the type of data that you are reading, which in itself is defined by one of the BufferDataType constants.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to read from.
The type of data that is to be read from the buffer.

Function.Name: buffer_resize
Function.Description: With this function you can resize a given buffer to be the size (in bytes) that you specify.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to change the size of.
The new size of the buffer (in bytes).

Function.Name: buffer_save
Function.Description: With this function you can save the contents of a buffer to a file, ready to be read back into memory using the buffer_load() function.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to save.
The name of the file to save as.

Function.Name: buffer_save_async
Function.Description: This function saves (part of) the contents of a buffer to a file asynchronously, ready to be read back into memory using any of the buffer_load_* functions.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to save.
The name of the file to save as.
The offset within the buffer to save from (in bytes).
The size of the buffer area to save (in bytes).

Function.Name: buffer_save_ext
Function.Description: This function saves (part of) the contents of a buffer to a file, ready to be read back into memory using the buffer_load() function.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to save.
The name of the file to save as.
The offset within the buffer to save from (in bytes).
The size of the buffer area to save (in bytes).

Function.Name: buffer_seek
Function.Description:
This function moves the seek position of a buffer, setting it relative to the start, end or current seek position (that which was last used when reading or writing data).
The seek position is the offset (in bytes) from the start of the buffer where new values are written, and from where values are read. It also moves automatically when you read from or write to a buffer.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to use.
The base position to seek.
The data offset value.

Function.Name: buffer_set_surface
Function.Description: This function writes information from a buffer to a given surface.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to use.
The index of the surface to use.
The data offset value.

Function.Name: buffer_set_surface_depth
Function.Description: This function copies data from a buffer into a surface's depth buffer.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to use.
The index of the surface whose depth buffer to use.
The data offset value.

Function.Name: buffer_get_used_size
Function.Description: This function returns the used size of the given buffer. The used size is the number of bytes that have been written to the buffer.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to use.

Function.Name: buffer_set_used_size
Function.Description: This function sets the "used" size of the given buffer, which is the number of bytes that have been written to it. It is primarily for use within extensions.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to use.
The number of bytes to set as the "used" size.

Function.Name: buffer_sha1
Function.Description: This function takes input data from a buffer and returns a 160 bit message digest in ASCII format. In this way you can generate a secure key which can be stored and used to check the integrity of the information being sent to (or received from) an external server (for example).
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to use.
The data offset value.
The size of the buffer.

Function.Name: buffer_sizeof
Function.Description: This function returns the size (in bytes) of the given buffer data type.
Function.Parameter: The type of data that is to be checked

Function.Name: buffer_tell
Function.Description: This function gets the current "seek" position for use in other buffer functions.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to use.

Function.Name: buffer_write
Function.Description: This function can be used to write data to a previously created buffer.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to write to.
The type of data that is to be written to the buffer.
The data to write.

Function.Name: display_get_dpi_x
Function.Description: This function gets the DPI of the device display along the x axis (this value is also dependent on the orientation of the device).

Function.Name: display_get_dpi_y
Function.Description: This function gets the DPI of the device display along the y axis (this value is also dependent on the orientation of the device).

Function.Name: display_get_gui_width
Function.Description: With this function you can get the width (in pixels) of the GUI as used in the Draw GUI Event.

Function.Name: display_get_height
Function.Description:
This function will return the height of the display (in pixels).
Note that on the HTML5 target, this value is the height of the browser window, rather than the physical display size.

Function.Name: display_get_orientation
Function.Description:
This function will return one of two constants GameMaker has to tell you whether the device running the game is being held in landscape or portrait mode.
Note that this function may not correctly detect the orientation of the device when used in the HTML5 target module.

Function.Name: display_get_sleep_margin
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the current sleep margin value used for the render timing of your game, and will return a millisecond value. For more information on display timing, please see display_set_timing_method().

Function.Name: display_get_timing_method
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the timing method to be used for rendering your game.

Function.Name: display_get_width
Function.Description:
This function will return the width of the display (in pixels).
Note that on the HTML5 target, this value is the width of the browser window, rather than the physical display size.

Function.Name: display_mouse_get_x
Function.Description: This function will return the mouse x position within the screen. It should be noted that this function only works properly when used on the Windows target. It can be used for HTML5 too, but will only return a value relative to the (0, 0) of the canvas itself, and will not return any value while the mouse is outside of the canvas. For other devices it will return 0, and you should use the device_mouse_raw_x()and device_mouse_raw_y() functions instead.

Function.Name: display_mouse_get_y
Function.Description: This function will return the mouse y position within the screen. It should be noted that this function only works properly when used on the Windows target. It can be used for HTML5 too, but will only return a value relative to the (0, 0) of the canvas itself, and will not return any value while the mouse is outside of the canvas. For other devices it will return 0, and you should use the device_mouse_raw_x() and device_mouse_raw_y() functions instead.

Function.Name: display_mouse_set
Function.Description: With this function you can change or set the position of the mouse within the game display.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate in the display.
The y coordinate in the display.

Function.Name: display_reset
Function.Description: This function resets the display settings to those that were set when the game was started and also allows you to change the current level of fullscreen anti-aliasing being used and whether to use vertical synchronisation.
Function.Parameter: The level of anti-aliasing filtering (0, 2, 4 or 8).
Toggle vertical synchronisation to on (true) or off (false).

Function.Name: display_set_gui_size
Function.Description: This function will only affect things drawn in the Draw GUI Event and can be used to set a specific width and height for all GUI components in that event, and no matter what size of display or window is used to display the GUI, it will be scaled to fit correctly.
Function.Parameter: The width of the GUI
The height of the GUI

Function.Name: display_set_sleep_margin
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the sleep margin value used for the render timing of your game, and requires a millisecond value.
Function.Parameter: The number of milliseconds for the sleep margin

Function.Name: display_set_timing_method
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the timing method to be used for rendering your game.
Function.Parameter: The timing method to use

Function.Name: display_set_ui_visibility
Function.Description: This function can be used to show or hide the system UI on Android and iOS only.
Function.Parameter: The Android SYSTEM flags to use (as an integer value).

Function.Name: gif_add_surface
Function.Description: With this function you can save a frame to a GIF file from a surface. The delay time is calculated in 1/100ths of a second, but note that once the GIF has been created different browsers may interpret the frame delay slightly differently.
Function.Parameter: The ID of gif to add the surface data to
The ID of the surface to use as the added frame
The delay time for the frame (in 100ths of a second)
[Optional] The offset along the X axis of the surface to add from
[Optional] The offset along the Y axis of the surface to add from
[Optional] The quantization amount from 0 to 3 (0 lowest quality, 3 highest quality, default is 2)

Function.Name: gif_open
Function.Description: With this function you can create an empty GIF format image, ready to have data added to it. The function will return the unique ID value used to identify the GIF in subsequent functions, or it will return -1 if the GIF could not be initialized (for example, if the width/height are too big for the memory available).
Function.Parameter: The width of the GIF to create
The height of the GIF to create
[Optional] The colour (RGB) to clear the GIF to (defaults to black)

Function.Name: gif_save
Function.Description: With this function you can save out a GIF animation. Note that GameMaker does not automatically append the .gif file extension, so you should include this as part of the filename string if you wish the saved file to be identified as a GIF. The created GIF will be palletised using the Universal 884 Palette.
Function.Parameter: The ID of the GIF to save
The filename to use for the GIF

Function.Name: gif_save_buffer
Function.Description: With this function you can save out a GIF animation. Note that the final GIF data will be palletised using the Universal 884 Palette.
Function.Parameter: The ID of the GIF to save

Function.Name: screen_save
Function.Description: With this function you can save a screenshot of the game as it currently appears in the game window. The file will be saved to the working directory of the game, which in windows is located at <drive>:/Users/YOURUSERNAME/AppData/Local/[Game Name]/ and on Mac it would be ~/Library/Application Support/[Game Name]/. The image captured will be the final render of the application surface of the game, or (if the app surface has been disabled) it will be an image of the whole display or window. It is important to note that the function is designed to be called in the Draw GUI End Event, which should give consistent results across all platforms.
Function.Parameter: The filename for the screenshot to save

Function.Name: screen_save_part
Function.Description: With this function you can save a screenshot of a part of the game as it currently appears in the game display. The selection coordinates are based on the absolute size of the display (or window if not fullscreen), so (0, 0) is always the top-left hand corner of the screen (or window).
Function.Parameter: The filename for the screenshot to save
The x coordinate of the top left corner of the area of the screen to capture
The y coordinate of the top left corner of the area of the screen to capture
The width of the area of the screen to capture
The height of the area of the screen to capture

Function.Name: camera_apply
Function.Description: This function immediately applies the given camera's settings to the current camera view being rendered and sets it as the active camera.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera.

Function.Name: camera_copy_transforms
Function.Description: This function will copy the transforms from one camera to another.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value for the camera the values will be copied to.
The unique camera ID value for the camera the values will be copied from.

Function.Name: camera_create
Function.Description: This function will create an "empty" camera, i.e.: a camera with no view or projection settings defined. Once you have created the camera you can then use the different matrix functions to set the view and projection matrices.

Function.Name: camera_create_view
Function.Description: This function will create a new camera and then set its view into the room, before returning the unique ID value to identify the camera in future function calls. The camera will be created using the values that you set in this function for position, size and other details which correlate to the values you set in the Room Editor. Note that this function can take a variable number of arguments and any arguments not supplied will use their default values.
Function.Parameter: The x position (within the room) of the left side of the area the camera view captures.
The y position (within the room) of the top of the area the camera view captures.
The width of the area the view captures.
The height of the area the view captures.
The angle to set the for the camera view(from 0 - 360, default is 0).
The object ID (or instance ID) for the camera view to follow (default is -1, no object).
The maximum horizontal speed the view can move at (set to -1 for "instant" following, default is -1).
The maximum vertical speed the view can move at (set to -1 for "instant" following, default is -1).
The minimum horizontal space between the edge of the view area and the instance it is set to follow (before the view begins moving and if it is set to follow an instance, default is 0).
The minimum vertical space between the edge of the view area and the instance it is set to follow (before the view begins moving and if it is set to follow an instance, default is 0).

Function.Name: camera_destroy
Function.Description: This function destroys the given camera.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera.

Function.Name: camera_get_active
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the unique camera ID value of the currently active camera.

Function.Name: camera_get_begin_script
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the ID of the script function assigned as the begin script for the given camera. If no script function is assigned then the function will return an invalid handle (-1).
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera

Function.Name: camera_get_default
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the unique camera ID value of the default camera (the camera that GameMaker uses when no camera views or ports are active in a game room).

Function.Name: camera_get_end_script
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the ID of the script function assigned as the end function for the given camera. If no script function is assigned then the function will return -1.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera

Function.Name: camera_get_proj_mat
Function.Description: This function returns the projection matrix of the given camera.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera

Function.Name: camera_get_update_script
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the ID of the script function assigned as the update script for the given camera. If no script is assigned then the function will return -1.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera

Function.Name: camera_get_view_angle
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the angle of the given camera.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera

Function.Name: camera_get_view_border_x
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the border value for object/instance following of the given camera along the x axis (horizontal border). The return value will be in pixels.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera

Function.Name: camera_get_view_border_y
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the border value for object/instance following of the given camera along the y axis (vertical border). The return value will be in pixels.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera

Function.Name: camera_get_view_height
Function.Description:
This function can be used to retrieve the height (in pixels) of the given camera view.
Note that this function is only valid for cameras created using camera_create_view() or for those added in the Room Editor.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera

Function.Name: camera_get_view_mat
Function.Description: This function returns the view matrix of the given camera.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera

Function.Name: camera_get_view_speed_x
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the movement speed of the given camera along the x axis (horizontal movement). The return value will be in pixels per game frame.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera

Function.Name: camera_get_view_speed_y
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the movement speed of the given camera along the y axis (vertical movement). The return value will be in pixels per game frame.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera

Function.Name: camera_get_view_target
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the follow target of the given camera, which can be set in the room properties or with camera_set_view_target().
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera

Function.Name: camera_get_view_width
Function.Description:
This function can be used to retrieve the width (in pixels) of the given camera view.
Note that this function is only valid for cameras created using camera_create_view() or for those added in the Room Editor.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera

Function.Name: camera_get_view_x
Function.Description:
This function can be used to retrieve the x position of the view for a given camera.
Note that this function is only valid for cameras created using camera_create_view() or for those added in the Room Editor.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera

Function.Name: camera_get_view_y
Function.Description:
This function can be used to retrieve the y position of the view for a given camera.
Note that this function is only valid for cameras created using camera_create_view() or for those added in the Room Editor.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera

Function.Name: camera_set_begin_script
Function.Description: This function can be used to set a script function that will be called at the beginning of every game frame that the camera is assigned to a visible and active viewport.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera.
The script function to run each game frame

Function.Name: camera_set_default
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the default camera to use a custom camera that you have previously created using one of the camera_create() functions. When you create a room with no active viewports or view cameras, GameMaker still uses a camera to show the action in the game. This camera is called the default camera and can be set and manipulated (and even destroyed) just like any other camera.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera

Function.Name: camera_set_end_script
Function.Description: This function can be used to set a script function that will be called at the end of every game frame that the camera is assigned to a visible and active viewport, after everything for that view camera has been rendered.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera.
The script to run each game frame

Function.Name: camera_set_proj_mat
Function.Description: This function will set the projection matrix for a given camera. You can find out more about creating projection matrices from the section Matrix Functions, specifically matrix_build_projection_perspective() and matrix_build_projection_ortho().
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera.
The unique matrix ID returned when you created the matrix.

Function.Name: camera_set_update_script
Function.Description: This function can be used to set a script function that will be called every game frame that the camera is assigned to a visible and active viewport.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera.
The script function to run each game frame

Function.Name: camera_set_view_angle
Function.Description: You can use this function to update the angle of the view camera within the room. The default value is 0 degrees with positive values rotating the camera counter-clockwise, i.e.: setting the value to 90 will rotate the camera 90 degrees to the left.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera
The new angle to set the camera view to

Function.Name: camera_set_view_border
Function.Description: You can use this function to set the border size of the camera within the room.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera.
The border (in pixels) for the view camera along the horizontal axis
The border (in pixels) for the view camera along the vertical axis

Function.Name: camera_set_view_mat
Function.Description: This function sets the view matrix for a given camera.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera.
The unique matrix ID returned when you created the matrix.

Function.Name: camera_set_view_pos
Function.Description: You can use this function to update the position of the camera view within the room.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera.
The x position to place the view at (in the room)
The y position to place the view at (in the room)

Function.Name: camera_set_view_size
Function.Description: You can use this function to update the size of the view camera within the room.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera.
The width of the camera view in pixels
The height of the camera view in pixels

Function.Name: camera_set_view_speed
Function.Description: You can use this function to update the speed of the view camera within the room. The speed is calculated as pixels per step and can be set to -1 to make the camera move instantly, but if the camera is not set to follow any instance then the values set here will have no visible effect.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera.
The speed (number of pixels per game frame) that the view should move on the horizontal (x) axis
The speed (number of pixels per game frame) that the view should move on the vertical (y) axis

Function.Name: camera_set_view_target
Function.Description: You can use this function to set the follow target of the view camera within the room. Note that if you set an object ID and there is more than one instance of that object in the room, there is no way for GameMaker to know which instance you wish to follow and so it could be any of them.
Function.Parameter: The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera
Instance or object to have the camera target for following

Function.Name: view_get_camera
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the unique camera ID value for the camera assigned to the given viewport (from 0 - 7). If no camera is assigned, the function will return -1.
Function.Parameter: The viewport to target (0 - 7)

Function.Name: view_get_hport
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the height of the given viewport.
Function.Parameter: The viewport to target (0 - 7)

Function.Name: view_get_surface_id
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the unique ID value for the surface assigned to the given viewport (will return -1 if no surface has been assigned).
Function.Parameter: The viewport to target (0 - 7)

Function.Name: view_get_visible
Function.Description: This function can be used to check the visibility of the given viewport.
Function.Parameter: The viewport to target (0 - 7)

Function.Name: view_get_wport
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the width of the given viewport.
Function.Parameter: The viewport to target (0 - 7)

Function.Name: view_get_xport
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the x position of the given viewport.
Function.Parameter: The viewport to target (0 - 7)

Function.Name: view_get_yport
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the y position of the given viewport.
Function.Parameter: The viewport to target (0 - 7)

Function.Name: view_set_camera
Function.Description: This function assigns the given camera to the given viewport.
Function.Parameter: The viewport to target (0 - 7)
The unique camera ID value returned when you created the camera

Function.Name: view_set_hport
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the height of the given viewport.
Function.Parameter: The viewport to target (0 - 7)
The new height (in pixels)

Function.Name: view_set_surface_id
Function.Description: This function sets the surface to draw the contents of the given viewport to.
Function.Parameter: The viewport to target (0 - 7)

Function.Name: view_set_visible
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the visibility of the given viewport.
Function.Parameter: The viewport to target (0 - 7)
Visibility toggle (true is visible and false is invisible)

Function.Name: view_set_wport
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the width of the given viewport.
Function.Parameter: The viewport to target (0 - 7)
The new width (in pixels)

Function.Name: view_set_xport
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the x position of the given viewport.
Function.Parameter: The viewport to target (0 - 7)
The new x position

Function.Name: view_set_yport
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the y position of the given viewport.
Function.Parameter: The viewport to target (0 - 7)
The new y position

Function.Name: window_center
Function.Description: With this function you can centre the game window in the display when the target module is Windows, Ubuntu (Linux) or macOS, or you can centre it in the browser if the target module is HTML5.

Function.Name: window_device
Function.Description: This function will return the current D3D device pointer, which you can then (for example) pass through to a DLL or Dylib on Windows and macOS.

Function.Name: window_post_message
Function.Description: This function is for the GX.games target and is used to send a message to the host window containing the game. It takes a string which is sent to the host iframe.
Function.Parameter: The message to be passed to the host window

Function.Name: window_get_showborder
Function.Description: Returns whether the border around the window is shown in windowed mode.

Function.Name: window_get_caption
Function.Description: This function returns the caption of the window (this is the text that appears on the top of the window, next to its icon).

Function.Name: window_get_colour
Function.Description: This function returns the background colour of the game window. This colour represents that which will be used for those areas of the game window that are not occupied by any views.

Function.Name: window_get_cursor
Function.Description: With this function you can get the current cursor being used in the game window.

Function.Name: window_get_fullscreen
Function.Description: This function returns whether the game window is in fullscreen mode (true) or not (false).

Function.Name: window_get_height
Function.Description: With this function you can get the current height (in pixels) of the game window.

Function.Name: window_get_visible_rects
Function.Description: With this function you can find the overlapping region of the rectangle defined by (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) on each of the attached displays. The function will return an array with 8 values per display, where the values [0 ... 3] correspond to the overlapx1, overlapy1, overlapx2, overlapy2 - defining the region of overlap on this display and will be set to 0,0,0,0 if no overlap - and the values [4 ... 7] corresponds to the monitorx1, monitory1, monitorx2, monitory2 - the coordinates of the display in the virtual display space.
Function.Parameter: The left edge of the rectangle to check
The top edge of the rectangle to check.
The right edge of the rectangle to check
The bottom edge of the rectangle to check.

Function.Name: window_get_width
Function.Description: With this function you can get the current width (in pixels) of the game window.

Function.Name: window_get_x
Function.Description: With this function you can get the x position (in pixels) within the browser if it is an HTML5 game or within the display if it is a Windows, Ubuntu (Linux) or macOS game.

Function.Name: window_get_y
Function.Description: With this function you can get the y position (in pixels) within the browser if it is an HTML5 game or within the display if it is a Windows, Ubuntu (Linux) or macOS game.

Function.Name: window_handle
Function.Description: With this function you can get the internal Windows ID value (the HWND, a pointer).

Function.Name: window_has_focus
Function.Description: With this function you can poll the window (or tab) state and if it loses focus the function will return false, otherwise it will return true.

Function.Name: window_minimise
Function.Description: This function minimises the game window. You can restore it with window_restore().

Function.Name: window_minimize
Function.Description: This function minimizes the game window. You can restore it with window_restore().

Function.Name: window_mouse_get_x
Function.Description: With this function you can get the x position of the mouse cursor (in pixels) within the browser if it is an HTML5 game or within the display if it is a Windows, Ubuntu (Linux) or macOS game.

Function.Name: window_mouse_get_y
Function.Description: With this function you can get the y position of the mouse cursor (in pixels) within the browser if it is an HTML5 game or within the display if it is a Windows, Ubuntu (Linux) or macOS game.

Function.Name: window_mouse_set
Function.Description: With this function you can change or set the position of the mouse within the game window.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate in the window.
The y coordinate in the window.

Function.Name: window_mouse_set_locked
Function.Description: With this function you can enable or disable mouse lock. When enabled, the mouse cursor is hidden and locked at the center of the window. When disabled, the mouse cursor is shown and unlocked. While the cursor is locked, you can still use functions window_mouse_get_delta_x() and window_mouse_get_delta_y() to retrieve how much has it moved since the last frame.
Function.Parameter: Enable (true) or disable (false) mouse lock.

Function.Name: window_mouse_get_locked
Function.Description: Returns whether the mouse cursor was locked using function window_mouse_set_locked.

Function.Name: window_mouse_get_delta_x
Function.Description: Returns how many pixels the mouse cursor has moved on the x axis since the last frame.

Function.Name: window_mouse_get_delta_y
Function.Description: Returns how many pixels the mouse cursor has moved on the y axis since the last frame.

Function.Name: window_restore
Function.Description: This function restores the game window which may have been minimised by the user or using the function window_minimise().

Function.Name: window_set_showborder
Function.Description: Sets whether the border around the window is shown in windowed mode.
Function.Parameter: Whether to show the window border (true) or not (false).

Function.Name: window_set_caption
Function.Description: With this function you can change or set the windows caption for the room that you are currently in. This caption appears at the top of the window, beside the game icon, when the game is not in full screen mode.
Function.Parameter: The new caption.

Function.Name: window_set_colour
Function.Description: This function sets the background colour of the game window.
Function.Parameter: The colour to set the region.

Function.Name: window_set_cursor
Function.Description: With this function you can set the cursor for the game window to any one of the built-in constants.
Function.Parameter: The cursor to set for the game window.

Function.Name: window_set_fullscreen
Function.Description: With this function you can set the game window to be full screen (true) or not (false).
Function.Parameter: Whether to set the screen to fullscreen (true) or not (false).

Function.Name: window_set_max_height
Function.Description: This function can be used to set a maximum window height for your game. If you enable the window resize option in the Game Options for the target platform, then the player can resize the game window to any size they wish, however by using this function you can limit the maximum height to the size you specify. If you wish to go back to the default behaviour (i.e.: no minimum), then use a value of -1.
Function.Parameter: The maximum height in pixels for the game window.

Function.Name: window_set_max_width
Function.Description: This function can be used to set a maximum window width for your game. If you enable the window resize option in the Game Options for the target platform, then the player can resize the game window to any size they wish, however by using this function you can limit the maximum width to the size you specify. If you wish to go back to the default behaviour (i.e.: no minimum), then use a value of -1.
Function.Parameter: The maximum width in pixels for the game window.

Function.Name: window_set_min_height
Function.Description: This function can be used to set a minimum window height for your game. If you enable the window resize option in the Game Options for the target platform, then the player can resize the game window to any size they wish, however by using this function you can limit the minimum height to the size you specify. If you wish to go back to the default behaviour (i.e.: no minimum), then use a value of -1.
Function.Parameter: The minimum height in pixels for the game window.

Function.Name: window_set_min_width
Function.Description: This function can be used to set a minimum window width for your game. If you enable the window resize option in the Game Options for the target platform, then the player can resize the game window to any size they wish, however by using this function you can limit the minimum width to the size you specify. If you wish to go back to the default behaviour (i.e.: no minimum), then use a value of -1.
Function.Parameter: The minimum width in pixels for the game window.

Function.Name: window_set_position
Function.Description: With this function you can set the game window to a specific position within the display (on macOS, Linux(Ubuntu) and Windows) or within the browser (HTML5).
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of where to position the window.
The y coordinate of where to position the window.

Function.Name: window_set_rectangle
Function.Description: With this function you can set the position of the game window within the browser (HTML5) or display (Windows, Ubuntu (Linux) or macOS) and set the scale of the window too.
Function.Parameter: The new x coordinate of the window.
The new y coordinate of the window.
The new width of the window.
The new height of the window.

Function.Name: window_set_size
Function.Description: With this function you can change the size of the game window. If you use this function to change the size of the game window, the contents of the window will be scaled to fit with a 1:1 ratio to the background canvas which will keep the image crisp and clear (although scaled if the window is other than the room or view size).
Function.Parameter: The new width of the window.
The new height of the window.

Function.Name: window_enable_borderless_fullscreen
Function.Description:
With this function you can enable borderless fullscreen mode which uses a borderless window when switching to fullscreen rather than making the game take over exclusive use of the display.
Note that this will only take effect on the next switch to fullscreen (so if the game is currently running in fullscreen then nothing will immediately change).
Function.Parameter: Whether to enable borderless fullscreen mode (true) or not (false).

Function.Name: window_get_borderless_fullscreen
Function.Description: This function returns whether fullscreen mode uses a borderless window or whether the game takes exclusive control of the display.

Function.Name: window_views_mouse_get_x
Function.Description: This function returns the x coordinate of the mouse with respect to all the active views and returns the same value mouse_x.

Function.Name: window_views_mouse_get_y
Function.Description: This function returns the y coordinate of the mouse with respect to all the active views and returns the same value mouse_y.

Function.Name: window_view_mouse_get_x
Function.Description: This function will return the mouse x position relative to the view selected.
Function.Parameter: The id of the view to compare the mouse position to.

Function.Name: window_view_mouse_get_y
Function.Description: This function will return the mouse y position relative to the view selected.
Function.Parameter: The id of the view to compare the mouse position to.

Function.Name: ds_exists
Function.Description: This function checks if a data structure of the given type with the given index exists.
Function.Parameter: The variable index to check for the data structure
The type of data structure to check for

Function.Name: ds_set_precision
Function.Description: This function sets the precision value to be used by the data structure functions for comparing values.
Function.Parameter: The precision value (default 0.0000001)

Function.Name: ds_grid_add
Function.Description: This function can be used to add a given value (real or string) to the value of the given cell within the grid. The value to be added must be the same type as that held within the grid cell.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The x position of the cell in the grid.
The y position of the cell in the grid.
The value to add to the cell.

Function.Name: ds_grid_add_disk
Function.Description: This function can be used to add a given value (real or string) to all the values of the cells found within the defined disk area of a grid. The value to be added must be of the same type as that held within the grid cells.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The x position of the disk on the grid.
The y position of the disk on the grid.
The radius of the disk on the grid.
The value to add to the cells within the disk.

Function.Name: ds_grid_add_grid_region
Function.Description: This function can be used to add all the values of all the cells found within the source area of a grid to the values within the destination grid.
Function.Parameter: The index of the destination grid.
The index of the source grid.
The left position of the region of cells to copy from the source grid.
The top position of the region of cells to copy from the source grid.
The right position of the region of cells to copy from the source grid.
The bottom position of the region of cells to copy from the source grid.
The x position on the destination grid to add the source region to.
The y position on the destination grid to add the source region to.

Function.Name: ds_grid_add_region
Function.Description: This function can be used to add a given value (real or string) to all the values of the cells found within the defined area of a grid. The value to be added must be of the same type as that held within the grid cells.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The x position of the left of the region in the grid.
The y position of the top of the region in the grid.
The x position of the right of the region in the grid.
The y position of the bottom of the region in the grid.
The value to add to the region cells.

Function.Name: ds_grid_clear
Function.Description: This function can be used to clear a given DS grid to a specific value. All cells within the grid will then contain this value, which can be a real number or a string.
Function.Parameter: This index of the grid to clear.
The new value for all grid cells.

Function.Name: ds_grid_copy
Function.Description: With this function you can copy the contents of one grid into another one. Both grids must have been created previously using the ds_grid_create() function.
Function.Parameter: This index of the grid to copy to.
This index of the grid to copy from.

Function.Name: ds_grid_create
Function.Description: With this function you can create a new DS grid data structure of the specified cell width and height. This function returns an ID which must be used in all further functions that deal with this DS grid.
Function.Parameter: The width of the grid to be created.
The height of the grid to be created.

Function.Name: ds_grid_destroy
Function.Description: This function will remove the given grid data structure from memory, freeing up the resources it was using and removing all values that it contained. This function should always be used when you are finished using the DS grid to prevent memory leaks that can slow down and crash your game.
Function.Parameter: This index of the grid to destroy.

Function.Name: ds_grid_get
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the value (either a real number or a string) from any cell within the given DS grid. If you pass invalid grid coordinates to the function, then the value returned will be undefined and an error will be shown in the output window.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The x position of the cell you want to find the value of.
The y position of the cell you want to find the value of.

Function.Name: ds_grid_get_disk_max
Function.Description: This function can be used to find the maximum value for all the cells found within the defined disk area of a grid.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The x position of the disk center in the grid.
The y position of the disk center in the grid.
The radius of the disk in the grid.

Function.Name: ds_grid_get_disk_mean
Function.Description: This function can be used to find the mean value for all the cells found within the defined disk area of a grid (all cell values are added together and then divided by the total number of cells that make up the disk).
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The x position of the disk on the grid.
The y position of the disk on the grid.
The radius of the disk on the grid.

Function.Name: ds_grid_get_disk_min
Function.Description: This function can be used to find the minimum value for all the cells found within the defined disk area of a grid.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The x position of the disk on the grid.
The y position of the disk on the grid.
The radius of the disk on the grid.

Function.Name: ds_grid_get_disk_sum
Function.Description: This function can be used to add all the values all the cells found within the defined disk area of a grid together.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The x position of the disk on the grid.
The y position of the disk on the grid.
The radius of the disk on the grid.

Function.Name: ds_grid_get_max
Function.Description: This function can be used to find the maximum value for all the cells found within the defined region of a grid.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The left cell column of the region.
The top cell row of the region.
The right cell column of the region.
The bottom cell row of the region.

Function.Name: ds_grid_get_mean
Function.Description: This function can be used to find the mean value for all the cells found within the defined region of a grid (all cell values are added together and then divided by the total number of cells that make the region).
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The left cell column of the region.
The top cell row of the region.
The right cell column of the region.
The bottom cell row of the region.

Function.Name: ds_grid_get_min
Function.Description: This function can be used to find the minimum value for all the cells found within the defined region of a grid.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The left cell column of the region.
The top cell row of the region.
The right cell column of the region.
The bottom cell row of the region.

Function.Name: ds_grid_get_sum
Function.Description: This function can be used to add all the values all the cells found within the defined region of a grid together.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The left cell column of the region.
The top cell row of the region.
The right cell column of the region.
The bottom cell row of the region.

Function.Name: ds_grid_height
Function.Description: This function will return the height of the given grid, which is the number of cells the grid has along the y-axis (an integer).
Function.Parameter: This index of the grid to find the height of.

Function.Name: ds_grid_multiply
Function.Description: This function will multiply the value of a the given grid cell by the specified amount.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The x position of the cell in the grid.
The y position of the cell in the grid.
The value to multiply with the cell.

Function.Name: ds_grid_multiply_disk
Function.Description: This function will take all the values in a given disc-shaped region of the DS grid, and multiply each one by the given amount.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The x position of the disk on the grid.
The y position of the disk on the grid.
The radius of the disk on the grid.
The value to multiply the cells within the disk with.

Function.Name: ds_grid_multiply_grid_region
Function.Description: With this function you can define an area within a given DS grid, then take those values and multiply them with those found in a separate region of either the same DS grid, or another one (which has been previously created). The original region will remain unchanged, while the region that they have been multiplied with will now store the new values for each cell.
Function.Parameter: The index of the destination grid.
The index of the source grid.
The left position of the region of cells to copy from the source grid.
The top position of the region of cells to copy from the source grid.
The right position of the region of cells to copy from the source grid.
The bottom position of the region of cells to copy from the source grid.
The x position on the destination grid to multiply the source region with.
The y position on the destination grid to multiply the source region with.

Function.Name: ds_grid_multiply_region
Function.Description: With this function you can specify a region of the grid in which to multiply each cell value by a given amount.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The x position of the left of the region in the grid.
The y position of the top of the region in the grid.
The x position of the right of the region in the grid.
The y position of the bottom of the region in the grid.
The value to multiply with the region cells.

Function.Name: ds_grid_read
Function.Description: This function can be used to convert a string which has been created previously by the function ds_grid_write() back into a DS grid.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid to read.
The string to read into the DS grid.
Can be either true or false or omitted completely.

Function.Name: ds_grid_resize
Function.Description: With this function you can resize the given DS grid to have a different width and/or height. If the grid size is larger than the current grid, the new cells will have a base value of 0, and if the size is smaller then the values held in the cells that are no longer within the new size will be lost. All other cells will be left untouched.
Function.Parameter: This index of the grid to resize.
The new width of the grid.
The new height of the grid.

Function.Name: ds_grid_set
Function.Description:
This function can be used to set a given cell within the given DS grid to any value, which can be a real number or a string.
This function is the same as using the DS grid accessor to set the value in a grid cell.
Function.Parameter: This index of the grid.
The x position of the cell to set.
The y position of the cell to set.
The value with which to set the cell.

Function.Name: ds_grid_set_disk
Function.Description: With this function you can set a circular region of a grid to a certain value.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The x position of the disk on the grid.
The y position of the disk on the grid.
The radius of the disk on the grid.
The value to set with the cells within the disk.

Function.Name: ds_grid_set_grid_region
Function.Description: This function can be used to copy the contents of a rectangular area of grid cells from one (previously defined) DS grid to another, or it can be used to copy a region from within the same grid.
Function.Parameter: The index of the destination grid.
The index of the source grid.
The left position of the region of cells to copy from the source grid.
The top position of the region of cells to copy from the source grid.
The right position of the region of cells to copy from the source grid.
The bottom position of the region of cells to copy from the source grid.
The x position on the destination grid to copy the source region to.
The y position on the destination grid to copy the source region to.

Function.Name: ds_grid_set_region
Function.Description: This function can be used to set a rectangular region of a given grid to a specified value (which can be either a real or a string).
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The x position of the left of the region in the grid.
The y position of the top of the region in the grid.
The x position of the right of the region in the grid.
The y position of the bottom of the region in the grid.
The value to set the region cells to.

Function.Name: ds_grid_shuffle
Function.Description: This function can be used to randomise the positions of all values in all cells within a grid.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid to shuffle.

Function.Name: ds_grid_sort
Function.Description: This function can be used to sort a DS grid based on the values from a given column (much as you would sort files by date, size, etc., in the OS file explorer).
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid to sort.
The column to use for sorting the rows
Whether to sort lowest to highest (true), or highest to lowest (false).

Function.Name: ds_grid_to_mp_grid
Function.Description: This function can be used to convert a DS grid into an MP grid. You can also provide an optional predicate function argument to map the DS grid value to the corresponding MP grid value. If you don't provide a predicate function, the function will treat zero values as empty and non-zero values as occupied.
Function.Parameter: The source DS grid.
The destination MP grid.
A predicate function (that is passed the: grid value, cell x and cell y) and should return true (cell is ocupied) or false (cell is empty)

Function.Name: ds_grid_value_disk_exists
Function.Description: With this function you can check to see if a specific value (real or string) is present within a circular area of a given DS grid.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The x position of the disk on the grid.
The y position of the disk on the grid.
The radius of the disk on the grid.
The value to find.

Function.Name: ds_grid_value_disk_x
Function.Description: With this function you can get the x coordinate (within the given grid disc-shaped region) of the value being searched for.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The x position of the disk on the grid.
The y position of the disk on the grid.
The radius of the disk on the grid.
The value to find.

Function.Name: ds_grid_value_disk_y
Function.Description: With this function you can get the y coordinate (within the given grid disc-shaped region) of the value being searched for.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The x position of the disk on the grid.
The y position of the disk on the grid.
The radius of the disk on the grid.
The value to find.

Function.Name: ds_grid_value_exists
Function.Description: With this function you can check to see if a specific value (real or string) is present within a rectangular area of a given DS grid.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The x position of the left of the region in the grid.
The y position of the top of the region in the grid.
The x position of the right of the region in the grid.
The y position of the bottom of the region in the grid.
The value to find.

Function.Name: ds_grid_value_x
Function.Description:
With this function you can get the x coordinate (within the given rectangular grid region) of the value being searched for.
If the value being searched for does not exist, the function will return -1.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The x position of the left of the region in the grid, from 0 to (grid width - 1).
The y position of the top of the region in the grid, from 0 to (grid height - 1).
The x position of the right of the region in the grid, from 0 to (grid width - 1).
The y position of the bottom of the region in the grid, from 0 to (grid height - 1).
The value to find.

Function.Name: ds_grid_value_y
Function.Description:
With this function you can get the y coordinate (within the given rectangular grid region) of the value being searched for.
If the value being searched for does not exist, the function will return -1.
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid.
The x position of the left of the region in the grid, from 0 to (grid width - 1).
The y position of the top of the region in the grid, from 0 to (grid height - 1).
The x position of the right of the region in the grid, from 0 to (grid width - 1).
The y position of the bottom of the region in the grid, from 0 to (grid height - 1)
The value to find.

Function.Name: ds_grid_width
Function.Description: This function will return the width of the given grid, which is the number of cells the grid has along the x-axis (an integer).
Function.Parameter: This index of the grid to find the width of.

Function.Name: ds_grid_write
Function.Description:
This function can be used to convert the given DS grid into a string, which can then be stored in an external file (for example).
You can read the returned string from this function back into a DS grid using the function ds_grid_read().
Function.Parameter: The index of the grid to write.

Function.Name: ds_list_add
Function.Description: This function can be used to add a new value (real or string) to the list, which will be added on at the end. The function can take as many further optional arguments as you require, permitting you to add multiple values consecutively to the list in a single call.
Function.Parameter: The id of the list to add to.
The value to add to the list.

Function.Name: ds_list_clear
Function.Description: With this function you can clear all data from the given list data structure.
Function.Parameter: The id of the data structure to clear.

Function.Name: ds_list_copy
Function.Description: With this function you can copy the contents of one list into another. Both lists must have been created previously and if the list being copied to already has information within it, this list will be cleared first. The end result is two independent lists which contain the same information.
Function.Parameter: The id of the list being copied to.
The id of the list to be copied from.

Function.Name: ds_list_create
Function.Description: This function creates a new list data structure and returns a handle to it.

Function.Name: ds_list_delete
Function.Description: With this function you can remove the value stored at a specific position within the list.
Function.Parameter: The id of the list to change.
Where in the list to delete the value.

Function.Name: ds_list_destroy
Function.Description: This function will remove the given list data structure from memory, freeing up the resources it was using and removing all values that it contained.
Function.Parameter: The id of the data structure to remove.

Function.Name: ds_list_empty
Function.Description: With this function you can check the given DS list to see if it is empty (returns true) or not (returns false).
Function.Parameter: The id of the data structure to check.

Function.Name: ds_list_find_index
Function.Description:
With this function you can check the given list for a value and the position within the list for that value will be returned.
Note that if there are multiple entries in the list with the same value, the position of any one of them may be returned, and if the value doesn't exist, -1 will be returned.
Function.Parameter: The id of the list to use.
The value to find.

Function.Name: ds_list_find_value
Function.Description:
With this function you can check the given list position and the value held within the list for that position will be returned.
Note that if you give a position that is outside of the given list size (i.e.: position 11 in a 10 value list) then the function may return undefined or 0.
Function.Parameter: The id of the list to use.
The position to look at, where 0 corresponds to the very beginning of the list and the final position is ds_list_size(id)-1.

Function.Name: ds_list_insert
Function.Description: This function will add the given value into the list at the given position. if the list contains more values after the given position, their position will be shifted up one to make room making the list larger by one.
Function.Parameter: The id of the list to add to.
The position to add the value, where 0 corresponds to the very beginning of the list and the final position is ds_list_size(id)-1.
The value to add to the list.

Function.Name: ds_list_is_list
Function.Description: With this function you can check to see if another DS list is stored at the given position within a DS list.
Function.Parameter: The id of the list to check.
The position within the list to check.

Function.Name: ds_list_is_map
Function.Description: With this function you can check to see if a DS map is stored at the given position within a DS list.
Function.Parameter: The id of the list to check.
The position within the list to check.

Function.Name: ds_list_mark_as_list
Function.Description: This function will "mark" (or "flag") a given position within a previously created DS list as holding another DS list, allowing for the correct encoding of the list containing the list into a JSON string with json_encode().
Function.Parameter: The id of the list to mark.
The position within the list to mark.

Function.Name: ds_list_mark_as_map
Function.Description: This function will "mark" (or "flag") a given position within a previously created DS list as holding a DS map, allowing for the correct encoding of the list containing the map into a JSON string with json_encode().
Function.Parameter: The id of the list to mark.
The position within the list to mark.

Function.Name: ds_list_read
Function.Description: With this function you can recreate a saved DS list (one that has previously been written as a string using ds_list_write()).
Function.Parameter: The id of the data structure to read into.
The string to read from.
Can be either true or false or omitted completely.

Function.Name: ds_list_replace
Function.Description: This function will replace the value at the given position by another one.
Function.Parameter: The id of the list to change.
The position to replace the value, where 0 corresponds to the very beginning of the list and the final position is ds_list_size(id)-1.
The new value to replace the given value with.

Function.Name: ds_list_set
Function.Description:
This function can be used to set a previously added list entry.
This function is the same as using the DS list accessor to set/create a list item.
Function.Parameter: The id of the list to add to.
The position within the list to set.
The value to set in the list.

Function.Name: ds_list_shuffle
Function.Description: With this function you can shuffle a list, which will re-order all the component values into random positions from those in which they were originally added to the list.
Function.Parameter: The id of the list to shuffle.

Function.Name: ds_list_size
Function.Description: This function will return the "size" of the list, i.e.: the number of items that have been added into it.
Function.Parameter: The id of the data structure to check.

Function.Name: ds_list_sort
Function.Description: With this function you can sort all the values within a list, either in ascending or descending order. If the list contains strings, these will be sorted alphabetically, based on the English 26 letter alphabet.
Function.Parameter: The id of the list to sort.
Whether the values should be ascending (true) or descending (false) order.

Function.Name: ds_list_write
Function.Description: This function returns a string which can then be stored or transferred to another data structure using the ds_list_read() function.
Function.Parameter: The id of the data structure to write.

Function.Name: ds_map_add
Function.Description: This function should be used to add sets of key/value pairs into the specified DS map.
Function.Parameter: The id of the map to add to.
The key of the value to add.
The value to add to the map.

Function.Name: ds_map_add_list
Function.Description: With this function you can assign a (previously created) DS list to a key within the given DS map, allowing for the correct encoding of the map containing the list into a JSON string with json_encode().
Function.Parameter: The id of the map to use.
The key for the added list.
The id of the list to add.

Function.Name: ds_map_add_map
Function.Description: With this function you can assign a (previously created) DS map to a key within the given DS map, allowing for the correct encoding of the map containing the map into a JSON string with json_encode().
Function.Parameter: The id of the map to use.
The key for the added map.
The id of the map to add.

Function.Name: ds_map_clear
Function.Description: This function will clear the given DS map of all key/value pairs.
Function.Parameter: The id of the data structure to clear.

Function.Name: ds_map_copy
Function.Description: You can use this function to copy the contents of one map into another one that you have previously created using ds_map_create(). If the DS map that is being copied to is not empty, then this function will clear it first before copying. The original DS map remains unchanged by this process.
Function.Parameter: The id of the map you are copying to
The id of the map you are copying from

Function.Name: ds_map_create
Function.Description: This function is used to create a new, empty, DS map and will return its id which is then used to access the data structure in all other DS map functions.

Function.Name: ds_map_delete
Function.Description: With this function you can remove any given key (and its corresponding value) from the given DS map.
Function.Parameter: The id of the map to change.
The key (along with its associated value) to delete.

Function.Name: ds_map_destroy
Function.Description: This function destroys the given DS map, freeing the memory it is using.
Function.Parameter: The id of the map to destroy.

Function.Name: ds_map_empty
Function.Description: This function will return false if the specified (previously created) DS map contains any key/value pairs, or true if it does not.
Function.Parameter: The id of the data structure to check.

Function.Name: ds_map_exists
Function.Description: This function will return true if the specified key exists in the (previously created) DS map, or false if it doesn't.
Function.Parameter: the id of the data structure to check
the key to check for

Function.Name: ds_map_find_first
Function.Description: This function returns the first key stored in the given DS map.
Function.Parameter: The id of the map to use.

Function.Name: ds_map_find_last
Function.Description: This function returns the last key stored in the given DS map.
Function.Parameter: The id of the map to use.

Function.Name: ds_map_find_next
Function.Description: This function returns the next key stored in the DS map after the one specified in the function.
Function.Parameter: The id of the map to use.
The key to find the next one to.

Function.Name: ds_map_find_previous
Function.Description: This function returns the previous key stored in the DS map before the one specified in the function.
Function.Parameter: The id of the map to use.
The key to find the previous one to.

Function.Name: ds_map_find_value
Function.Description: With this function you can get the value from a specified key.
Function.Parameter: The id of the map to use.
The key to find.

Function.Name: ds_map_is_list
Function.Description: With this function you can check to see if a DS list is stored in the given map key.
Function.Parameter: The id of the DS map to use.
The key to check.

Function.Name: ds_map_is_map
Function.Description: With this function you can check to see if a DS map is stored in the given map key.
Function.Parameter: The id of the DS map to use.
The key to replace.

Function.Name: ds_map_keys_to_array
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve all of the keys that a DS map contains.
Function.Parameter: The id of the map to use.
The array to append the DS map keys to.

Function.Name: ds_map_read
Function.Description:
This function will take a string that has previously been created by the function ds_map_write() and then read it into a previously created DS map.
If the map that the string is being read into contains any key/value pairs, these will be cleared first before the saved map is reconstructed.
Function.Parameter: The id of the data structure to read the string into
The string to read
Can be either true or false or omitted completely.

Function.Name: ds_map_replace
Function.Description:
With this function you can change the value for the given key in the given DS map.
If the given key does not exist then it will be created for you, and if it does then the current value will be replaced with the new value.
Function.Parameter: The id of the map to change.
The key with the value that should be replaced by the new one
The new value to replace the given value with

Function.Name: ds_map_replace_list
Function.Description:
With this function you can replace a DS list that has been stored in the given "key" with another list that has been created previously.
This function is designed for creating JSON-compatible maps which you would then encode using json_encode() and should only be used in conjunction with that functionality.
Function.Parameter: The id of the map to use.
The key to replace.
The id of the DS list to use to replace the one previously stored in the given key.

Function.Name: ds_map_replace_map
Function.Description:
With this function you can replace a DS Map that has been stored in the given "key" with another map that has been created previously.
This function is designed for creating JSON-compatible maps which you would then encode using json_encode() and should only be used in conjunction with that functionality.
Function.Parameter: The id of the DS map to use.
The key to replace.
The id of the DS map to use to replace the one previously stored in the given key.

Function.Name: ds_map_secure_load
Function.Description: This function will load a DS map, saved previously using DS map_secure_save(), from the given file.
Function.Parameter: The name of the file to load the map data from.

Function.Name: ds_map_secure_load_buffer
Function.Description: This function will load a secure saved DS map, written previously using DS map_secure_save_buffer(), from the given buffer.
Function.Parameter: The buffer ID of the buffer to load the map data from.

Function.Name: ds_map_secure_save
Function.Description: This function will save the contents of the given DS map to a file that is linked to the device it was created on (meaning it can't be read if transferred to any other device).
Function.Parameter: The id of the data structure to use
The name of the file to save the map to

Function.Name: ds_map_secure_save_buffer
Function.Description: This function will save a previously created DS map to a buffer.
Function.Parameter: The DS map ID value.
The buffer ID value.

Function.Name: ds_map_set
Function.Description:
With this function you can set the value of a key within a given DS map.
This function is the same as using the DS map accessor to set/create a map key/value pair.
Function.Parameter: The id of the map to use.
The key to set.
The value to set the key to.

Function.Name: ds_map_size
Function.Description: With this function you can find how many key/value pairs the given DS map contains.
Function.Parameter: The id of the data structure to check.

Function.Name: ds_map_values_to_array
Function.Description:
With this function you can retrieve all of the values that a DS map contains for each key in the map.
Note that the function will modify the array supplied directly, but will also return a reference to it (or a reference to a new array if none is supplied).
Function.Parameter: The id of the map to use.
The array to append the DS map values to.

Function.Name: ds_map_write
Function.Description: This function will turn the DS map data of the specified map into string format which can then be written to an *.ini or a *.txt file for easy storage. This string can then be later read back into a new DS map using ds_map_read().
Function.Parameter: The id of the data structure to use

Function.Name: ds_priority_add
Function.Description: With this function you can add a value (either a real number or a string) to a priority queue, at the same time assigning it a priority value.
Function.Parameter: The id of the priority queue to add to.
The value to add to the priority queue.
The priority of the value to add.

Function.Name: ds_priority_change_priority
Function.Description: This function will take a given value and change its priority within the referenced priority queue.
Function.Parameter: The id of the priority queue to change.
The value to change the priority of.
The new priority of the value.

Function.Name: ds_priority_clear
Function.Description: With this function you can clear all data from the given priority queue data structure. This does NOT destroy the data structure (for that you should use ds_priority_destroy()) it only wipes all data from it and returns an empty priority queue.
Function.Parameter: The id of the data structure to clear.

Function.Name: ds_priority_copy
Function.Description:
This function can be used to copy the contents of one priority queue into another.
Note that this does NOT remove the contents from the original priority queue, nor does it destroy the original priority queue.
Function.Parameter: The id of the priority queue to copy to.
The id of the priority queue to copy from.

Function.Name: ds_priority_create
Function.Description: This function will create a new priority queue data structure and return the index value. This value should be stored in a variable and used in all further function calls relating to the priority queue.

Function.Name: ds_priority_delete_max
Function.Description: This function will return the value that has the highest priority in the queue and then remove the value (and priority) from the data structure. If more than one value has the same priority, then any one of them could be returned in any order, but all other values with the same priority will still be in the queue.
Function.Parameter: The id of the priority queue to use.

Function.Name: ds_priority_delete_min
Function.Description: This function will return the value that has the lowest priority in the queue and then remove the value (and priority) from the data structure. If more than one value has the same priority, then any one of them could be returned in any order, but all other values with the same priority will still be in the queue.
Function.Parameter: The id of the priority queue to use.

Function.Name: ds_priority_delete_value
Function.Description: This function will simply delete the given value, along with its priority, from the indexed priority queue.
Function.Parameter: The id of the priority queue to use.
The value to delete from the priority queue.

Function.Name: ds_priority_destroy
Function.Description: This function will remove the given priority queue data structure from memory, freeing up the resources it was using and removing all values that it contained. This function should always be used when you are finished using the DS priority queue to prevent memory leaks that can slow down and crash your game.
Function.Parameter: The id of the data structure to remove.

Function.Name: ds_priority_empty
Function.Description: With this function you can check the given DS priority queue to see if it is empty (returns true) or not (returns false).
Function.Parameter: The id of the data structure to check.

Function.Name: ds_priority_find_max
Function.Description: With this function you can find the value stored in the priority queue with the highest priority, and if more than one value has the same priority then any one of them could be returned in any order. However, unlike ds_priority_delete_max(), this function will not remove the value from the queue.
Function.Parameter: The id of the priority queue to use.

Function.Name: ds_priority_find_min
Function.Description: With this function you can find the value stored in the priority queue with the lowest priority, and if more than one value has the same priority then any one of them could be returned in any order. However, unlike ds_priority_delete_min(), this function will not remove the value from the queue.
Function.Parameter: The id of the priority queue to use.

Function.Name: ds_priority_find_priority
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the priority of any given value. If the value does not exist in the priority queue then undefined will be returned.
Function.Parameter: The id of the priority queue to use.
The value to find the priority of.

Function.Name: ds_priority_read
Function.Description: With this function you can recreate a saved DS priority queue (one that has previously been written as a string using ds_priority_write()). You must first create a new DS priority to read the string into, and if the DS priority already exists and has information stored in it, then this will be cleared before reading.
Function.Parameter: The id of the data structure to write.
The string to write from.
Can be either true or false or omitted completely.

Function.Name: ds_priority_size
Function.Description: This function will return the "size" of the priority queue, i.e.: the number of items that have been prioritized in it.
Function.Parameter: The id of the data structure to check.

Function.Name: ds_priority_write
Function.Description: This function returns a string which can then be stored or transferred to another data structure using the ds_priority_read() function.
Function.Parameter: The id of the data structure to check.

Function.Name: ds_queue_clear
Function.Description: With this function you can clear all data from the given queue data structure. This does NOT destroy the data structure (for that you should use ds_queue_destroy()), it only wipes all data from it and returns an empty queue.
Function.Parameter: The id of the data structure to clear.

Function.Name: ds_queue_copy
Function.Description: This function can be used to copy the contents of one queue into another. Note that this does NOT remove the contents from the original queue, nor does it destroy the original queue. When using this function the queue being copied to must have been previously created and if it contained any items before the copy, then these will be cleared first (meaning this information will be lost).
Function.Parameter: The id of the NEW queue.
The ORIGINAL queue to copy to id.

Function.Name: ds_queue_create
Function.Description: This function will create a new queue data structure and return the index value.

Function.Name: ds_queue_dequeue
Function.Description: This function will dequeue the head value off of the DS queue, removing it from the queue and returning the value to be stored in a variable. If the queue is empty then the function will return the constant undefined, otherwise it will return the real or string value contained in the queue.
Function.Parameter: The id of the queue to dequeue from.

Function.Name: ds_queue_destroy
Function.Description: This function will remove the given queue data structure from memory, freeing up the resources it was using and removing all values that it contained. This function should always be used when you are finished using the DS queue to prevent memory leaks that can slow down and crash your game.
Function.Parameter: The id of the data structure to remove.

Function.Name: ds_queue_empty
Function.Description: With this function you can check the given DS queue to see if it is empty (returns true) or not (returns false).
Function.Parameter: The id of the data structure to check.

Function.Name: ds_queue_enqueue
Function.Description: This function will add a value (real or string) onto the tail of the DS queue. The function can take a further 14 optional arguments (making a total of 15 possible additions), permitting you to add multiple values consecutively to the tail of the queue in a single call.
Function.Parameter: The id of the queue to add to.
The value to add to the queue.

Function.Name: ds_queue_head
Function.Description: This function will only read the first value of the queue (that which is "at the head").
