It does not reset or remove the particle types themselves, just their visual representation, and if you have any object streaming particles from an emitter, these particles disappear but will begin to appear again the next step after calling this code.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle system.

Function.Name: part_particles_count
Function.Description: With this function you can check to see if a particle system currently has any particles created in the room, and it will return the number of them too.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle system.

Function.Name: part_particles_create
Function.Description: This function is ideal for those effects that do not require any of the functionality offered by particle emitters (for example, to create smoke from a missile, or a simple explosion effect) as it permits you to quickly and easily create particles at any position in the game room. Note that you must have created the particle system and the particle type previously for this function to be used.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle system.
The x coordinate of where to create the particles.
The y coordinate of where to create the particles.
The index (type) of the particles to be created.
The number of particles to create.

Function.Name: part_particles_create_colour
Function.Description: This function is ideal for those effects that do not require any of the functionality offered by particle emitters (for example, to create smoke from a missile, or a simple explosion effect) as it permits you to quickly and easily create particles at any position in the game room.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle system.
The x coordinate of where to create the particles.
The y coordinate of where to create the particles.
The index (type) of the particles to be created.
The colour blending for the particles.
The number of particles to create.

Function.Name: part_particles_burst
Function.Description: This function allows you to burst all particles defined in a particle system asset at any position in the room.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle system.
The x coordinate of where to burst the particles.
The y coordinate of where to burst the particles.
The particle system asset to burst.

Function.Name: part_system_automatic_draw
Function.Description: This function can be used to switch off the drawing of a particle system so that any updates done to the system (automatic or otherwise) will not be seen.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle system to change.
Whether automatic drawing is on (true) or not (false).

Function.Name: part_system_automatic_update
Function.Description: This function controls whether GameMaker should update the particle system automatically or not, and normally you would not need to use this function as the default value of true (automatic update is on) is what you wish to happen.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle system to change.
Whether automatic updating is on (true) or not (false).

Function.Name: part_system_clear
Function.Description: With this function you can clear the indexed system to its default state, removing all emitters and resetting the depth and position (if they had been changed).
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle system to clear.

Function.Name: particle_add
Function.Description: With this function you can create a new particle system assset from an info struct.
Function.Parameter: The info struct to create a new particle system asset from.

Function.Name: particle_delete
Function.Description: With this function you can delete a particle system asset.
Function.Parameter: The particle system asset to delete.

Function.Name: particle_exists
Function.Description: With this function you can check to see if a particle system asset with the given index exists or not.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle system asset to check for.

Function.Name: particle_get_info
Function.Description: This function is used to retrieve information for the given particle system asset or instance.
Function.Parameter: The particle system for which information should be retrieved.

Function.Name: part_system_create
Function.Description: This function is used to create a new particle system and will return a unique index number that should be stored and used in all further functions relating to that system. The system will be assigned a managed layer and will be set to have a depth of 0. Managed layers are not accessible to the user and used only for internal management when depth is used instead of layers. Normally you would use the function part_system_create_layer() instead of this one.
Function.Parameter: A particle system asset to create an instance of.

Function.Name: part_system_create_layer
Function.Description: This function will create a new particle system on a given layer.
Function.Parameter: The layer ID value or string to assign the particle system to (can be any layer type)
Flag the particle system as persistent (set to true) or not (set to false)
A particle system asset to create an instance of.

Function.Name: part_system_depth
Function.Description: With this function you can set the draw depth for the particle system, much the same as you can set the render depth of different layers within the room, where a low draw depth means that it will appear on top of all things drawn with a higher depth, and a high draw depth placing it below everything with a lower draw depth.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle system to change.
The depth at which to set the particle system.

Function.Name: part_system_destroy
Function.Description: With this function you can destroy a given particle system and remove it from memory.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle system to destroy.

Function.Name: part_system_update
Function.Description: This function will advance the given particle system one step in game time and can be used to simulate the particle system behaviour when automatic updating is off, or it can be used to advance a particle system to a specific point all in one step.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle system to update.

Function.Name: part_system_draw_order
Function.Description: With this function you can set the order in which particles in the given particle system are drawn when created on the screen, either old to new or new to old.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle system to change.
Whether old particles should be drawn behind newer ones (true) or vice versa (false).

Function.Name: part_system_exists
Function.Description: With this function you can check to see if the given particle system indexed exists in the game or not.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle system to check for.

Function.Name: part_system_get_layer
Function.Description: This function retrieves the layer handle for the given particle system.
Function.Parameter: The particle system ID value to get the layer ID of

Function.Name: part_system_layer
Function.Description: This function can be used to switch a particle system from its current layer to a new one.
Function.Parameter: The particle system ID
The new layer ID

Function.Name: part_system_global_space
Function.Description: This function can be used to enable global space particles. When enabled, particles keep their position and direction when the particle system is moved or rotated. This is by default disabled.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle system.
Enable (true) or disable (false) global space particles.

Function.Name: part_system_get_info
Function.Description: This function is used to retrieve information for the given particle system instance.
Function.Parameter: The particle system for which information should be retrieved.

Function.Name: part_system_color
Function.Description: This function can be used to change color and alpha with which the particle system is blended.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle system to change the color and alpha of.
The new color with which to blend the particle system. c_white is to display it normally.
The new alpha of the particle system (from 0 to 1 where 0 is transparent and 1 opaque).

Function.Name: part_system_colour
Function.Description: This function can be used to change colour and alpha with which the particle system is blended.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle system to change the colour and alpha of.
The new colour with which to blend the particle system. c_white is to display it normally.
The new alpha of the particle system (from 0 to 1 where 0 is transparent and 1 opaque).

Function.Name: part_system_position
Function.Description: With this function you can set the base position for the particle system relative to the (0, 0) position of the room, meaning that all further particle functions relating to this system will now be drawn relative to the new position.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle system to change.
The new x coordinate of the particle system.
The new y coordinate of the particle system.

Function.Name: part_system_angle
Function.Description: This function can be used to change the rotation of the particle system.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle system to change the rotation of.
The new rotation of the particle system in degrees.

Function.Name: part_type_alpha1
Function.Description: This function is used to set a particle type to have a single alpha value (transparency) for the total duration of the lifetime of each individual particle, and this can be from 0 (transparent) to 1 (opaque).
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The alpha of the particle.

Function.Name: part_type_alpha2
Function.Description: This function can be used to set an alpha value (transparency) gradient for each particle created of the given type. The first alpha is that which all particles will start with, and the second alpha is the one on with which the particle will end with, and a smooth gradient change will occur to the alpha over the particle's lifetime from one to the other. This can be from 0 (transparent) to 1 (opaque).
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The start alpha of the particle.
The end alpha of the particle.

Function.Name: part_type_alpha3
Function.Description: This function can be used to set a three alpha (transparency) value gradient for each particle created of the given type. The first alpha is that which all particles will start with, and the second alpha is the one that will be blended to half way through its lifetime and the third alpha is the one with which the particle will end with. A smooth gradient change will occur through the alphas over the particle's lifetime from one to the other.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The starting alpha of the particle.
The halfway point alpha of the particle.
The ending alpha of the particle.

Function.Name: part_type_blend
Function.Description: With this function you can make your particles be drawn with an additive blend mode (true) or not (false). Additive blending is a special blend mode that adds the luminosity values of each particle as they overlap, so that light colours will gradually get brighter (until they appear white) as they overlap, and dark colours become more and more transparent with black being almost invisible.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
Whether the particles should be blended additively (true) or normally (false).

Function.Name: part_type_clear
Function.Description: With this function you can "reset" a particle, returning all the values for each of the functions relating to the particle (life, colour, alpha, orientation, etc.) to their default values. Note that this function does not remove any particles currently visible in the room from the screen, for that you should be using part_particles_clear().
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to clear.

Function.Name: part_type_colour1
Function.Description: This function is used to set a particle type to be a single colour for the total duration of the lifetime of each individual particle.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The single colour to make the particle type.

Function.Name: part_type_colour2
Function.Description: This function can be used to set a two colour gradient for each particle created of the given type. The first colour is that which all particles will start with, and the second colour is the one on which the particle will end with, and a smooth gradient change will occur to the colour over the particle's lifetime from one colour to the other.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The colour the particle will start at.
The colour the particle will end at.

Function.Name: part_type_colour3
Function.Description: This function can be used to set a three colour gradient for each particle created of the given type. The first colour is that which all particles will start with, and the second colour is the one that will be blended to half way through its lifetime and the third colour is the one with which the particle will end with. A smooth gradient change will occur through the colours over the particle's lifetime from one colour to the other.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The colour the particle will start at.
The colour the particle will be halfway through its lifespan.
The colour the particle will end at.

Function.Name: part_type_colour_hsv
Function.Description: With this function you can set a hue, saturation and value range for all particles of the given type. In this way you can create particles of the same hue but different saturations, or of different hues but the same value (luminosity), etc. All values must be between 0 and 255.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The minimum the final colour's hue component can be.
The maximum the final colour's hue component can be.
The minimum the final colour's saturation component can be.
The maximum the final colour's saturation component can be.
The minimum the final colour's value component can be.
The maximum the final colour's value component can be.

Function.Name: part_type_colour_mix
Function.Description: With this function you can set the given particle type to be a random blend of two colours.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The first colour the blend will take from.
The second colour the blend will take from.

Function.Name: part_type_colour_rgb
Function.Description: With this function you can set the mix of red, green and blue colours for all particles created of the given type. All values must be between 0 and 255.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The minimum the final colour's red component can be.
The maximum the final colour's red component can be.
The minimum the final colour's green component can be.
The maximum the final colour's green component can be.
The minimum the final colour's blue component can be.
The maximum the final colour's blue component can be.

Function.Name: part_type_create
Function.Description: With this function you can create a new particle type and the return value should be stored in a variable for use in all subsequent particle functions.

Function.Name: part_type_death
Function.Description: This function can be used to make your particle burst another type of particle at the end of its lifetime.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.

The quantity of the new particle to create at the particle death. If a negative value, it will instead create a fraction chance one is created (e.g. -3 would mean that one is created every 3 or so steps).
The index of the particle type to create.

Function.Name: part_type_destroy
Function.Description: With this function you can remove the specified particle type from the game. When you use this function, all particles of the given type will disappear from the room and the particle itself is removed form memory, so this function should be used only when you no longer need the particle.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to destroy.

Function.Name: part_type_direction
Function.Description: This function is used to determine the direction of the particle when it is created and can also be used to make the particle increase or decrease its direction over its lifetime.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The minimum direction the particle can start at.
The maximum direction the particle can start at.
How much the particle direction should increase or decrease per step.
How much should randomly be added or subtracted from the particle's direction per step.

Function.Name: part_type_exists
Function.Description: With this function you can check to see if the given particle type indexed exists in the game or not. Note that if the variable being checked is an uninitialised variable (that a particle type would otherwise have its index assigned to) this will throw an error.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to check for.

Function.Name: part_type_gravity
Function.Description: This function will set the gravity that is to affect each particle of the given type that is created.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
Strength of the gravity.
The direction of the gravity.

Function.Name: part_type_life
Function.Description: This is the function that governs how long each individual particle of the indicated type remains on the screen. You provide a minimum and a maximum value (in steps)and each particle lifespan will be a random number of steps from within the specified range. To have all particles with the same lifetime, set the two values to be the same.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The minimum lifespan of the particles.
The maximum lifespan of the particles.

Function.Name: part_type_orientation
Function.Description: This function is used to determine the orientation of the particle sprite when it is created and can also be used to make the particle orientation increase or decrease over its lifetime. The minimum and maximum orientation values default at 0 but these values can be changed to randomise the orientation following the standard GameMaker directions of 0 degrees being right, 90 degrees being up, 180 degrees being left and 270 degrees being down. If you set them to the same value the particles will all be created with the same orientation.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The minimum starting angle of the particles.
The maximum starting angle of the particles.
The increase (or decrease if set negative) of the angle in degrees per step.
The amount the angle wiggles clockwise/counterclockwise per step.
Whether to set its angle relative to the direction of the particle's motion (true) or not (false).

Function.Name: part_type_scale
Function.Description: This function will set the horizontal and vertical scale of the particle before any other size changes are made. This function works on the ratio of the sprite size, so a value of 1 (the default value) is a 1:1 ratio, meaning that 0.5 would be half and 2 double.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The horizontal scaling of the base particle.
The vertical scaling of the base particle.

Function.Name: part_type_shape
Function.Description: With this function you can set the sprite shape to use for the particle type.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to set.
The shape to choose.

Function.Name: part_type_size
Function.Description: This function is used to determine the size of the particle when it is created and can also be used to make the particle increase or decrease in size over its lifetime.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The minimum size the particle can start at.
The maximum size the particle can start at.
How much the particle should increase or decrease per step.
How much should randomly be added or subtracted from the particles size per step.

Function.Name: part_type_size_x
Function.Description: This function is used to configure particle size similarly to part_type_size(), except only for the x axis. You can use function part_type_size_y() to configure the size on the y axis separately as well.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The minimum size the particle can start at on the x axis.
The maximum size the particle can start at on the x axis.
How much the particle should increase or decrease on the x axis per step.
How much should randomly be added or subtracted from the particles size on the x axis per step.

Function.Name: part_type_size_y
Function.Description: This function is used to configure particle size similarly to part_type_size(), except only for the y axis. You can use function part_type_size_x() to configure the size on the x axis separately as well.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The minimum size the particle can start at on the y axis.
The maximum size the particle can start at on the y axis.
How much the particle should increase or decrease on the y axis per step.
How much should randomly be added or subtracted from the particles size on the y axis per step.

Function.Name: part_type_speed
Function.Description: This function is used to set the movement speed of the particle when it is created and can also be used to make the particle increase or decrease its speed over its lifetime.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The minimum speed the particle can start at.
The maximum speed the particle can start at.
How much the particle speed should increase or decrease per step.
How much should randomly be added or subtracted from the particle's speed per step.

Function.Name: part_type_sprite
Function.Description: This function can be used to set a particle type to use a custom sprite from the game assets. You can choose a random sub-image so that if the sprite is not animated, a different image will be chosen at random to create the sprite, or if the particle is animated it will start the animation at a random point.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The index of the sprite to set the particle type to.
Whether to follow the sprite's animation normally (true) or not (false).
Whether to stretch the sprite's animation to match the particle lifespan (true) or not (false).
Whether to choose a random sub-image (true) or not (false).

Function.Name: part_type_subimage
Function.Description: This function can be used to set a particle type to use a custom sub-image (frame) of a sprite. If the particle's sprite is animated, then this sub-image will be used as the starting frame of the animation.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The sub-image (frame) of the sprite to use.

Function.Name: part_type_step
Function.Description: This function can be used to make your particle type stream another type each step until the end of its lifetime. A negative value for the step number will emit a particle with a one in "value" chance. For example, a value of -3 will have a 1:3 chance of emitting a particle each step.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The quantity of the new particle to create per step.
The index of the particle type to create.

Function.Name: draw_primitive_begin
Function.Description: This function starts drawing a primitive of the given type (this must be called before you can define any primitives).
Function.Parameter: The kind of primitive you are going to draw.

Function.Name: draw_primitive_begin_texture
Function.Description: This function starts drawing a textured primitive of the given type (this must be called before you define the vertices of the textured primitive).
Function.Parameter: The kind of primitive you are going to draw.
The texture to use with the primitive.

Function.Name: draw_primitive_end
Function.Description: This function ends the definition of a primitive and effectively draws it.

Function.Name: draw_vertex
Function.Description: This function defines the position of a vertex for a primitive.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the vertex.
The y coordinate of the vertex.

Function.Name: draw_vertex_colour
Function.Description: This function defines the position of a vertex for a primitive, with its own colour and alpha setting.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the vertex.
The y coordinate of the vertex.
The colour to draw this vertex with.
The alpha to draw this vertex with (0-1).

Function.Name: draw_vertex_texture
Function.Description: This function defines the position of a textured vertex for a primitive.

Function.Name: draw_vertex_texture_colour
Function.Description: This function defines the position of a textured vertex for a primitive.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the vertex.
The y coordinate of the vertex.
The x coordinate within the texture.
The y coordinate within the texture.
The colour to blend with the texture at this vertex (-1 or c_white for no blending).
The alpha to draw this vertex with (0-1).

Function.Name: vertex_argb
Function.Description: This function will set the ARGB values for the vertex currently being defined for the custom primitive.
Function.Parameter: The buffer to write the information to.
The ARGB value to set.

Function.Name: vertex_begin
Function.Description: This function starts the definition of a custom primitive.
Function.Parameter: The buffer to be written to.
The vertex format to use.

Function.Name: vertex_colour
Function.Description: If your defined vertex format takes a colour value you can use this function to add that data to the vertex being defined for the current primitive.
Function.Parameter: The buffer to write the information to.
The colour for this vertex (can be a constant or a hex value).
The alpha value for the vertex (from 0 to 1).

Function.Name: vertex_create_buffer
Function.Description: This function creates a new vertex buffer. This is a special grow buffer created by GameMaker which is pre-formatted for use when building primitives (for use with shaders, for example).

Function.Name: vertex_create_buffer_ext
Function.Description: This function creates a new vertex buffer and sets its initial size in bytes.
Function.Parameter: The initial size of the buffer (in bytes).

Function.Name: vertex_create_buffer_from_buffer
Function.Description: As with the function vertex_create_buffer(), this function will create a new vertex buffer, only now the vertex data it stores is copied from the regular buffer that is specified as the source.
Function.Parameter: The buffer to create the vertex buffer from.
The primitive vertex format to use.

Function.Name: vertex_create_buffer_from_buffer_ext
Function.Description: As with the function vertex_create_buffer(), this function will create a new vertex buffer, only now the vertex data it stores is copied from the regular buffer that is specified as the source. Note that if the number of vertices does not match those being copied you may get corrupted vertex data.
Function.Parameter: The buffer to create the vertex buffer from.
The primitive vertex format to use.
The offset within the the source buffer to copy from.
The number of vertices the buffer should have.

Function.Name: vertex_update_buffer_from_buffer
Function.Description: This function updates contents of a vertex buffer using data from a regular buffer. The vertex buffer must not be frozen!
Function.Parameter: The vertex buffer to copy to.
The offset (in bytes) within the vertex buffer to copy to.
The buffer to copy data from.
The offset (in bytes) within the buffer to copy from.
The size (in bytes) of data to be copied.

Function.Name: vertex_update_buffer_from_vertex
Function.Description: This function updates contents of a vertex buffer using contents of another vertex buffer. The vertex buffers must not be frozen!
Function.Parameter: The destination vertex buffer to copy to.
The index of the first vertex within the destination vertex buffer to copy to.
The source vertex buffer to copy vertices from.
The index of the first vertex to copy from the source vertex buffer.
The number of vertices to copy.

Function.Name: vertex_delete_buffer
Function.Description: This function can be used to remove a previously created vertex buffer (see vertex_create_buffer()) from system memory.
Function.Parameter: The buffer to be removed.

Function.Name: vertex_end
Function.Description: With this function you end the building of the custom primitive.
Function.Parameter: The buffer to end writing to.

Function.Name: vertex_float1
Function.Description: This function will add a floating point value to the vertex data. The vertex must have been formatted correctly to accept this using the vertex_format_add_custom() function.
Function.Parameter: The buffer to write the information to.
The input value.

Function.Name: vertex_float2
Function.Description: This function will add two floating point values to the vertex data. The vertex must have been formatted correctly to accept this using the vertex_format_add_custom() function.
Function.Parameter: The buffer to write the information to.
The first input value.
The second input value.

Function.Name: vertex_float3
Function.Description: This function will add three floating point values to the vertex data. The vertex must have been formatted correctly to accept this using the vertex_format_add_custom() function.
Function.Parameter: The buffer to write the information to.
The first input value.
The second input value.
The third input value.

Function.Name: vertex_float4
Function.Description: This function will add four floating point values to the vertex data. The vertex must have been formatted correctly to accept this using the vertex_format_add_custom() function.
Function.Parameter: The buffer to write the information to.
The first input value.
The second input value.
The third input value.
The fourth input value.

Function.Name: vertex_format_add_colour
Function.Description: Tell GameMaker to accept colour data as part of the new vertex format being created.

Function.Name: vertex_format_add_custom
Function.Description: This function permits you to use a custom data type for specific vertex format attributes as part of the new vertex format being created.
Function.Parameter: The data type that this custom vertex data will hold.
The use that the data will get.

Function.Name: vertex_format_add_normal
Function.Description: Tell GameMaker to accept surface normal data (nx, ny and nz) as part of the new vertex format being created.

Function.Name: vertex_format_add_position
Function.Description: Tell GameMaker to accept 2D positional data (x and y) as part of the new vertex format being created.

Function.Name: vertex_format_add_position_3d
Function.Description: Tell GameMaker to accept 3D positional data (x, y and z) as part of the new vertex format being created.

Function.Name: vertex_format_add_texcoord
Function.Description: Tell GameMaker to accept texture position data (u and v) as part of the new vertex format being created.

Function.Name: vertex_format_begin
Function.Description: This function starts the definition of a new vertex format.

Function.Name: vertex_format_delete
Function.Description: This function deletes the given vertex format and must be called whenever you are finished using any created vertex formats.

Function.Name: vertex_format_end
Function.Description: This function ends the vertex format that was started with vertex_format_begin() and returns it.

Function.Name: vertex_format_get_info
Function.Description: This function is used to retrieve information for the given vertex format.
Function.Parameter: The vertex format for which information should be retrieved.

Function.Name: vertex_format_exists
Function.Description: This function will check whether the given vertex format exists in memory or not. If it does, the function will return true, otherwise it will return false.

Function.Name: vertex_freeze
Function.Description: This function can be used to "freeze" a vertex buffer. This buffer becomes read-only, meaning that if you need to change it, you would have to delete the whole buffer and re-create it. A frozen buffer can be submitted to the shader faster than a normal, dynamic buffer and is recommended for those effects that require an unchanging custom primitive for the duration of a level or the game.
Function.Parameter: The buffer to freeze.

Function.Name: vertex_get_buffer_size
Function.Description: This function gets the size of the given vertex buffer in bytes.
Function.Parameter: The buffer to get the size of.

Function.Name: vertex_get_number
Function.Description: This function returns the number of vertices defined in the given vertex buffer.
Function.Parameter: The vertex buffer to check.

Function.Name: vertex_normal
Function.Description: This function will add surface normal data to the vertex currently being defined for the custom primitive.
Function.Parameter: The buffer to write the information to.
The x component of the surface normal.
The y component of the surface normal.
The z component of the surface normal.

Function.Name: vertex_position
Function.Description: This function will add 2D position data to the vertex currently being defined for the custom primitive.
Function.Parameter: The buffer to write the information to.
The x position.
The y position.

Function.Name: vertex_position_3d
Function.Description: This function will add 3D position data to the vertex currently being defined for the custom primitive.
Function.Parameter: The buffer to write the information to.
The x position.
The y position.
The z position.

Function.Name: vertex_submit
Function.Description: You can use this function to submit the contents of a vertex buffer to the graphics pipeline.
Function.Parameter: The buffer to use.
The primitive base type.
The texture to use (or -1 for no texture).

Function.Name: vertex_submit_ext
Function.Description: This function submits a range of vertices in the given vertex buffer to the graphics pipeline for drawing.
Function.Parameter: The buffer to use.
The primitive base type.
The texture to use (or -1 for no texture).
The index of the first vertex to submit. Must be a positive number.
Number of vertices to submit. Use -1 to submit all vertices after given offset.

Function.Name: vertex_texcoord
Function.Description: This function will set the texture coordinates to use for the vertex currently being defined for the custom primitive.
Function.Parameter: The buffer to write the information to.
The first texture coordinate to use (0 - 1).
The second texture coordinate to use (0 - 1).

Function.Name: vertex_ubyte4
Function.Description: This function will add four unsigned byte values (0 - 255) to the vertex data.
Function.Parameter: The buffer to write the information to.
The first input value.
The second input value.
The third input value.
The fourth input value.

Function.Name: vertex_buffer_exists
Function.Description: This function will check whether the given buffer exists in memory or not. If it does, the function will return true, otherwise it will return false.
Function.Parameter: The index of the buffer to check.

Function.Name: draw_enable_swf_aa
Function.Description: With this function you can enable or disable anti-aliasing (AA) for SWF format vector sprites.
Function.Parameter: Enable (true) or disable (false) AA for all SWF sprites.

Function.Name: draw_get_swf_aa_level
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the anti-aliasing (AA) level for SWF format vector sprites.

Function.Name: draw_self
Function.Description: This function draws the sprite assigned to the instance exactly as it would be drawn if the draw event held no code or actions, and will reflect and changes that have been made to the sprite variables in other events.

Function.Name: draw_set_swf_aa_level
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the anti-aliasing (AA) level for SWF format vector sprites. This can be a real value from 0 to 1 and will "smooth" the edges of these sprites. Note that to see this effect, you must first have enabled AA using the function draw_enable_swf_aa().
Function.Parameter: The anti-aliasing value to use from 0 to 1.

Function.Name: draw_enable_svg_aa
Function.Description: With this function you can enable or disable anti-aliasing (AA) for SVG format vector sprites. AA simply smooths the edges of vector images to give them a nicer look. The amount of AA used will depend on the value set using the function draw_set_svg_aa_level(). By default this is disabled.
Function.Parameter: Enable (true) or disable (false) AA for all SVG sprites.

Function.Name: draw_get_svg_aa_level
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the anti-aliasing (AA) level for SVG format vector sprites. The return value will between 0 and 1 and shows how "smooth" the edges of these sprites will be drawn. You can set the AA level using the function draw_set_svg_aa_level().

Function.Name: draw_set_svg_aa_level
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the anti-aliasing (AA) level for SVG format vector sprites. This can be a real value from 0 to 1 and will "smooth" the edges of these sprites. Note that to see this effect, you must first have enabled AA using the function draw_enable_svg_aa().
Function.Parameter: The anti-aliasing value to use from 0 to 1.

Function.Name: vector_sprite_cache_limit
Function.Description: This function can be used to set the maximum size of the cache used to accelerate the drawing of SWF and SVG format vector sprites. This can be a value of 0 or greater. A value of 0 will disable the cache. Changing this value will reset the return value of vector_sprite_get_cache_max_used().
Function.Parameter: The cache size in bytes.

Function.Name: vector_sprite_cache_prune_fraction
Function.Description: This function sets what fraction of the SWF and SVG vector sprite cache is attempted to be cleared each frame. This can be a value between 0.0 and 1.0 (a value of 0.0 will disabled automatic pruning). This will only attempt to clear cache entries that are older than the number of frames specified by vector_sprite_cache_prune_age().
Function.Parameter: The fraction of the cache size to clear (a value between 0.0 and 1.0).

Function.Name: vector_sprite_cache_prune_age
Function.Description: This function sets how long entries in the SWF and SVG vector sprite cache must not have been used for before being deleted by the automatic pruning logic. This value is measured in frames and should be 0 or greater.
Function.Parameter: The number of frames a cache entry can be unused for before being considered for deletion.

Function.Name: vector_sprite_cache_get_limit
Function.Description: This function returns the current maximum size of the SWF and SVG vector sprite cache.

Function.Name: vector_sprite_cache_get_prune_fraction
Function.Description: This function returns the fraction of the SWF and SVG vector sprite cache that is attempted to be cleared each frame.

Function.Name: vector_sprite_cache_get_prune_age
Function.Description: This function returns the number of frames an entry in the SWF and SVG vector sprite cache can exist without being used before it is considered for deletion.

Function.Name: vector_sprite_cache_get_used
Function.Description: This function returns the current amount of memory used by the SWF and SVG vector sprite cache.

Function.Name: vector_sprite_cache_get_max_used
Function.Description: This function returns the maximum amount of memory which has been used by the SWF and SVG vector sprite cache. This value is reset if the cache size is changed by vector_sprite_get_cache_limit().

Function.Name: vector_sprite_cache_get_oldest_entry_age
Function.Description: This function returns how long ago the oldest entry in the SWF and SVG vector sprite cache was last used. This can be useful for determining if the cache is set to an appropriate size.

Function.Name: draw_sprite
Function.Description: This function draws the given sprite and sub-image at a position within the game room.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to draw.
The sub-image (frame) of the sprite to draw (image_index or -1 correlate to the current frame of animation in the object).
The x coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The y coordinate of where to draw the sprite.

Function.Name: draw_sprite_ext
Function.Description: This function will draw the given sprite as in the function draw_sprite() but with additional options to change the scale, blending, rotation and alpha of the sprite being drawn.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to draw.
The subimg (frame) of the sprite to draw (image_index or -1 correlate to the current frame of animation in the object).
The x coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The y coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The horizontal scaling of the sprite, as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The vertical scaling of the sprite as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The rotation of the sprite. 0=right way up, 90=rotated 90 degrees counter-clockwise, etc.
The colour with which to blend the sprite. c_white is to display it normally.
The alpha of the sprite (from 0 to 1 where 0 is transparent and 1 opaque).

Function.Name: draw_sprite_general
Function.Description: This function combines the function draw_sprite_ext() with the function draw_sprite_part(), adding in some additional blending options so that each corner of the final sprite part can be blended with an individual colour.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to draw.
The subimg (frame) of the sprite to draw (image_index or -1 correlate to the current frame of animation in the object).
The x position on the sprite of the top left corner of the area to draw.
The y position on the sprite of the top left corner of the area to draw.
The width of the area to draw.
The height of the area to draw.
The x coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The y coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The horizontal scaling of the sprite, as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The vertical scaling of the sprite, as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The rotation of the sprite. 0=normal, 90=turned 90 degrees counter-clockwise, etc.
The colour with which to blend the top left area of the sprite.
The colour with which to blend the top right area of the sprite.
The colour with which to blend the bottom right area of the sprite.
The colour with which to blend the bottom left area of the sprite.
The alpha of the sprite (from 0 to 1 where 0 is transparent and 1 opaque).

Function.Name: draw_sprite_part
Function.Description: With this function you can draw part of any sprite at a given position within the room.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to draw.
The subimg (frame) of the sprite to draw (image_index or -1 correlate to the current frame of animation in the object).
The x position on the sprite of the top left corner of the area to draw.
The y position on the sprite of the top left corner of the area to draw.
The width of the area to draw.
The height of the area to draw.
The x coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The y coordinate of where to draw the sprite.

Function.Name: draw_sprite_part_ext
Function.Description: This function will draw a part of the chosen sprite at the given position following the same rules as per draw_sprite_part(), only now you can scale the part, blend a colour with it, or change its alpha when drawing it to the screen (the same as when drawing a sprite with draw_sprite_ext()).
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to draw.
The subimg (frame) of the sprite to draw (image_index or -1 correlate to the current frame of animation in the object).
The x position on the sprite of the top left corner of the area to draw.
The y position on the sprite of the top left corner of the area to draw.
The width of the area to draw.
The height of the area to draw.
The x coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The y coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The horizontal scaling of the sprite, as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The vertical scaling of the sprite, as a multiplier: 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The colour with which to blend the sprite. c_white is to display it normally.
The alpha of the sprite (from 0 to 1 where 0 is transparent and 1 opaque).

Function.Name: draw_sprite_pos
Function.Description: With this function you can draw a sprite distorted over the area defined by the four corner coordinates.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to draw.
The subimg (frame) of the sprite to draw (image_index or -1 correlate to the current frame of animation in the object).
The first x coordinate.
The first y coordinate.
The second x coordinate.
The second y coordinate.
The third x coordinate.
The third y coordinate.
The fourth x coordinate.
The fourth y coordinate.
The alpha of the sprite (from 0 to 1 where 0 is transparent and 1 opaque).

Function.Name: draw_sprite_stretched
Function.Description: This function takes a sprite asset and stretches it over the given width and height so that it occupies that area.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to draw.
The subimg (frame) of the sprite to draw (image_index or -1 correlate to the current frame of animation in the object).
The x coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The y coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The width of the area the stretched sprite will occupy.
The height of the area the stretched sprite will occupy.

Function.Name: draw_sprite_stretched_ext
Function.Description: This function does exactly the same as the draw_sprite_stretched() function with the added ability to set the colour blending and alpha value for the sprite when it is drawn (similar to the function draw_sprite_ext()).
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to draw.
The subimg (frame) of the sprite to draw (image_index or -1 correlate to the current frame of animation in the object).
The x coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The y coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The width of the area the stretched sprite will occupy.
The height of the area the stretched sprite will occupy.
The colour with which to blend the sprite. c_white is to display it normally.
The alpha of the sprite (from 0 to 1 where 0 is transparent and 1 opaque).

Function.Name: draw_sprite_tiled
Function.Description: This function will take a sprite and then repeatedly tile it across the whole view (or room if no view is defined), starting from the coordinates that you give in the function. Tiling is based on the width and height of the sprite as defined by the sprite variables of the instance running the code. This function is for 2D (orthographic) projections only, and will not work correctly when a 3D camera projection is used.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to draw.
The subimg (frame) of the sprite to draw (image_index or -1 correlate to the current frame of animation in the object).
The x coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The y coordinate of where to draw the sprite.

Function.Name: draw_sprite_tiled_ext
Function.Description: This function will take a sprite and then repeatedly tile it across the whole view (or room if no view is defined), starting from the coordinates that you give in the function and with each tile scaled, colour blended and with the alpha that you define (these properties are the same as those used in draw_sprite_ext()). This function is for 2D (orthographic) projections only, and will not work correctly when a 3D camera projection is used.
Function.Parameter: The index of the sprite to draw.
The subimg (frame) of the sprite to draw (image_index or -1 correlate to the current frame of animation in the object).
The x coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The y coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The horizontal scaling of the sprite. A multiplier, where 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The vertical scaling of the sprite. A multiplier, where 1 = normal scaling, 0.5 is half, etc.
The colour with which to blend the sprite. c_white is to display it normally.
The alpha of the sprite (from 0 to 1 where 0 is transparent and 1 opaque).

Function.Name: draw_tile
Function.Description: With this function you can draw any given tile from a tile set - complete with rotations, flips and mirrors - setting the frame (if animated) and the position within the room.
Function.Parameter: The ID of the tile set to use
The tile data to use
The frame number for the animated tile to use (default 0 for non-animated tiles)
The x position within the room to draw at
The y position within the room to draw at

Function.Name: draw_tilemap
Function.Description: This function can be used to draw a given tilemap anywhere in the room.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the tilemap element to get the cell y position of
The x position within the room to draw at
The y position within the room to draw at

Function.Name: application_get_position
Function.Description: This function returns the position of the application surface in an array with four elements, where elements 0 and 1 are the (x, y) position of the top left-hand corner of the surface, and elements 2 and 3 are the x and y of the bottom right-hand corner of the surface, all relative to the size of the display or window.

Function.Name: application_surface_draw_enable
Function.Description: This function enables or disables the automatic drawing of the application surface.
Function.Parameter: The flag will be either true (enabled, the default value) or false (disabled).

Function.Name: application_surface_enable
Function.Description: This function enables or disables the application surface.
Function.Parameter: Set to enable (true) or disable (false) the application surface.

Function.Name: application_surface_is_enabled
Function.Description: This function will return true if the application surface is being used for drawing, or false if the screen buffer is being used.

Function.Name: application_surface_is_draw_enabled
Function.Description: This function will return true if the automatic draw of the application surface is enabled.

Function.Name: video_open
Function.Description: With this function you can open a video from the specified path or url.
Function.Parameter: Set the path or url to the video.

Function.Name: video_close
Function.Description: This function is used to close the video file and free up any memory associated with it.

Function.Name: video_set_volume
Function.Description: This function will set the volume for any video that you play.
Function.Parameter: The volume is a linear value from 0 to 1.

Function.Name: video_draw
Function.Description: This function will draw the currently selected video to surfaces which will then be used to draw the video.

Function.Name: video_pause
Function.Description: This function will pause the video.

Function.Name: video_resume
Function.Description: This function will resume the video.

Function.Name: video_enable_loop
Function.Description: This function will enable or disable the loop.
Function.Parameter: Set loop enable or disable.

Function.Name: video_seek_to
Function.Description: This function will move the position of the video in milliseconds.
Function.Parameter: Set the position in milliseconds.

Function.Name: video_get_duration
Function.Description: This function will return the duration of video in milliseconds.

Function.Name: video_get_position
Function.Description: This function will return the position of video in milliseconds.

Function.Name: video_get_status
Function.Description: This function will return the status of the video.

Function.Name: video_get_format
Function.Description: This function will return the format of the surface.

Function.Name: video_is_looping
Function.Description: This function will return true if loop is enabled.

Function.Name: video_get_volume
Function.Description: This function will return the volume of the video as a value between 0 and 1.

Function.Name: draw_surface
Function.Description: With this function you can draw a surface at a given position within the room, with the top-left corner of the image being drawn at the specified x/y position.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the surface to draw.
The x position of where to draw the surface.
The y position of where to draw the surface.

Function.Name: draw_surface_ext
Function.Description: This function will draw the given surface as in the function draw_surface() but with additional options to change the scale, blending, rotation and alpha of the surface being drawn.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the surface to draw.
The x position of where to draw the surface.
The y position of where to draw the surface.
The horizontal scale.
The vertical scale.
The rotation or angle to draw the surface.
The colour with which to blend the surface.
The alpha transparency for drawing the surface.

Function.Name: draw_surface_general
Function.Description: This function combines the function draw_surface_ext() with the function draw_surface_part(), adding in some additional blending options so that each corner of the final surface part can be blended with an individual colour.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the surface to draw.
The left position in the surface of the part to be drawn.
The top position in the surface of the part to be drawn.
The width of the part to be draw, from left.
The height of the part to be draw, from top.
The x position of where to draw the surface.
The y position of where to draw the surface.
The horizontal scaling to draw the surface with.
The vertical scaling to draw the surface with.
The rotation or angle to draw the surface with.
The colour of the top left corner of the surface.
The colour of the top right corner of the surface.
The colour of the bottom right corner of the surface.
The colour of the bottom left corner of the surface.
The alpha transparency to draw the surface with..

Function.Name: draw_surface_part
Function.Description: With this function you can draw part of any surface at a given position within the room. As with draw_surface() you can specify a surface, but you then need to specify the relative coordinates within the surface of an area to select for drawing. This means that a left position of 0 and a top position of 0 would be the top left corner of the surface and all further coordinates should be taken from that position.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the surface to draw.
The left position in the surface of the part to be drawn.
The top position in the surface of the part to be drawn.
The width of the part to be draw, from left.
The height of the part to be drawn, from top.
The x position of where to draw the surface.
The y position of where to draw the surface.

Function.Name: draw_surface_part_ext
Function.Description: This function will draw a part of the chosen surface at the given position following the same rules as per draw_surface_part(), only now you can scale the part, blend a colour with it, or change its alpha when drawing it to the screen (the same as when drawing a surface with draw_surface_ext()).
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the surface to draw.
The left position in the surface of the part to be drawn.
The top position in the surface of the part to be drawn.
The width of the part to be draw, from left.
The height of the part to be drawn, from top.
The x position of where to draw the surface.
The y position of where to draw the surface.
The horizontal scaling the part should be drawn with.
The vertical scaling the part should be drawn with.
The colour blending the part should be drawn with.
The alpha transparency the part should be drawn with.

Function.Name: draw_surface_stretched
Function.Description: This function simply takes a surface and stretches it over the given width and height so that it occupies the area. As with draw_surface() you can specify a surface and then the x / y position in the room for the surface to be drawn at and finally a width and a height (which must be pixel values).
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the surface to draw.
The x position of where to draw the surface.
The y position of where to draw the surface.
The width at which to draw the surface.
The height at which to draw the surface.

Function.Name: draw_surface_stretched_ext
Function.Description: This function does exactly the same as the draw_surface_stretched() function with the added ability to set the colour blending and alpha value for the surface when it is drawn (similar to the function draw_surface_ext()).
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the surface to draw.
The x position of where to draw the surface.
The y position of where to draw the surface.
The width at which to draw the surface.
The height at which to draw the surface.
The colour with which to colour the surface.
The alpha with which to blend the surface.

Function.Name: draw_surface_tiled
Function.Description: This function will take a surface and then repeatedly tile it across the whole room, starting from the coordinates that you give in the function.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the surface to draw.
The x position of where to draw the surface.
The y position of where to draw the surface.

Function.Name: draw_surface_tiled_ext
Function.Description: This function will take a surface and then repeatedly tile it across the whole room, starting from the coordinates that you give in the function and with each tile scaled, colour blended and with the alpha that you define (these properties are the same as those used in draw_surface_ext()).
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the surface to draw.
The x coordinate of where to draw the surface.
The y coordinate of where to draw the surface.
The horizontal scaling of the surface.
The vertical scaling of the surface.
The colour with which to blend the surface.
The alpha of the surface.

Function.Name: surface_copy
Function.Description: This function takes the image from one surface and copies it onto another one at the specified local position within that surface (where the (0, 0) position is the top left corner of the destination surface). If the destination surface already has information this will be overwritten by the copy, and the function does not change the source surface in any way.
Function.Parameter: The ID of the surface to copy the other surface to.
The x position to copy to.
The y position to copy to.
The ID of surface to be copied.

Function.Name: surface_copy_part
Function.Description: This function takes the image from one surface and copies part of it onto another one at the specified local position within that surface (where the (0, 0) position is the top left corner of the destination surface). You can specify a local x and y position to copy from as well as the width and height of the section. Please note that these are coordinates based on the surface size and not on the position at which the surface is being drawn in the room. If the destination surface already has information this will be overwritten by the copy, and the function does not change the source surface in any way.
Function.Parameter: The ID of the surface to copy the other surface to.
The x position to copy to.
The y position to copy to.
The ID of the surface to be copied.
The x position in the source surface to copy from.
The y position in the source surface to copy from.
The width of the area in the source surface to copy from.
The height of the area in the source surface to copy from.

Function.Name: surface_create
Function.Description: This function creates a new surface and returns it.
Function.Parameter: The width of the surface to be created.
The height of the surface to be created.
The format of the surface to be created.

Function.Name: surface_create_ext
Function.Description: This function allows you to attach a surface to a canvas element that already exists in your web page, meaning that you can effectively split up portions of your game to be drawn at various different places within the page.
Function.Parameter: The name of the canvas element to link the surface to.
The width of the surface to be created.
The height of the surface to be created.

Function.Name: surface_format_is_supported
Function.Description: This function is used to test whether the specified surface format is supported on the current platform.
Function.Parameter: The surface format to be tested.

Function.Name: surface_depth_disable
Function.Description: This function disables the automatic depth buffer generation for all surfaces that are created after it has been disabled. Normally all surfaces have depth buffers so if you draw 3D objects to them then it'll sort them properly by depth in order to maintain functional parity between rendering to surfaces and rendering to the back buffer. Note that for 2D games they aren't generally required.
Function.Parameter: If set to true the depth buffer will be disabled for created surfaces.

Function.Name: surface_exists
Function.Description: This function checks if a surface exists.
Function.Parameter: The ID of the surface to check.

Function.Name: surface_free
Function.Description: When you are working with surfaces, you should always use this function whenever you are finished using them.
Function.Parameter: The ID of the surface to be freed.

Function.Name: surface_getpixel
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the colour of a specific pixel from a surface, using the local coordinates of the surface where (0, 0) is the top-left corner.
Function.Parameter: The ID of the surface.
The x position on the surface from which to get the pixel.
The y position on the surface from which to get the pixel.

Function.Name: surface_getpixel_ext
Function.Description: With this function you can get the full ABGR 32bit value of any pixel of a (previously created) surface.
Function.Parameter: The ID of the surface to use.
The x coordinate of the pixel to check
The y coordinate of the pixel to check

Function.Name: surface_get_depth_disable
Function.Description: This function checks to see if the automatic depth buffer generation for surfaces is enabled.

Function.Name: surface_get_height
Function.Description: This function simply returns the height, in pixels, of the given surface.
Function.Parameter: The ID of the surface to get the height of.

Function.Name: surface_get_target
Function.Description: This function gets the surface that's currently set as the drawing target.

Function.Name: surface_get_target_depth
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the ID of the surface whose depth buffer is set as the current one.

Function.Name: surface_get_target_ext
Function.Description: This function will retrieve the surface ID assigned to one of the 4 render targets available to surfaces.
Function.Parameter: The render target index to check (from 0 to 3).

Function.Name: surface_get_texture
Function.Description: This function returns the texture for the surface's texture page. This value can then be used in other draw functions, particularly in general 3D and some of the 2D primitive functions.
Function.Parameter: The ID of the surface to get the texture of.

Function.Name: surface_get_texture_depth
Function.Description: This function returns the depth texture of the given surface or -1 if no depth texture exists.
Function.Parameter: The ID of the surface to get the depth buffer texture of.

Function.Name: surface_get_width
Function.Description: This function returns the width, in pixels, of the indexed surface.
Function.Parameter: The ID of the surface to get the width of.

Function.Name: surface_has_depth
Function.Description: This function returns whether the given surface has a depth buffer (and by relation, a stencil buffer, as depth buffer creation needs to be enabled for stencil buffers to also be created).
Function.Parameter: The ID of the surface to check.

Function.Name: surface_reset_target
Function.Description: This function resets all further drawing from the current surface back to the previous draw target.

Function.Name: surface_resize
Function.Description: This function will resize a surface to the given dimensions (in pixels).
Function.Parameter: The ID of the surface to change.
The width of the new surface.
The height of the new surface.

Function.Name: surface_save
Function.Description: This function will save a surface to disc using the given filename. The surface must be saved as a *.png format file.
Function.Parameter: The ID of the surface to set as the drawing target.
The name of the saved image file.

Function.Name: surface_save_part
Function.Description: This function will save a part of a surface to disc using the given filename. The surface must be saved as a *.png format file, and the (x, y) position must be given as local coordinates to the surface, bearing in mind that the top-left corner of the surface is always (0, 0).
Function.Parameter: The ID of the surface to set as the drawing target.
The name of the saved image file.
The starting x position within the surface.
The starting y position within the surface.
The width of the part to save.
The height of the part to save.

Function.Name: surface_set_target
Function.Description: This function sets all further drawing to the target surface rather than the screen. In this way you can tell GameMaker to only draw specific things to the specified surface.
Function.Parameter: The ID of the surface to set as the drawing target.
The ID of the surface whose depth buffer to use as the current depth buffer.

Function.Name: surface_set_target_ext
Function.Description: This function is for use with the Shader Functions and sets the MRT (0 - 3) for native level shaders (DX9, DX11, OpenGL).
Function.Parameter: The render target index to use (from 0 to 3).
The ID of the surface to use.

Function.Name: draw_get_font
Function.Description: This function will get the font currently assigned for drawing text, or an invalid handle (-1) if no font is set.

Function.Name: draw_get_halign
Function.Description: This function is used to get the text alignment setting along the horizontal axis.

Function.Name: draw_get_valign
Function.Description: This function is used to get the text alignment setting along the vertical axis.

Function.Name: draw_highscore
Function.Description: This simple function will draw the current list of internally stored high scores using the currently set font, colour and alpha values within the specified rectangle.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the left of the highscore rectangle.
The y coordinate of the top of the highscore rectangle.
The x coordinate of the right of the highscore rectangle.
The y coordinate of the bottom of the highscore rectangle.

Function.Name: draw_set_font
Function.Description: This function will set the font to be used for all further text drawing.
Function.Parameter: The name of the font to use.

Function.Name: draw_set_halign
Function.Description: This function is used to align text along the horizontal axis and changing the horizontal alignment will change the position and direction in which all further text is drawn with the default value being fa_left.
Function.Parameter: Horizontal alignment.

Function.Name: draw_set_valign
Function.Description: This function is used to align text along the vertical axis and changing the vertical alignment will change the position and direction in which all further text is drawn, with the default value being fa_top.
Function.Parameter: Vertical alignment.

Function.Name: draw_text
Function.Description: With this function you can draw any string at any position within the room (for drawing real numbers you should use the string() function to convert them into text).
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the drawn string.
The y coordinate of the drawn string.
The string to draw.

Function.Name: draw_text_colour
Function.Description: This function will draw text in a similar way to draw_text(), only now you can choose the colours to use for colouring the text as well as the alpha value, and these new values will be used instead of the base drawing colour and alpha.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the drawn string.
The y coordinate of the drawn string.
The string to draw.
The colour for the top left of the drawn text.
The colour for the top right of the drawn text.
The colour for the bottom right of the drawn text.
The colour for the bottom left of the drawn text.
The alpha for the text.

Function.Name: draw_text_ext
Function.Description: This function will draw text in a similar way to draw_text(), only now you can set the space between each line of text - should the text occupy more than one line - and limit the width (in pixels) of the string per line so that should any line exceed this value, GameMaker will automatically split the text to the next line at the nearest available white-space (if the text has no white-spaces then it will overrun this maximum width value).
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the drawn string.
The y coordinate of the drawn string.
The string to draw.
The distance in pixels between lines of text.
The maximum width in pixels of the string before a line break.

Function.Name: draw_text_ext_colour
Function.Description: This function is a combination of the base draw_text() function with the draw_text_ext() and draw_text_colour() functions, permitting you to define gradient colours for text as well as the line spacing and maximum width per line all together.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the drawn string.
The y coordinate of the drawn string.
The string to draw.
The distance in pixels between lines of text.
The maximum width in pixels of the string before a line break.
The colour for the top left of the drawn text.
The colour for the top right of the drawn text.
The colour for the bottom right of the drawn text.
The colour for the bottom left of the drawn text.
The alpha for the text.

Function.Name: draw_text_ext_transformed
Function.Description: This function is a combination of the base draw_text() function with the draw_text_ext() and draw_text_transformed() functions, permitting you to scale and rotate text while maintaining a specific line spacing and maximum width per line.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the drawn string.
The y coordinate of the drawn string.
The string to draw.
The distance in pixels between lines of text.
The maximum width in pixels of the string before a line break.
The horizontal scale.
The vertical scale.
The angle of the text.

Function.Name: draw_text_ext_transformed_colour
Function.Description: This function is a combination of the base draw_text() function with the draw_text_ext(), draw_text_transformed() and draw_text_colour() functions.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the drawn string.
The y coordinate of the drawn string.
The string to draw.
The distance in pixels between lines of text.
The maximum width in pixels of the string before a line break.
The horizontal scale.
The vertical scale.
The angle of the text.
The colour for the top left of the drawn text.
The colour for the top right of the drawn text.
The colour for the bottom right of the drawn text.
The colour for the bottom left of the drawn text.
The alpha for the text.

Function.Name: draw_text_transformed
Function.Description: This function will draw text in a similar way to draw_text(), only now you can choose to scale the text along the horizontal or vertical axis (effectively stretching or shrinking it) and also have GameMaker draw it at an angle (where 0 is normal and every degree over 0 rotates the text anti-clockwise).
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the drawn string.
The y coordinate of the drawn string.
The string to draw.
The horizontal scale (default 1).
The vertical scale(default 1).
The angle of the text.

Function.Name: draw_text_transformed_colour
Function.Description: This function is a combination of the base draw_text() function with the draw_text_transformed() and draw_text_colour() functions, permitting you to scale and rotate text as well as colour it with a gradient fill and change its alpha value, ignoring the base alpha and colour settings for drawing.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the drawn string.
The y coordinate of the drawn string.
The string to draw.
The horizontal scale.
The vertical scale.
The angle of the text.
The colour for the top left of the drawn text.
The colour for the top right of the drawn text.
The colour for the bottom right of the drawn text.
The colour for the bottom left of the drawn text.
The alpha for the text.

Function.Name: draw_texture_flush
Function.Description: With this function you can remove all textures from video memory, and they will then be reloaded on first use.

Function.Name: texturegroup_get_fonts
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the font index of each of the fonts assigned to texture pages within the given texture group.
Function.Parameter: The name of the texture group to check

Function.Name: texturegroup_get_sprites
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the sprite index of each of the sprites assigned to texture pages within the given texture group.
Function.Parameter: The name of the texture group to check

Function.Name: texturegroup_get_textures
Function.Description: This function can be used to retrieve the texture page IDs of the individual pages that make up a texture group.
Function.Parameter: The name of the texture group to check

Function.Name: texturegroup_get_tilesets
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the tileset index of each of the tilesets assigned to texture pages within the given texture group.
Function.Parameter: The name of the texture group to check

Function.Name: texturegroup_get_names
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the names of all the texturegroups contained in the game.

Function.Name: texturegroup_load
Function.Description: With this function you can load all the pages for the specified texture group.
Function.Parameter: The name of the texture group to load
Whether each texture in the group should be loaded into GPU memory (defaults to true)

Function.Name: texturegroup_add
Function.Description: Add a new texturegroup with name `groupname` that contains either single image file or an array of image files (the image files are any of the formats that `sprite_add` can accept). Assets will be created based on the description in the struct (or json string) in the last parameter. Buffers can be used in place of filenames, any buffer used should NOT be deleted until the texturegroup is deleted, the user is responsibile for deleting them after that.
Function.Parameter: The name of the texture group to add
filename or buffer reference for the image file to use or an array of filenames or buffer references for the images
description of how assets (sprites) are to be created from the image files

Function.Name: texturegroup_delete
Function.Description: Deletes a texturegroup with name `groupname`, only texturegroups created with texturegroup_add can be deleted.
Function.Parameter: The name of the texture group to add

Function.Name: texturegroup_unload
Function.Description: With this function you can unload all pages in the specified texture group.
Function.Parameter: The name of the texture group to unload

Function.Name: texturegroup_get_status
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the load status of the specified texture group.
Function.Parameter: The name of the texture group to check

Function.Name: texturegroup_set_mode
Function.Description: With this function you can configure how texture group loading is handled as well as set debug options
Function.Parameter: If false, indicates that texture pages are automatically loaded if a sprite is rendered from an unloaded texture group
If true, enables a debug view
Specifies default sprite which is used for drawing when a texture group hasn't been loaded

Function.Name: texturegroup_exists
Function.Description: With this function you can see whether a texture group with the specified name exists.
Function.Parameter: The name of the texture group to check

Function.Name: texture_debug_messages
Function.Description: This function can be used to enable or disable texture debug messages.
Function.Parameter: Enable or disable the texture debug messages

Function.Name: texture_flush
Function.Description: This function can be used to "flush" a texture page or a group of texture pages, i.e.: remove them from VRAM when no longer required.
Function.Parameter: The texture page ID (an integer) or a texture group ID

Function.Name: texture_get_height
Function.Description: Returns the height of the texture with the given id, which is always a value within the range 0 - 1.
Function.Parameter: The texture page asset pointer to use

Function.Name: texture_get_texel_height
Function.Description: This function returns the height of a single texel from the texture page of the image asset used.
Function.Parameter: The texture page asset pointer to use

Function.Name: texture_get_texel_width
Function.Description: This function returns the width of a single texel from the texture page of the image asset used.
Function.Parameter: The texture page asset pointer to use

Function.Name: texture_get_uvs
Function.Description: This function returns a 1D array with 4 elements representing the UV coordinates for the image on the texture page.
Function.Parameter: The image asset to get the texture from

Function.Name: texture_get_width
Function.Description: Returns the width of the texture with the given id, which is always a value within the range 0 - 1.
Function.Parameter: The texture page asset pointer to use

Function.Name: texture_global_scale
Function.Description: This function allows you to control the scaling of the texture pages on load from the WAD file that is part of your final game executable.
Function.Parameter: The scale factor to use (1, no scale, 2, half scale, 4, quarter scale, etc.)

Function.Name: texture_is_ready
Function.Description: This function can be used to check if a specific texture page has been unpacked and is ready for use, or if a group of texture pages have been unpacked and are ready for use.
Function.Parameter: The texture page ID (an integer) or a texture group ID

Function.Name: texture_prefetch
Function.Description: This function can be used to "prefetch" a texture page or a group of texture pages, i.e.: load them into VRAM when required.
Function.Parameter: The texture page ID (an integer) or a texture group ID

Function.Name: texture_set_stage
Function.Description: This function will set the given stage "slot" a texture to be used.
Function.Parameter: The texture "slot" to use.
The texture to use.

Function.Name: file_bin_close
Function.Description: Closes a previously opened binary file.
Function.Parameter: The ID of the file to close.

Function.Name: file_bin_open
Function.Description: This function will open the binary file with the indicated name.
Function.Parameter: The name of the file to read from.
the indicator of what can be done with the file.

Function.Name: file_bin_position
Function.Description: This function will return the current position in bytes of the file with the given file id, where 0 is the first position..
Function.Parameter: The ID of the file to get the position in.

Function.Name: file_bin_read_byte
Function.Description: This function will return a byte of data from the current position within the file with the given file ID.
Function.Parameter: The ID of the file to get the data from.
