Function.Description: This function will return the number of particles that are active in a single group.
Function.Parameter: The group index (ID) of the particle group to count.

Function.Name: physics_particle_group_delete
Function.Description: With this function you can delete (remove) a particle group from the physics simulation in the current room.
Function.Parameter: The index (ID) of the particle group to delete.

Function.Name: physics_particle_group_end
Function.Description: This function is used to end the definition of a particle group shape.

Function.Name: physics_particle_group_get_angle
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the rotation (angle) in the room of a group of particles.
Function.Parameter: The particle group to get.

Function.Name: physics_particle_group_get_ang_vel
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the angular velocity of a group of particles.
Function.Parameter: The particle group to get.

Function.Name: physics_particle_group_get_centre_x
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the x component of the center of mass of an entire group of particles.
Function.Parameter: The particle group to get.

Function.Name: physics_particle_group_get_centre_y
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the y component of the center of mass of an entire group of particles.
Function.Parameter: The particle group to get.

Function.Name: physics_particle_group_get_data
Function.Description: This function returns various pieces of information about a group of particles in the physics simulation using the given flags checked.
Function.Parameter: The group index (ID) of the particle group to get the data from.
The (previously created) buffer to use to store the data.
The flags to use to extract data about specific particle types.

Function.Name: physics_particle_group_get_inertia
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the inertia of an entire group of particles.
Function.Parameter: The particle group to get.

Function.Name: physics_particle_group_get_vel_x
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the horizontal velocity of a group of particles.
Function.Parameter: The particle group to get.

Function.Name: physics_particle_group_get_vel_y
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the vertical velocity of a group of particles.
Function.Parameter: The particle group to get.

Function.Name: physics_particle_group_get_x
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the x position in the room of a group of particles.
Function.Parameter: The particle group to get.

Function.Name: physics_particle_group_get_y
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the y position in the room of a group of particles.
Function.Parameter: The particle group to get.

Function.Name: physics_particle_group_join
Function.Description: With this function you can join two particle groups together, and the joined groups will then behave as if they were both part of a single entity.
Function.Parameter: The first particle group to join.
The second particle group to join.

Function.Name: physics_particle_group_polygon
Function.Description: This function will set the shape of the particle group that is being created to a polygon shape.

Function.Name: physics_particle_set_category_flags
Function.Description: With this function you can change the particle flags for a category of particles.
Function.Parameter: The particle category to set.
The flags to set on the particle.

Function.Name: physics_particle_set_damping
Function.Description: With this function you can set the linear damping of particles in the simulation.
Function.Parameter: The linear damping to be applied to the particle fixture.

Function.Name: physics_particle_set_density
Function.Description: With this function you can set the density of the particles in a physics simulation.
Function.Parameter: The density of the particle fixture.

Function.Name: physics_particle_set_flags
Function.Description: With this function you can change the particle flags for an individual particle.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle.
The flags to set on the particle.

Function.Name: physics_particle_set_gravity_scale
Function.Description: With this function you can set the gravity scale factor for particles in the physics simulation.
Function.Parameter: The scaling factor to be applied to gravity for all particles.

Function.Name: physics_particle_set_group_flags
Function.Description: With this function you can change the group flags for a group of particles.
Function.Parameter: The particle group to set.
The flags to set on the particle.

Function.Name: physics_particle_set_max_count
Function.Description: This function will set the total permitted number of particles in a physics simulation.
Function.Parameter: The maximum number of particles to permit.

Function.Name: physics_particle_set_radius
Function.Description: With this function you can set the radius (in pixels) for the particles in a physics simulation.
Function.Parameter: The radius (in pixels) of the particle fixture.

Function.Name: physics_draw_debug
Function.Description: This function debug-draws a visual representation of the current physics-enabled instance.

Function.Name: physics_pause_enable
Function.Description: This function sets whether the physics simulation should be paused or not.
Function.Parameter: This can be set to true to pause the simulation, or false to start it again.

Function.Name: physics_world_create
Function.Description: This function will associate a physics "world" with the room and all instances created in the room will behave using the physics that has been defined for them and the world itself.
Function.Parameter: defines the ratio of pixels on screen to metres in the real world. A ratio of 32:1 will be specified as 1/32 (or 0.03125).

Function.Name: physics_world_draw_debug
Function.Description: This function will draw a representation of the physics world system of the room.
Function.Parameter: The flag value for showing different debug features

Function.Name: physics_world_gravity
Function.Description: This function sets the gravity for the current physics world.
Function.Parameter: The x component of the gravity vector
The y component of the gravity vector

Function.Name: physics_world_update_iterations
Function.Description: This function sets the number of iterations per step that the physics system will perform.
Function.Parameter: the iterations (per step) that the physics system will perform

Function.Name: physics_world_update_speed
Function.Description: This function sets the number of times per second that the physics system updates.
Function.Parameter: the number of times per second that the physics system updates

Function.Name: ansi_char
Function.Description: This function returns a string containing the character with raw BYTE value set. This will not, and should not, be displayed, but it will save correctly to disk for use in encoding.
Function.Parameter: The raw byte value.

Function.Name: chr
Function.Description: This function returns a string containing the character which relates to the input Unicode code for displaying. This character depends on the current drawing font's character set code page and if no font is set, it will use the default code page for the machine.
Function.Parameter: The Unicode code value to get the string from

Function.Name: clipboard_get_text
Function.Description: This function will return a string of the text contained on the clipboard. If no text is stored it will return an empty string "".

Function.Name: clipboard_has_text
Function.Description: This function will return true if the clipboard contains text or false if it does not.

Function.Name: clipboard_set_text
Function.Description: This function will set the clipboard to hold the defined string. You can set it to an empty string "" to effectively clear the clipboard of text.
Function.Parameter: The text (as a string) to set the clipboard to hold.

Function.Name: ord
Function.Description: This function takes a single character input string and returns the Unicode (UTF-8) value for that character. When used with the keyboard_check* functions, the input string can only be one character in length and can only be a number from 0 to 9 or a capitalised Roman character from A to Z.
Function.Parameter: The string with which to find the Unicode code.

Function.Name: real
Function.Description: This function can be used to turn a given string into a real number. When using this function, numbers, minus signs, decimal points and exponential parts in the string are taken into account, while other characters (such as letters) will cause an error to be thrown. If a string has any other characters then you can use string_digits() to remove all non-numeric characters, before using this function to turn the resulting string into a real number.
Function.Parameter: The string to be converted to a real value.

Function.Name: string
Function.Description: With this function you can turn any value into a string. If the real number is an integer, it will be saved with no decimal places, otherwise, it will be saved with two decimal places. If you require more decimal places, then use the function string_format(). Also note that using this function on a variable storing an array, a data structure, or a struct will convert the contents of these variables into a string which can then be output to the console or saved to a file for debugging. You are also able to use a format string with "{x}" placeholders (i.e. {0},{1},...) where 'X' is the argument number after the format string (starting at 0).
Function.Parameter: The value to be turned into a string or a format string.
Values to replace the placeholders with.

Function.Name: string_byte_at
Function.Description: Returns the raw byte value as a real value at a given position in the given string.
Function.Parameter: The string to check.
The position to get the byte from.

Function.Name: string_byte_length
Function.Description: This function returns the number of bytes in a string, but you should note that due to their being held as UTF-8, this will not be equal to their string length.
Function.Parameter: The string to measure the number of bytes of.

Function.Name: string_char_at
Function.Description: You can use this function to return a specific character at a specific position within a string, with the index starting at 1 for the first character. If no character is found or the string is shorter than the given index value, an empty string "" is returned, however if the given index is equal to or smaller than 0, then the first character of the string is returned.
Function.Parameter: The string to check.
The position to get the character from.

Function.Name: string_copy
Function.Description: With this function you can easily select a number of characters from within a string to be copied to another one. The first character in a string is always indexed as 1 and not 0 as you may expect, so to copy (for example) the first five characters of string you would have string_copy(str, 1, 5).
Function.Parameter: The string to copy from.
The position of the first character in the string to copy from (numbered from 1)
The number of characters, starting from the position of the first, to copy

Function.Name: string_count
Function.Description: This function will return the number of times the given substring appears within a specific string.
Function.Parameter: The substring to check the string for.
The string to check.

Function.Name: string_delete
Function.Description: You can use this function to remove a specific part of a string. You supply the input string and the start and end position within that string to remove characters (index starts at 1) and the function will return a new string without that section in it.
Function.Parameter: The string to copy and delete from.
The position of the first character to remove.
The number of characters to remove.

Function.Name: string_digits
Function.Description: You can use this function to parse a given string and get any numbers from it.
Function.Parameter: The string to get the digits from.

Function.Name: string_format
Function.Description: Turns a real number into a string using your own formatting, where you can choose how many "places" are saved to the string and how many decimal places are saved also.
Function.Parameter: The real number to be turned into a string.
The total number of places of the main number to be shown. Spaces will be inserted to match this.
The number of decimal places to be included.

Function.Name: string_hash_to_newline
Function.Description: This function returns a string where the "#" symbol has been converted into a new line.
Function.Parameter: The string to convert over multiple lines

Function.Name: string_height
Function.Description: This function will return the height (in pixels) of the input string, taking into account the line separation and any line breaks the text may have.
Function.Parameter: The string to measure the height of.

Function.Name: string_height_ext
Function.Description: This function will return the height (in pixels) of the input string, taking into account the line separation and line break width (which is defined as the number of pixels that the string can occupy before a line break is inserted).
Function.Parameter: The string to measure the height of.
The distance in pixels between lines of text as if the string was being drawn.
The maximum width (in pixels) of the string before a line break as if the string was bring drawn.

Function.Name: string_insert
Function.Description: With this function you can create a new string made up of two strings, where one has been inserted into the other at a given position. Keep in mind when calculating the position to insert into that strings are indexed from 1, so the first character in a string is 1 and not 0 as you may expect.
Function.Parameter: The substring to be inserted.
The string to be copied.
The position in characters of the string to insert the substring.

Function.Name: string_last_pos
Function.Description: This function will return the character position of an instance of a substring within a string, searching from the end of the string to the beginning (so the reverse of string_pos()). The function will return 0 if the search string is not found, or the position of the first character of the search string if it is.
Function.Parameter: The substring to look for in the string.
The string.

Function.Name: string_last_pos_ext
Function.Description: This function will return the character position of an instance of a substring within a string, searching backwards through the string from the position given as the starting position. The function will return 0 if the search string is not found, or the position of the first character of the search string if it is.
Function.Parameter: The substring to look for in the string.
The string.
The starting position to search from.

Function.Name: string_length
Function.Description: This function returns the number of characters in a given string.
Function.Parameter: The string to measure the number of characters of.

Function.Name: string_letters
Function.Description: With this function you can remove all characters that are not classed as letters.
Function.Parameter: The string to convert to letters.

Function.Name: string_lettersdigits
Function.Description: This function will return a copy of a given string with everything but its letters and digits removed, which means it can be used to remove any unwanted characters (like "#" or "?") from, for example, a login name or a password.
Function.Parameter: The string to convert to letters and digits.

Function.Name: string_lower
Function.Description: With this function you can force a string to contain only lowercase characters.
Function.Parameter: The string to convert to lowercase.

Function.Name: string_ord_at
Function.Description: You can use this function to return a specific character code at a specific position within a string, with the index starting at 1 for the first character. If no character is found or the string is shorter than the value given to index, -1 is returned.
Function.Parameter: The string to check.
The position to get the character code from.

Function.Name: string_pos
Function.Description: This function will return the character position of an instance of a substring within a string, searching from the beginning of the string (to search from the end, use the function string_last_pos()). The function will return 0 if it's not found at all, or the position of the first character of the substring if it is found.
Function.Parameter: The substring to look for in the string.
The string.

Function.Name: string_pos_ext
Function.Description: This function will return the character position of an instance of a substring within a string, searching forwards through the string from the position given as the starting position. The function will return 0 if the search string is not found, or the position of the first character of the search string if it is.
Function.Parameter: The substring to look for in the string.
The string.
The starting position to search from.

Function.Name: string_repeat
Function.Description: This function simply returns the same string repeated a given number of times over itself.
Function.Parameter: The string to repeat.
The number of times to repeat the string.

Function.Name: string_replace
Function.Description: You can use this function to parse a string looking for a specific part, which can then be replaced by the new string that you have specified.
Function.Parameter: The string to be copied.
The substring within the string to be replaced.
The new substring to replace the previous one.

Function.Name: string_replace_all
Function.Description: You can use this function to parse a string looking for specific parts, which can then be replaced by the new string that you have specified in all places that they occur.
Function.Parameter: The string to be copied.
The substring within the string to be replaced in all instances.
The new substring to replace the previous one(s).

Function.Name: string_set_byte_at
Function.Description: This function sets a byte directly in a string (based on the UTF-8 format) and returns a copy of the string with the changes.
Function.Parameter: The string to change the byte of.
The position within the string (starting at 1) to change the byte of.
The new byte value.

Function.Name: string_upper
Function.Description: With this function you can force a string to contain only uppercase characters.
Function.Parameter: The string to convert to uppercase.

Function.Name: string_width
Function.Description: This function will return the width (in pixels) of the input string, taking into account any line breaks the text may have.
Function.Parameter: The string to measure the width of.

Function.Name: string_width_ext
Function.Description: This function will return the maximum width (in pixels) of the input string, taking into account the line separation and line break width (which is defined as the number of pixels that the string can occupy before a line break is inserted). Separation and width can be set to -1 to get the default spacing.
Function.Parameter: The string to measure the width of.
The distance in pixels between lines of text as if the string was being drawn.
The maximum width (in pixels) of the string before a line break as if the string was bring drawn.

Function.Name: string_ext
Function.Description: This function returns a new string using a format string with placeholder information and an array of values. The placeholders should follow the format "{x}" where x is the index of the value in the array that it should be replaced with.
Function.Parameter: The input string format.
An array of values to replace the placeholders.

Function.Name: string_trim_start
Function.Description: This function removes whitespace from the beginning of a string (left). You can optionally provide an array of strings to be used for trimming if you want to remove something other than whitespace.
Function.Parameter: The input string.
An array of strings to be used during trimming.

Function.Name: string_trim_end
Function.Description: This function removes whitespace from the end of a string (right). You can optionally provide an array of strings to be used for trimming if you want to remove something other than whitespace.
Function.Parameter: The input string.
An array of strings to be used during trimming.

Function.Name: string_trim
Function.Description: This function removes whitespace from both ends of a string and returns a new string, without modifying the original string. You can optionally provide an array of strings to be used for trimming if you want to remove something other than whitespaces.
Function.Parameter: The input string.
An array of strings to be used during trimming.

Function.Name: string_starts_with
Function.Description: This function determines whether a string begins with the characters of a specified string, returning true or false as appropriate.
Function.Parameter: The input string.
The string to check against.

Function.Name: string_ends_with
Function.Description: This function determines whether a string ends with the characters of a specified string, returning true or false as appropriate.
Function.Parameter: The input string.
The string to check against.

Function.Name: string_split
Function.Description: This function splits string into an ordered list of substrings by searching for the delimiter, puts these substrings into an array, and returns the array.
Function.Parameter: The input string.
The delimiter string to search for.
Removes empty entries from the output array.
The maximum number of splits that are allowed.

Function.Name: string_split_ext
Function.Description: This function splits string into an ordered list of substrings by searching from an array of delimiters, puts these substrings into an array, and returns the array.
Function.Parameter: The input string.
An array of delimiter strings to search for.
Removes empty entries from the output array.
The maximum number of splits that are allowed.

Function.Name: string_join
Function.Description: This function joins a set of arguments using the provided delimiter, non-string values will be converted to string.
Function.Parameter: The delimiter to use when joining the values.
The values be joined using the delimiter.

Function.Name: string_join_ext
Function.Description: This function joins the elements of an array using the provided delimiter, non-string values will be converted to string.
Function.Parameter: The delimiter to use when joining the values.
An array of values be joined using the delimiter.
The offset of the range (allows negative values, from end of string).
The number of elements to join (allows negative values, reverse traversing).

Function.Name: string_concat
Function.Description: This function concatenates a set of arguments, non-string values will be converted to string.
Function.Parameter: The values be concatenated.

Function.Name: string_concat_ext
Function.Description: This function concatenates a range of elements in an array, non-string values will be converted to string.
Function.Parameter: An array of values be concatenated.
The offset of the range (allows negative values, from end of string).
The number of elements to concatenate (allows negative values, reverse traversing).

Function.Name: string_foreach
Function.Description: This function iterates over each character of a string calling a provided function. Note that the start position is 1-based.
Function.Parameter: The string to iterate over.
A function to be called for each character in range (allows arguments 'char' and 'pos').
The position to start the iteration from (allows negative values, from end of string).
The number of iterations to execute (allows negative values, reverse traversing).

Function.Name: array_copy
Function.Description: With this function you can copy all or part of an array into another array at any position. If the data being copied exceeds the length of the destination array, the array will be extended to accept the data.
Function.Parameter: The array to copy to.
The index within the array to copy to.
The array to copy from.
The index with the array to start copying from.
The length (number of array indices) to copy.

Function.Name: array_create
Function.Description:
With this function you can create a 1D array of a given size.
Arrays created in this way will have each entry initialised to 0 unless you specify an (optional) initialisation value (which will have a greater performance overhead).
Function.Parameter: The size of the array to create.
The value to use to initialise all array indices (optional).

Function.Name: array_delete
Function.Description: With this function you can delete a value (or values) from an array at any given position.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The index (position) in the array to delete the value(s) from.
The number of values to delete.

Function.Name: array_equals
Function.Description: With this function you can check to see if two arrays are equal (equivalent or the same). Note that this is not the same as checking if two arrays are the same using ==, which will not check to see if the two arrays hold equivalent values, but only to see if the arrays are referencing the same initial array.
Function.Parameter: The index of the first array.
The index of the second array.

Function.Name: array_get
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the value from an index in an array. Note that if the array index given is out of bounds then the game will crash with an error.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The index of the array to get the value from.

Function.Name: array_insert
Function.Description: With this function you can insert a value (or values) into an array at any given position.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The index (position) in the array to insert the value(s)
The value to insert

Function.Name: array_length
Function.Description: With this function you can get the length (number of entries) of an array dimension. This function can also be used for multi-dimensional arrays, as long as you specify which dimension you want to get the length of when you supply the array index.
Function.Parameter: The index of the array to check.

Function.Name: array_pop
Function.Description: This function will remove the last element in the given array and return its value. If the array is empty undefined is returned.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.

Function.Name: array_push
Function.Description: With this function you can push a value (or values) onto the end of an array without having to know the length of the array.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The value (or values) to push onto the end of the array

Function.Name: array_resize
Function.Description: With this function you can resize an existing array dimension to a new size. Note that this function is designed for resizing an array down to a smaller length as you can resize up by simply setting a new index in the array. If you do use it to size up an array, any new indices will be set to the default value of 0.
Function.Parameter: The index of the array to resize.
The new size for the array (an integer, starting from 0).

Function.Name: array_set
Function.Description: With this function you can set the value of an index in an array to a value. This function can also be used for multi-dimensional arrays, as long as you specify which dimension you want to set when you supply the array index.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The index of the array to set the value for.
The value to set.

Function.Name: array_sort
Function.Description: With this function you can sort an array in ascending order or descending order or using a custom function to define the sort order.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The sort type (true for ascending or false for descending) or a function reference to use for sorting.

Function.Name: array_shift
Function.Description: This function will remove the first element in the given array and return its value. If the array is empty undefined is returned.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.

Function.Name: array_shuffle
Function.Description: With this function you can shuffle an array (or subsection), a new array is returned that is a copy of the original with the entries shuffled.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The offset to be used when shuffling the array. Negative values will count from the end of the array. Defaults to 0.
How many entries should be shuffled. Defaults to array_length() - 1.

Function.Name: array_shuffle_ext
Function.Description: With this function you can shuffle an array (or subsection) in place, nothing is returned.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The offset to be used when shuffling the array. Negative values will count from the end of the array. Defaults to 0.
How many entries should be shuffled. Negative values will traverse the array in reverse order. Defaults to array_length() - 1.

Function.Name: array_get_index
Function.Description: This function returns the first index at which a given element can be found in the array (or subsection). If the value is not found the function returns -1.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The value to search for.
The offset to be used when searching the array. Negative values will count from the end of the array. Defaults to 0.
How many entries should be searched. Negative values will traverse the array in reverse order. Defaults to array_length() - 1.

Function.Name: array_contains
Function.Description: Determines whether an array includes a certain value among its entries, returning true or false as appropriate.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The value to check inside the array.
The offset to be used when looking through the array. Negative values will count from the end of the array. Defaults to 0.
How many entries should be checked. Negative values will traverse the array in reverse order. Defaults to array_length() - 1.

Function.Name: array_contains_ext
Function.Description: Determines whether an array includes certain values among its entries, returning true or false as appropriate. The function doesn't account for order.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
An array of values to be search inside the provided array.
Whether the match should be complete of partial.
The offset to be used when looking through the array. Negative values will count from the end of the array. Defaults to 0.
How many entries should be checked. Negative values will traverse the array in reverse order. Defaults to array_length() - 1.

Function.Name: array_first
Function.Description: With this function you can return the first element of the array, or undefined if the array is empty.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.

Function.Name: array_last
Function.Description: With this function you can return the last element of the array, or undefined if the array is empty.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.

Function.Name: array_create_ext
Function.Description: With this function you can create an array of a given size, initialising each element with the provided function.
Function.Parameter: The size of the array to create.
The function to be used for element initialisation. Accepts the following arguments (index) and should return the init value of the element.

Function.Name: array_find_index
Function.Description: With this function you can find the index of the first element that returns true to the given predicate. This function allows a custom range definition and reverse order.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The function used to perform the search. Accepts the following arguments (value, index) and should return a boolean.
The offset to be used when executing the function. Negative values will count from the end of the array. Defaults to 0.
On how many entries should the function be executed. Negative values will traverse the array in reverse order. Defaults to array_length() - 1.

Function.Name: array_any
Function.Description: With this function you can check if any of the elements returns true to the given predicate. This function allows a custom range definition and reverse order.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The function used to perform the check. Accepts the following arguments (value, index) and should return a boolean.
The offset to be used when executing the function. Negative values will count from the end of the array. Defaults to 0.
On how many entries should the function be executed. Negative values will traverse the array in reverse order. Defaults to array_length() - 1.

Function.Name: array_all
Function.Description: With this function you can check if all of the elements return true to the given predicate. This function allows a custom range definition and reverse order.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The function used to perform the check. Accepts the following arguments (value, index) and should return a boolean.
The offset to be used when executing the function. Negative values will count from the end of the array. Defaults to 0.
On how many entries should the function be executed. Negative values will traverse the array in reverse order. Defaults to array_length() - 1.

Function.Name: array_foreach
Function.Description: With this function you can execute a method on all or a range of elements in the array. This function allows a custom range definition and reverse order.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The function to be executed for each array entry. Accepts the following arguments (value, index).
The offset to be used when executing the function. Negative values will count from the end of the array. Defaults to 0.
On how many entries should the function be executed. Negative values will traverse the array in reverse order. Defaults to array_length() - 1.

Function.Name: array_reduce
Function.Description: With this function you can traverse the array/range performing a cumulative operation on its elements. This function allows a custom range definition and reverse order.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The function to be executed for each array entry. Accepts the following arguments (prev, value, index) and should return a new 'prev'.
The initial value to be used for the previous element. Defaults to array[offset], if ommitted first iteration will be skipped.
The offset to be used when executing the function. Negative values will count from the end of the array. Defaults to 0.
On how many entries should the function be executed. Negative values will traverse the array in reverse order. Defaults to array_length() - 1.

Function.Name: array_copy_while
Function.Description: With this function you can create a new array from elements of the current array while the predicate is matched. This function allows a custom range definition and reverse order.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The function to be executed for each array entry. Accepts the following arguments (value, index) and should return a boolean.
The offset to be used when executing the function. Negative values will count from the end of the array. Defaults to 0.
On how many entries should the function be executed. Negative values will traverse the array in reverse order. Defaults to array_length() - 1.

Function.Name: array_filter
Function.Description: With this function you can create a new array with only the elements that return true to the given predicate. This function allows a custom range definition and reverse order.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The function to be executed as filter. Accepts the following arguments (value, index) and should return a boolean.
The offset to be used when executing the function. Negative values will count from the end of the array. Defaults to 0.
On how many entries should the function be executed. Negative values will traverse the array in reverse order. Defaults to array_length() - 1.

Function.Name: array_filter_ext
Function.Description: With this function you can mutate an existing array to filter the elements that return true to the given predicate. This function returns the number of filtered elements. The filtered elements will be padded to offset and order by the traversing direction. This function allows a custom range definition and reverse order.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The function to be executed as filter. Accepts the following arguments (value, index) and should return a boolean.
The offset to be used when executing the function. Negative values will count from the end of the array. Defaults to 0.
On how many entries should the function be executed. Negative values will traverse the array in reverse order. Defaults to array_length() - 1.

Function.Name: array_map
Function.Description: With this function you can create a new array by mapping the current array elements using the given predicate. This function allows a custom range definition and reverse order.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The function to be executed for mapping the values. Accepts the following arguments (value, index) and should return the mapped value.
The offset to be used when executing the function. Negative values will count from the end of the array. Defaults to 0.
On how many entries should the function be executed. Negative values will traverse the array in reverse order. Defaults to array_length() - 1.

Function.Name: array_map_ext
Function.Description: With this function you can mutate an existing array by mapping the element values using the given predicate. This function returns the number of mapped elements. The mapped elements will keep their original position on the array. This function allows a custom range definition and reverse order.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The function to be executed for mapping the values. Accepts the following arguments (value, index) and should return the mapped value.
The offset to be used when executing the function. Negative values will count from the end of the array. Defaults to 0.
On how many entries should the function be executed. Negative values will traverse the array in reverse order. Defaults to array_length() - 1.

Function.Name: array_unique
Function.Description: With this function you can create a new array with only unique values. This function allows a custom range definition and reverse order.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The offset to be used when executing the function. Negative values will count from the end of the array. Defaults to 0.
On how many entries should the function be executed. Negative values will traverse the array in reverse order. Defaults to array_length() - 1.

Function.Name: array_unique_ext
Function.Description: With this function you can mutate an existing array with only unique value. This function returns the number of unique elements. The mapped elements will be padded to offset and order by the traversing direction. This function allows a custom range definition and reverse order.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The offset to be used when executing the function. Negative values will count from the end of the array. Defaults to 0.
On how many entries should the function be executed. Negative values will traverse the array in reverse order. Defaults to array_length() - 1.

Function.Name: array_reverse
Function.Description: With this function you can create a new array with the elements in reverse order. This function allows a custom range definition.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The offset to be used when executing the function. Negative values will count from the end of the array. Defaults to 0.
On how many entries should the function be executed. Negative values will traverse the array in reverse order. Defaults to array_length() - 1.

Function.Name: array_reverse_ext
Function.Description: With this function you can mutate an existing array reversing the elements order. This function returns the number of reversed elements. This function allows a custom range definition.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the array.
The offset to be used when executing the function. Negative values will count from the end of the array. Defaults to 0.
On how many entries should the function be executed. Negative values will traverse the array in reverse order. Defaults to array_length() - 1.

Function.Name: array_concat
Function.Description: With this function you can concatenate two or more arrays into a single one.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the first array.
The variable that holds the nth array.

Function.Name: array_union
Function.Description: With this function you can join two or more arrays into a single one, removing the duplicates.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the first array.
The variable that holds the nth array.

Function.Name: array_intersection
Function.Description: With this function you can create an array of elements common to all the input arrays, removing duplicates.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the first array.
The variable that holds the nth array.

Function.Name: bool
Function.Description: This function will attempt to convert a given value into a boolean data type, where the value will be returned as true if it is greater than 0.5 and false otherwise.
Function.Parameter: The value to convert.

Function.Name: instanceof
Function.Description: This function can be used to get the name of the function that was used to create a struct when the struct was created using a constructor function and the new operator. The function will return either a string with the function name or undefined. Note that if you pass the function a struct literal it will simply return the string "struct". This function can also be used to check if a struct reference is a weak reference or not, in which case the function will return the string "weakref" instead of the name of the function that created the struct for more information, see the function weak_ref_create()).
Function.Parameter: The struct reference to use.

Function.Name: is_instanceof
Function.Description: This function returns whether the given struct is an "instance of" the given constructor. You can use this function to check if the constructor used to create your struct was the same one as you supplied in the second argument, or if it's a child constructor of your given constructor.
Function.Parameter: The struct reference to check.
The constructor reference to check against

Function.Name: static_get
Function.Description: Returns the static struct for the given struct or function / script, returns undefined if no static struct is set.
Function.Parameter: The struct or Function reference to use.

Function.Name: static_set
Function.Description: Sets the static struct on the given struct.
Function.Parameter: The struct reference to set.
The struct to set as the static

Function.Name: int64
Function.Description: This function will attempt to convert a given value into a 64bit integer, where the value must be either a real, a string, an int64, an int32, or a ptr. Anything else will cause the game to crash with an error message.
Function.Parameter: The value to convert.

Function.Name: is_array
Function.Description: This function can be used to check and see if a variable holds an array (true) or not (false).
Function.Parameter: The variable to check.

Function.Name: is_bool
Function.Description: This function returns whether a given variable is a boolean (true or false) or not.
Function.Parameter: The argument to check.

Function.Name: is_callable
Function.Description: This function returns whether a given variable can be called (either being a method or a valid function index).
Function.Parameter: The argument to check.

Function.Name: is_handle
Function.Description: This function returns whether a given variable is a handle that references an internal type.
Function.Parameter: The argument to check.

Function.Name: is_infinity
Function.Description: This function returns whether a given variable is infinity (an infinite number) or not, returning true if it is, and false if it is not.
Function.Parameter: The argument to check.

Function.Name: is_int32
Function.Description: This function returns whether a given variable is a 32bit integer or not.
Function.Parameter: The argument to check.

Function.Name: is_int64
Function.Description: This function returns whether a given variable is a 64bit integer or not.
Function.Parameter: The argument to check.

Function.Name: is_method
Function.Description: This function can be used to check and see if a variable is a method variable (true) or not (false).
Function.Parameter: The variable to check.

Function.Name: is_nan
Function.Description: This function returns whether a given variable is NaN (not a number) or not, returning true if it is, and false if it is not.
Function.Parameter: The argument to check.

Function.Name: is_numeric
Function.Description: This function returns whether a given variable is a numeric value (real, int32, int64 or boolean) or not.
Function.Parameter: The input to check.

Function.Name: is_ptr
Function.Description: This function returns whether a given variable is a pointer or not.
Function.Parameter: The argument to check.

Function.Name: is_real
Function.Description: This function returns whether a given variable is a real number (single, double or integer) or not.
Function.Parameter: The argument to check.

Function.Name: is_string
Function.Description: This function returns whether a given variable is a string or not.
Function.Parameter: The argument to check.

Function.Name: is_struct
Function.Description: This function checks if the supplied value is a struct.
Function.Parameter: The value to check.

Function.Name: is_undefined
Function.Description: This function checks whether a given value is equal to the value undefined or not.
Function.Parameter: The argument to check.

Function.Name: nameof
Function.Description: Returns the argument as a string, resolved at compile time.
Function.Parameter: The name to convert to string.

Function.Name: method
Function.Description: With this function you can bind any function that has previously been defined to a given instance or struct, creating a method variable that can be used later. The function will return a method which can be called from the variable it is assigned to. Note that you can bind built-in functions as well as user-defined functions, and you can also supply the special constant undefined as the instance/struct argument meaning that the current self scope will be used for the binding.
Function.Parameter: The unique reference or ID value of the struct or instance to use (or undefined for self)
The ID of the function to use

Function.Name: method_get_index
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the script index for the script where the method was defined. If the method was not defined in a script then the function will return -1, otherwise it will return the index value for the script.
Function.Parameter: The method variable to check

Function.Name: method_get_self
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve the instance ID or struct reference which is the self context used when the method is called. If the variable is not a method then the function will return undefined.
Function.Parameter: The method variable to check.

Function.Name: ptr
Function.Description: This function will attempt to convert a given value into a pointer data type, where the value must be either a real, a string, an int64, an int32, or a ptr; anything else will cause the game to crash with an error message.
Function.Parameter: The value to convert.

Function.Name: handle_parse
Function.Description:
This function will attempt to convert a string into a handle data type, to be used when a handle has been converted to a string and you want to convert it back.
Note: No validation is done on the value returned so it is not guaranteed to be valid.
Function.Parameter: The string to convert.

Function.Name: typeof
Function.Description: This function returns the data type of any given variable as a string.
Function.Parameter: The variable to get the data type of.

Function.Name: variable_clone
Function.Description: This function can accept any kind of data as its first parameter, which represents the variable or data structure to be cloned (won't work for instances). The second parameter, "depth" is applicable only for arrays and structs and sets the level of depth to which the cloning process should be performed (with a maximum value of 128).
Function.Parameter: The value to be cloned
The depth to be used during the cloning process (defaults to the maximum of 128)

Function.Name: variable_get_hash
Function.Description: With this function you can compute the hash of a given struct or instance member allowing for faster access (see struct_get_from_hash() and struct_set_from_hash()).
Function.Parameter: The name of the variable to compute the hash of

Function.Name: variable_global_exists
Function.Description: With this function you can check whether a global scope variable exists or not.
Function.Parameter: The name of the global variable to check for (as a string)

Function.Name: variable_global_get
Function.Description: With this function you can get the value from a given named global variable. The function will return the value held by the global variable or undefined if the variable does not exist.
Function.Parameter: The name of the global variable to get (as a string)

Function.Name: variable_global_set
Function.Description: With this function you can set the value of a given global variable. If the global variable does not exist already in the game it will be created and then assigned the value.
Function.Parameter: The name of the global variable to set (as a string)
The value to set the global variable to

Function.Name: variable_instance_exists
Function.Description: With this function you can check whether an instance scope variable exists or not.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the instance to check
The name of the variable to check for (as a string)

Function.Name: variable_instance_get
Function.Description: With this function you can get the value from a given named variable. The function will return the value held by the variable, or undefined if the variable does not exist.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the instance to use
The name of the variable to get (as a string)

Function.Name: variable_instance_get_names
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve an array populated with the instance variable names for an instance, or the global variables for a game. When you pass in an instance ID value, each entry in the array will be a string of the variable name that corresponds to an instance scope variable that has been created in the instance. However if you pass in the keyword global, each entry in the array will be a string of the variable name that corresponds to a global scope variable.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the instance to check or the keyword global

Function.Name: variable_instance_names_count
Function.Description: With this function you can find the total number of variables defined for an instance. The function will return an integer value for the number of variables encountered, or -1 if no instance of the given ID exists.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the instance to check.

Function.Name: variable_instance_set
Function.Description: With this function you can set the value of a given variable in an instance. If the variable does not exist already in the instance it will be created and then assigned the value.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the instance to use
The name of the variable to set (as a string)
The value to set the variable to

Function.Name: variable_struct_exists
Function.Description: With this function you can check whether a variable exists within the given struct or not.
Function.Parameter: The struct reference to check
The name of the struct variable to check for (as a string)

Function.Name: variable_struct_get
Function.Description: With this function you can get the value from a given named variable within a struct. The function will return the value held by the variable or undefined if the named variable does not exist.
Function.Parameter: The struct reference to use
The name of the variable to get (as a string)

Function.Name: variable_struct_get_names
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve an array populated with the variable names from a struct.
Function.Parameter: The struct reference to check.

Function.Name: variable_struct_names_count
Function.Description: With this function you can find the total number of variables defined for a struct. The function will return an integer value for the number of variables encountered, or -1 if no struct of the given ID exists.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the struct to check.

Function.Name: variable_struct_remove
Function.Description: With this function you can remove a variable from a struct.
Function.Parameter: The struct reference to remove the variable from
The name of the variable to remove (as a string)

Function.Name: variable_struct_set
Function.Description: With this function you can set the value of a given variable in a struct. If the variable does not exist already in the struct it will be created and then assigned the value.
Function.Parameter: The struct reference to set
The name of the variable to set (as a string)
The value to set the variable to

Function.Name: struct_exists
Function.Description: With this function you can check whether a variable exists within the given struct or not.
Function.Parameter: The struct reference to check
The name of the struct variable to check for (as a string)

Function.Name: struct_exists_from_hash
Function.Description: With this function you can check whether a variable exists within the given struct or not.
Function.Parameter: The struct reference to check
The hash of the struct variable to check for

Function.Name: struct_foreach
Function.Description: With this function you can execute a method on all of the members in the struct.
Function.Parameter: The variable that holds the struct.
the function to execute on each member of the struct; the callback function can accept the following arguments - key and value (in this order).

Function.Name: struct_get
Function.Description: With this function you can get the value from a given named variable within a struct. The function will return the value held by the variable or undefined if the named variable does not exist.
Function.Parameter: The struct reference to use
The name of the variable to get

Function.Name: struct_get_from_hash
Function.Description: With this function you can get the value from a given named variable within a struct. The function will return the value held by the variable or undefined if the named variable does not exist.
Function.Parameter: The struct reference to use
The hash of the variable being accessed (returned from variable_get_hash())

Function.Name: struct_get_names
Function.Description: With this function you can retrieve an array populated with the variable names from a struct.
Function.Parameter: The struct reference to check.

Function.Name: struct_names_count
Function.Description: With this function you can find the total number of variables defined for a struct. The function will return an integer value for the number of variables encountered, or -1 if no struct of the given ID exists.
Function.Parameter: The unique ID value of the struct to check.

Function.Name: struct_remove
Function.Description: With this function you can remove a variable from a struct.
Function.Parameter: The struct reference to remove the variable from
The name of the variable to remove

Function.Name: struct_remove_from_hash
Function.Description: With this function you can remove a variable from a struct.
Function.Parameter: The struct reference to remove the variable from
The hash of the variable being removed (returned from 'variable_get_hash')

Function.Name: struct_set
Function.Description: With this function you can set the value of a given variable in a struct. If the variable does not exist already in the struct it will be created and then assigned the value.
Function.Parameter: The struct reference to set
The name of the variable to set
The value to set the variable to

Function.Name: struct_set_from_hash
Function.Description: With this function you can set the value of a given variable in a struct. If the variable does not exist already in the struct it will be created and then assigned the value.
Function.Parameter: The struct reference to set
The hash of the variable being set (returned from 'variable_get_hash')
The value to set the variable to

Function.Name: analytics_event
Function.Description: This function will send the specified text to the analytics provider that you have set up through the HTML5 Game Options. This function can be used to create a custom analytic to track something outside of the scope of the provider being used.
Function.Parameter: A string to send to the provider

Function.Name: analytics_event_ext
Function.Description: This function will send the specified text to the analytics provider that you have set up through the HTML5 Game Options. This function can be used to create a custom analytic to track something outside of the scope of the provider being used, and will also accept custom parameter/value pairs, where the parameter is a string and the value a real number. For Google Analytics, you can only add in one extra pair while Flurry will accept up to 7.
Function.Parameter: A string to send to the provider.
The parameter to send.
The value of the parameter (a real number).

Function.Name: browser_input_capture
Function.Description: With this function you can set whether the browser window should capture all input (set it to false) or whether the game should capture the input (set it to true). Note that this function is for use with the HTML5 module only.

Function.Name: clickable_add
Function.Description: With this function you can create a custom, clickable, icon that acts as a "button" outside of the game canvas, but within the browser window itself. This function is very useful to prevent the browser creating a pop-up window when clicking on the button as it is all done through GameMaker itself.
Function.Parameter: The x position within the window.
The y position within the window.
The texture page entry for the sprite to be used.
The URL (website address) to link to, or the script to be run.
This is the target area to open the URL in.
The various parameters for the icon.

Function.Name: clickable_add_ext
Function.Description: With this function you can create a custom, clickable, icon that acts as a "button" outside of the game canvas, but within the browser window itself. This function is very useful to prevent the browser creating a pop-up window when clicking on the button as it is all done through GameMaker itself.
Function.Parameter: The x position within the window.
The y position within the window.
The texture page entry for the sprite to be used.
The URL (website address) to link to, or the script to be run.
This is the target area to open the URL in.
The various parameters for the icon.
The image alpha of the icon (default 1).
The scale of the icon (default 1).

Function.Name: clickable_change
Function.Description: With this function you can change the sprite and position of a clickable icon previously created with clickable_add(). Please note that the position is based on the window, not the canvas, (0, 0) position and that the sprite must be referenced directly from the texture page (see: sprite_get_tpe()).
Function.Parameter: The index of the clickable icon to change.
The texture page entry for the sprite to be used.
The new x position within the window.
The new y position within the window.

Function.Name: clickable_change_ext
Function.Description: With this function you can change the sprite and position of a clickable icon previously created with clickable_add(). Bear in mind that the position is based on the window, not the canvas, (0, 0) position and that the sprite must be referenced directly from the texture page (see: sprite_get_tpe()).
Function.Parameter: The index of the clickable icon to change.
The texture page entry for the sprite to be used
The new x position within the window.
The new y position within the window.
The scale of the icon (default 1).
The image alpha of the icon (default 1).

Function.Name: clickable_delete
Function.Description: This function must be used to remove a clickable icon previously created with clickable_add() from the game window.
Function.Parameter: Index of the clickable icon to remove.

Function.Name: clickable_exists
Function.Description: This function returns whether a clickable DOM icon has been created with the specified index exists or not. Please note, that the value used for checking must have been initialised previously or else you will get an error causing GameMaker to close.
Function.Parameter: The index of the clickable to check.

Function.Name: clickable_set_style
Function.Description: This function lets you set the CSS style properties for the given button via the key/value pairs in the provided DS Map.
Function.Parameter: The index of the clickable icon to style.
The index of the DS Map to set the style from.

Function.Name: url_get_domain
Function.Description: You can use this to get the domain where your HTML5 game is being played.

Function.Name: url_open
Function.Description: This will open the specified URL on the browser of the chosen target device, or, if you are using the HTML5 module, in the currently open browser.
Function.Parameter: The URL (website address) to link to.

Function.Name: url_open_ext
Function.Description: This will open the specified URL on the browser of the chosen target device, or, if you are using the HTML5 module, in the currently open browser.
Function.Parameter: The URL (website address) to link to.
This is the target area to open the URL in.

Function.Name: url_open_full
Function.Description: This will open the specified URL on the browser of the chosen target device, or, if you are using the HTML5 module, in the currently open browser.
Function.Parameter: The URL (website address) to link to.
This is the target area to open the URL in.
Standard browser options.

Function.Name: randomize
Function.Description: This function sets the seed to a random value. Should you need to keep a consistent value over a number of runs of a game, you should be using random_set_seed().

Function.Name: dot_product_normalized
Function.Description: This function returns the normalized dot product of two 2D vectors specified as (x1, y1) and (x2, y2).
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the first vector.
The y coordinate of the first vector.
The x coordinate of the second vector.
The y coordinate of the second vector.

Function.Name: dot_product_3d_normalized
Function.Description: This function returns the normalized dot product of two 3D vectors, specified as (x1, y1, z1) and (x2, y2, z2).
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the first vector.
The y coordinate of the first vector.
The z coordinate of the first vector.
The x coordinate of the second vector.
The y coordinate of the second vector.
The z coordinate of the second vector.

Function.Name: draw_set_color
Function.Description: With this function you can set the base draw color for the game. This value will affect all further drawing where appropriate, including fonts, forms, primitives and 3D. If any of those assets are drawn with their own color value changed, this value will be ignored.
Function.Parameter: The color to set for drawing.

Function.Name: draw_get_color
Function.Description: This function returns the current draw color which is used for drawing forms, text, primitives and untextured 3D models. This can be set with the draw_set_color() function.

Function.Name: merge_color
Function.Description: With this function you can take two colors and then merge them together to make a new color. The amount of each of the component colors can be defined by changing the "amount" argument, where a value of 0 will return the first color (col1), a value of 1 will return the second color (col2) and a value in between will return the corresponding mix. For example, a value of 0.5 will mix the two colors equally.
Function.Parameter: The first color to merge
The second color to merge
How much of each color should be merged. For example, 0 will return col1, 1 will return col2, and 0.5 would return a merge of both colors equally.

Function.Name: make_color_rgb
Function.Description: This function creates a color based on the red, green and blue components.
Function.Parameter: The red component of the color
The green component of the color
The blue component of the color

Function.Name: make_color_hsv
Function.Description: This function creates a color based on the hue, saturation and value components.
Function.Parameter: The hue of the color
How saturated the color is
How dark the color is

Function.Name: color_get_red
Function.Description: This function returns the amount of red used to make the given color, with the value being between 0 and 255, where 0 is no red and 255 is all red.
Function.Parameter: The color to check

Function.Name: color_get_green
Function.Description: This function returns the amount of green used to make the given color, with the value being between 0 and 255, where 0 is no green and 255 is all green.
Function.Parameter: The color to check

Function.Name: color_get_blue
Function.Description: This function returns the amount of blue used to make the given color, with the value being between 0 and 255, where 0 is no blue and 255 is all blue.
Function.Parameter: The color to check

Function.Name: color_get_hue
Function.Description: This function will return the hue of the given color. This is the "pure" color tone which is part of the hue, saturation and value (luminosity) method for defining a color.
Function.Parameter: The color to check

Function.Name: color_get_saturation
Function.Description: This function will return the saturation of the given color. This is the amount of the color tone that is mixed into the final color and is part of the hue, saturation and value (luminosity) method for defining a color.
Function.Parameter: The color to check

Function.Name: color_get_value
Function.Description: This function will return the value (luminosity) of the given color. This is the amount of the "light" that is mixed into the final color and is part of the hue, saturation and value method for defining a color.
Function.Parameter: The color to check

Function.Name: draw_text_color
Function.Description: This function will draw text in a similar way to draw_text(), only now you can choose the colors to use for coloring the text as well as the alpha value, and these new values will be used instead of the base drawing color and alpha.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the drawn string.
The y coordinate of the drawn string.
The string to draw.
The color for the top left of the drawn text.
The color for the top right of the drawn text.
The color for the bottom right of the drawn text.
The color for the bottom left of the drawn text.
The alpha for the text.

Function.Name: draw_text_ext_color
Function.Description: This function is a combination of the base draw_text() function with the draw_text_ext() and draw_text_color() functions, permitting you to define gradient colors for text as well as the line spacing and maximum width per line all together.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the drawn string.
The y coordinate of the drawn string.
The string to draw.
The distance in pixels between lines of text.
The maximum width in pixels of the string before a line break.
The color for the top left of the drawn text.
The color for the top right of the drawn text.
The color for the bottom right of the drawn text.
The color for the bottom left of the drawn text.
The alpha for the text.

Function.Name: draw_text_transformed_color
Function.Description: This function is a combination of the base draw_text() function with the draw_text_transformed() and draw_text_color() functions, permitting you to scale and rotate text as well as color it with a gradient fill and change its alpha value, ignoring the base alpha and color settings for drawing.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the drawn string.
The y coordinate of the drawn string.
The string to draw.
The horizontal scale.
The vertical scale.
The angle of the text.
The color for the top left of the drawn text.
The color for the top right of the drawn text.
The color for the bottom right of the drawn text.
The color for the bottom left of the drawn text.
The alpha for the text.

Function.Name: draw_text_ext_transformed_color
Function.Description: This function is a combination of the base draw_text() function with the draw_text_ext(), draw_text_transformed() and draw_text_color() functions.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the drawn string.
The y coordinate of the drawn string.
The string to draw.
The distance in pixels between lines of text.
The maximum width in pixels of the string before a line break.
The horizontal scale.
The vertical scale.
The angle of the text.
The color for the top left of the drawn text.
The color for the top right of the drawn text.
The color for the bottom right of the drawn text.
The color for the bottom left of the drawn text.
The alpha for the text.

Function.Name: draw_point_color
Function.Description: With this function you can draw a single pixel anywhere on the screen with a color that you define.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the point.
The y coordinate of the point.
The color of the point.

Function.Name: draw_line_color
Function.Description: With this function you can draw a 1 pixel wide line with the color blended between color 1 at the first point and color 2 at the second point.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the start of the line.
The y coordinate of the start of the line.
The x coordinate of the end of the line.
The y coordinate of the end of the line.
The color of the start of the line.
The color of the end of the line.

Function.Name: draw_line_width_color
Function.Description: With this function you can draw a line of a specific width with the color blended between color 1 at the first point and color 2 at the second point.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the start of the line.
The y coordinate of the start of the line.
The x coordinate of the end of the line.
The y coordinate of the end of the line.
The width in pixels of the line.
The color of the start of the line.
The color of the end of the line.

Function.Name: draw_rectangle_color
Function.Description: With this function you can draw either an outline of a rectangle or a filled rectangle by defining an area where the (x1, y1) position is the top left corner and the (x2, y2) position is the bottom right corner.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the left of the rectangle.
The y coordinate of the top of the rectangle.
The x coordinate of the right of the rectangle.
The y coordinate of the bottom of the rectangle.
The color of the top left corner.
The color of the top right corner.
The color of the bottom right corner.
The color of the bottom left corner.
Whether the rectangle is an outline (true) or filled in (false).

Function.Name: draw_roundrect_color
Function.Description: With this function you can draw either an outline of a rounded rectangle or a filled rounded rectangle where the (x1, y1) position is the top left corner and the (x2, y2) position is the bottom right corner.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the left of the rounded rectangle.
The y coordinate of the top of the rounded rectangle.
The x coordinate of the right of the rounded rectangle.
The y coordinate of the bottom of the rounded rectangle.
The center color.
The outside edge color.
Whether the rectangle is an outline (true) or filled in (false).

Function.Name: draw_roundrect_color_ext
Function.Description: With this function you can draw either an outline of a rounded rectangle or a filled rounded rectangle where the (x1, y1) position is the top left corner and the (x2, y2) position is the bottom right corner.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the left of the rounded rectangle.
The y coordinate of the top of the rounded rectangle.
The x coordinate of the right of the rounded rectangle.
The y coordinate of the bottom of the rounded rectangle.
The radius of the curve along the x axis from the rectangle corners.
The radius of the curve along the y axis from the rectangle corners.
The center color.
The outside edge color.
Whether the rectangle is an outline (true) or filled in (false).

Function.Name: draw_triangle_color
Function.Description: With this function you can draw either an outline of a triangle or a filled triangle.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the triangle's first corner.
The y coordinate of the triangle's first corner.
The x coordinate of the triangle's second corner.
The y coordinate of the triangle's second corner.
The x coordinate of the triangle's third corner.
The y coordinate of the triangle's third corner.
The color of the first corner.
The color of the second corner.
The color of the third corner.
Whether the triangle is an outline (true) or filled in (false).

Function.Name: draw_circle_color
Function.Description: With this function you can draw either an outline of a circle or a filled circle, and if it is filled you can define the interior and exterior fill colors.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the center of the circle.
The y coordinate of the center of the circle.
The radius (distance from center to edge) of the circle in pixels.
The color at the center of the circle.
The color at the edge of the circle.
Whether the circle is an outline (true) or not (false). If true, col1 is irrelevant.

Function.Name: draw_ellipse_color
Function.Description: With this function you can draw either an outline of an ellipse or a filled ellipse by defining a rectangular area that will then have the ellipse created to fit.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the left of the ellipse.
The y coordinate of the top of the ellipse.
The x coordinate of the right of the ellipse.
The y coordinate of the bottom of the ellipse.
The color of the center.
The color of the edge.
Whether the ellipse is an outline (true) or filled in (false).

Function.Name: draw_vertex_color
Function.Description: This function defines the position of a vertex for a primitive, with its own color and alpha setting.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the vertex.
The y coordinate of the vertex.
The color to draw this vertex with.
The alpha to draw this vertex with (0-1).

Function.Name: font_cache_glyph
Function.Description: This function lets you pre-cache a character glyph from a font. If you don't pre-cache a character using this function, it's automatically cached before it's drawn for the first time.
Function.Parameter: The font to cache a character or glyph from
The index (or character code) of the glyph to cache (see ord()/string_ord_at())

Function.Name: draw_vertex_texture_color
Function.Description: This function defines the position of a textured vertex for a primitive.
Function.Parameter: The x coordinate of the vertex.
The y coordinate of the vertex.
The x coordinate within the texture.
The y coordinate within the texture.
The color to blend with the texture at this vertex (-1 or c_white for no blending).
The alpha to draw this vertex with (0-1).

Function.Name: display_get_gui_height
Function.Description: With this function you can get the height (in pixels) of the GUI as used in the Draw GUI Event.

Function.Name: window_set_color
Function.Description: This function can set the background color of the game window.
Function.Parameter: The color to set for the region.

Function.Name: window_get_color
Function.Description: This function returns the background color of the game window.

Function.Name: part_type_color1
Function.Description: This function is used to set a particle type to be a single color for the total duration of the lifetime of each individual particle.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The single color to make the particle type.

Function.Name: part_type_color2
Function.Description: This function can be used to set a two color gradient for each particle created of the given type. The first color is that which all particles will start with, and the second color is the one on which the particle will end with, and a smooth gradient change will occur to the color over the particle's lifetime from one color to the other.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The color the particle will start at.
The color the particle will end at.

Function.Name: part_type_color3
Function.Description: This function can be used to set a three color gradient for each particle created of the given type. The first color is that which all particles will start with, and the second color is the one that will be blended to half way through its lifetime and the third color is the one with which the particle will end with. A smooth gradient change will occur through the colors over the particle's lifetime from one color to the other.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The color the particle will start at.
The color the particle will be halfway through its lifespan.
The color the particle will end at.

Function.Name: part_type_color_mix
Function.Description: With this function you can set the given particle type to be a random blend of two colors.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The first color the blend will take from.
The second color the blend will take from.

Function.Name: part_type_color_rgb
Function.Description: With this function you can set the mix of red, green and blue colors for all particles created of the given type. All values must be between 0 and 255.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The minimum the final color's red component can be.
The maximum the final color's red component can be.
The minimum the final color's green component can be.
The maximum the final color's green component can be.
The minimum the final color's blue component can be.
The maximum the final color's blue component can be.

Function.Name: part_type_color_hsv
Function.Description: With this function you can set a hue, saturation and value range for all particles of the given type. In this way you can create particles of the same hue but different saturations, or of different hues but the same value (luminosity), etc. All values must be between 0 and 255.
Function.Parameter: The index of the particle type to change.
The minimum the final color's hue component can be.
The maximum the final color's hue component can be.
The minimum the final color's saturation component can be.
